Reviews.Content: I had to go online and gather more info to get it to work  and look the way I wanted. But it works fine for what I need it to do, mainly browse and read both kindle and and nook books. Works great.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet
Reviews.Author: Ian Feinleib "Ian F."
Reviews.Content: Fantastic piece of hardware. Upgraded to KitKat flawlessly. However, KitKat does not allow messaging.  If this a consideration, think twice before installing KitKat. Therefore, 4 stars to Google, 5 stars to ASUS.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: David G. Varghese
Reviews.Content: I think, especially for the price, this is the best tablet out on the market today. ASUS once again delivers an excellent, sturdy product. Would definitely recommend this product (but this is the older version, so you may want to take a look at the newer model).

Reviews.Title: Decent tablet.
Reviews.Author: Courtnichole
Reviews.Content: I have had no problems with this tablet. I would recommend this tablet to any one who wants a tablet.

Reviews.Title: one sweet device!
Reviews.Author: the_red_blue_blur
Reviews.Content: I purchased this device because my sister has have one for couple years and loves hers so I decided I want to get one. I have not been disappointed one bit. From all the apps I can Install to all my bluetooth devices I have connected to it. I can connect a printer to an imprint anything I want from the device. it is simply incredible. I have no complaints whatsoever in any manner with this and I would recommend this item to anyone who would like a good 7 inch tablet by their side. And are all kinds of new games out like deer hunter 2014, Iron Man 3, Real Racing 3 and a classic plants vs zombies 2. But is on one way you'll know if you like It. Try It out!!

Reviews.Title: Very Tablet. Much Usability. Wow.
Reviews.Author: Jason W. Bowden
Reviews.Content: I don't think ASUS is even aware of how usable and fun their simple tablet design is. Homework gets done faster thanks to this little thing being mounted beside my laptop, and I can use it for Google Hangouts while collaborating on college assignments and mobile game development. How I managed without this handy little thing is a mystery worth writing a novel about.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet! Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with my Nexus 7. It does almost every thing I want in a tablet. The one thing is is missing is a camera on the back side. It has a front-facing camera, but none on the other side. This might have been covered in the specs when buying the device, but I did not notice it. Again, still a great and affordable device. Really great for surfing the web when I want something meatier than my phone, but not as big as my laptop.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Google Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: diligent
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet for my 8 year-old so he would stop playing with my smart phone.  He loves it. The picture quality is great. The wi-fi connection a lot better than my nook color.  He watches netflix on it all of the time, so I figure the sound and speed is pretty good as well.  He has had it for one month and so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Excelente Tablet
Reviews.Author: Jorge S.
Reviews.Content: The only thing Asus and Google missed in this crear tableta os the SD card slot, besides that, I hace nmo complains...

Reviews.Title: boots up slow
Reviews.Author: S. gill "Lana"
Reviews.Content: Good product but it boots up rather slowly, I have 3 tablets (ASUS, Samsung, and Amazon Kindle {2nd gen}) this tablet is the most disappointing. Which i guess I shouldn't be surprised it is an Asus product. I made the mistake of buying one of their laptops. Suffice to say it does do what it's supposed to, when it isn't freezing or taking its sweet time. The touchscreen is very responsive, actually its too sensitive. The thing turns off for no reason. I would definitely not recommend the 2012 version.

Reviews.Title: 32GB Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: menace_shoes
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. I have the earlier version that I bought in July (slightly smaller and lighter in weight), and this one I bought for my boyfriend's Christmas gift. Colors are great, apps are unlimited, and it's exactly what he needed.My ONLY drawback, for me, would be that it's a little too heavy to read from comfortably, but he likes the solid feel of the weight.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: shas
Reviews.Content: tab came on time, usb cable had a little knick on it. but that didnt impede its functionality... tab works great, updates like a charm.. just missing the back cam, BUT.. still a great tab

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Katerina
Reviews.Content: I like it so much. Use it with WiFi now. Didn't get simcard yet but I'm sure it will be great as well. Not so big Nd not so small. Can take it anywhere with u. Easy to work with even if you new in it. Camera is OK. Not for professional users of course but enough to take good pictures right away

Reviews.Title: Best purchase for a 7 inch tablet for me
Reviews.Author: J. Ligon "JimL"
Reviews.Content: It got my kids off my back about buying an overpriced Apple product and I get to play long distance "Words With Friends" with my daughter as well a read my morning newspaper without having to throw all that paper away. As a bonus I can take my latest photos around to show my friends on a good sized screen instead of squinting at a phone.Though mine has no flash memory card slot, I purchased a very inexpensive OTG cable which allows me to use a portable flash card reader with no problems...instant storage.

Reviews.Title: Great Inexpensive Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: When I was tablet shopping I initially purchased a Samsung Tab 2.  I love my Samsung Galaxy S4 so I assumed I would love the tab 2 too.  Oh boy was a wrong!  I purchaed it over the Nexus 7 because the idea of expandable storage was appealing to me.  When I got it home I discovered that I couldn't move any apps or movies to the SD card.  I'm not sure if a software update has since corrected this  but not being able to move anything to the SD card at the time was a deal breaker for me since the internal storage was insuffifient.  I immediately returned the Samsung Tab and ordered a Google Nexus 7 in its place.  The 32GB of internal memory is more than enough to meet my needs AND the needs of my memory hogging gameing kids.I LOVE my Google Nexus 7 Tablet so much that I recently bought a second one!  This way the kids can play with one while I play with the other. :-)

Reviews.Title: Nexua 7 :)
Reviews.Author: Ramos
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet, runs smooth !! Highly recommended people just check the review and the internet A+ thanks Google

Reviews.Title: the best tablet you could buy for this price!
Reviews.Author: Enric
Reviews.Content: Still has a great performance for being the 2012 version. Works great with Android 4.4 Kit-Kat.It feels very confortable in your hands, and you don't have the feeling of holding a cheap tablet.If you have a budget of 200$ or less this is your tablet. I've been looking reviews of tablets under 200$ and comparing the pros and the cons before buying the nexus 7 2012, and after going crazy with too many reviews, I decided to choose this tablet for:High performance comparing it with similar price modelsBetter screen than other tablets with same priceMore RAMRAW Android version with direct google updatesDon't need a cheap rear cameraDon't need extra memory, I have enough with 32Gb

Reviews.Title: Google Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Raquel
Reviews.Content: This is a good tablet. it works well. I would like to get one for my son. My son loves to play with the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Very convenient and inexpensive tablet
Reviews.Author: Izoslav Lyubovskiy
Reviews.Content: Very convenient and inexpensive tablet. Looks nice. Good to hold. To him many useful applications. I use it at home and outside.

Reviews.Title: Good!!
Reviews.Author: Jessica Engel
Reviews.Content: Good piece of equipment, MY downfall is that I also own an iPad and I am so used to the iPad functions, it takes me a little while to get use to it.

Reviews.Title: Okay product, NOT okay support. Stick with a Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Adam Addison
Reviews.Content: 3 Stars only! The product is great but the support from ASUS is not. Product won't power on and instead of replacing it I have to return it for repair. I have tablets from both Amazon and Google. Amazon tablet trouble after 10 months, They said return it no question asked! Got my new one before I even shipped the old one ! 2days! I'm on day seven trying to return this tablet. Amazon 1 Google 1/2.

Reviews.Title: Very good for its price
Reviews.Author: Nathan Reyes
Reviews.Content: Only thing I don't like its the one speaker and the one camara. Feels very good, its fast, beautiful screen and battery is better than decent. I am very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Super user friendly and easy to carry
Reviews.Author: Michelle Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I ordered this and got it the very next day as I work overseas and needed it before I left. I got the 4G version because I wanted to be able to pop a SIM into it when I got back to Europe. I know for a fact it will work on SIM cards in the UK and in Russia. The tablet itself is super user friendly and the size is just right for carrying. The screen is one of the clearest models I've seen. My previous tablet was the Asus Transformer and I was happy with it, but was looking for something easier to carry around town and with SIM +wifi capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Worked for five minutes
Reviews.Author: Aaron Maldonado
Reviews.Content: It came working out of the Box.Fast forward three months and the product wont keep a charge for more than 3 hours, the mini USB slot is flimsy, and it takes about ten hours to actually charge.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: Buschchris1
Reviews.Content: Best value for the money. Has enough power to run games and do everything on the web. Has long battery life and works great for movies, netflix, as an E reader and music storage. Its slim and simple. Way better price and more power than the Kindle Fire. Dont waste money on an IPad that limits you and you have to pay for apps. This does everything and is the perfect size to fit in a back jean pocket. The next generation of this is even better.

Reviews.Title: great little tablet
Reviews.Author: Julie Becker
Reviews.Content: For the price, this tablet really does the trick.  I don't get what is so much better about the ipad mini that it would cost several times what this costs (since I primarily use it with wireless anyhow, and can use my iphone for gps and the like). I originally bought it to use on a vacation with the idea of giving it to one of the kids once the new ipad mini comes out, but I'm now thinking I'll just keep this because it's everything I need. I haven't tried reading books on it yet (kept my e-ink kindle just in case), but love having it in bed at night to catch up on email and watch movies. I've stopped using my TV!  The only issue I'm having, hence the 4 star, is that the charging cord doesn't seem to sit well in the device. It's a little hard to get in, and it doesn't seem to fit in tightly.  PS - I understand the ipad has longer battery life, but this isn't bad.

Reviews.Title: This version is the OLD Nexus 7 FIRST GENERATION
Reviews.Author: camisdad "camisdad"
Reviews.Content: Great product, but be aware that this is the first generation product, not the Nexus 7 2nd Gen with LTE.I can find the Nexus 7 2nd Gen without LTE on Amazon here: Google Nexus 7 Tablet (7-Inch, 32GB, Black) by ASUS (2013), but I cannot find the Nexus 7 2nd Gen with LTE on Amazon, it looks like you have to go to Google Play for it.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Charles John
Reviews.Content: Really great tablet no issues so far! It's easy to use and starts up in a few seconds. Runs everything I can think of and never slows down.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 GREAT TABLET
Reviews.Author: Clifford Law
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 is awesome! Great bang for your buck.  It blows tablets that are three times the price out of the water!!

Reviews.Title: Battery issues marred the experience
Reviews.Author: AlanH
Reviews.Content: Great seller, great product and service; but I am having battery problems just weeks into owning the item, and I use it lightly.  Can't day for certain it was a seller issue, but not happy, as it makes the device have limited usage for me.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7" tablet
Reviews.Author: Charles Schwab
Reviews.Content: Have had this tablet for over a month and love it. I use every day to do genealogy and play games.The only thing I don't like about it is the camera lens is in the front of tablet instead of the back. Makes taking pics awkward with trying to keep yourself out of the pic.  Need the camera lens on the back side of the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Gave it as a well-received gift
Reviews.Author: William R. Pratt "Bill Pratt"
Reviews.Content: I sent one to my niece-in-law and she says she absolutely loves it. Now my nephew wants one! Hang on, pal, Christmas is coming!

Reviews.Title: Great Devise
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I picked this up. It's been everything I wanted in a tablet and performed without error or problem.

Reviews.Title: very good for ingress.
Reviews.Author: Domingo A. Rodriguez S.
Reviews.Content: Very good gadget, very good price. Ingress players are rejoicing with this very economic and featureful device. Currently recommending it to all the agents I know. (it gives you an advantage over everyone else :) )

Reviews.Title: A very capable tablet.
Reviews.Author: Dominic
Reviews.Content: The performance is enough from this tablet to provide smooth browsing and game play. It easily out performs the Galaxy Tab 2 (7 inch). It feels very well put together, with a build quality you would expect from a higher priced tablet. The fact that it is from Google and receives all the Android updates before other devices is a pleasant perk.The only flaw I can find with this device is that it won't seem to receive .apk files via Bluetooth. However, there maybe some setting in the menu that I have overlooked. I can still transfer .apk files via the USB cable, so it is only a minor inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 Tablet Review
Reviews.Author: Gary E. Whelan
Reviews.Content: It is a great little tablet that is speedy with very good graphics at an outstanding price.  I have not found any significant downsides yet.

Reviews.Title: Love
Reviews.Author: sonya members
Reviews.Content: I love this it came in handie when I need to do Some work for my classes I Am great full

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet
Reviews.Author: I Durant
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband as a birthday gift and he loves it.  He fishes a lot and wanted something small enough for his tackle bag but powerful enough to check weather and fishing conditions on the remote lakes he frequents.  This is fitting the bill perfectly.  The screen size is large enough to make his sites readable, but not large enough to be cumbersome.

Reviews.Title: A Good Purchase
Reviews.Author: Maverick Espinoza
Reviews.Content: I like this product, its cheaper handy and helps me in my work as a teacherI would recommend this product to everyone in the educational environment because it helps maintain main documents at hand

Reviews.Title: Did not Work at all
Reviews.Author: BrokeMedStudent
Reviews.Content: This arrived from the seller in a labeled used like new condition but it would not power on. It would not charge. I don't know what happened to it from the time it left there warehouse, but by the time I got it I put it straight back into the return package. They did make the return really easy and headache free.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: R. Clayton "Alldayer"
Reviews.Content: I have a few other tablets and can safely say this is my favorite! It is so much more fun to use this than even my Ipad because it's easier to customize and looks very clean, crisp and sharp. Google just upgraded to Android 4.3 and with all the defaulted customization out of the application after upgrading, it is just amazing!!Solid performance and speed along with everything else. If you are thinking of getting a tablet, don't spend so much money on Apple tablets and live with old technology!

Reviews.Title: surprised
Reviews.Author: cw
Reviews.Content: My son was concerned with not having expandable sd slot but the 32GB still allowed him to have most of his music and 5 movies loaded for our vacation trip. And it still had plenty of space left for apps. Fast processor and great screen. Very happy with the choice and price.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Sarai Grant
Reviews.Content: So far it has been a great little tablet. Perfect size and processing speed. Youtube loads fast and doesn't lag a lot. Probably the only thing I dont like is the fact that it cant be added to my cell phone data plan so my son can play it on the go!

Reviews.Title: Love It...
Reviews.Author: Thomas G. Berger "TommyB78"
Reviews.Content: User friendly, fast, sleek and more memory too shake a stick it. I can't stop complimenting my Nexus. We have a Kindle Fire and an Ipad, but I love the Nexus it's a perfect tablet match for me. >.<

Reviews.Title: Way better than my thousand dollar ITurd...
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a gift for someone and this thing is great.  It does way more that my IPad and was a fraction of the price!!!Nice crisp screen and wonderful quality!!!

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: HAMEED YOUSEF M. TILEB
Reviews.Content: i love it the ASUS Nexus 7 (7-Inch, 32GB) Tablet .i have very very good time and its very nice tablet for use in you home and work

Reviews.Title: Pretty cool tablet
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful and efficient tablet, with stock Android OS. It's also supposed to be updated to Android version 4.3 soon.

Reviews.Title: Value for money
Reviews.Author: Dave Junia Lum
Reviews.Content: A great tablet that offers good value for money. Long battery life and a great price thanks to the new Nexus.

Reviews.Title: Freaking Awesome!!! No joke.. lol
Reviews.Author: Ruthie
Reviews.Content: I actually love this tablet!! I like the option of having more than one account. I love how it's a lightweight and 32GB for under $200!! I bought this almost a year ago...in November 2012. Still works amazing and never had to take it back to be fixed or updated. It's actually really cool! Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: It definitely had its issues but it was fun.
Reviews.Content: I got the Nexus 7 a year ago and for the first few months it worked great but then one day I went to turn it on and got a blackish static screen. I managed to get it to turn on long enough to restore it to factory settings. After that it worked for a while. About a 2 months or so ago I realized that every time I shut down my tablet it would not power up again because it would have no battery (It didn't matter that I would shut it down with 100% battery). This was annoying but I was able to deal with it. A month ago while we were on vacation I dropped my tablet on the concrete accidently. That night I played with my tablet and it worked fine. The next day when I got my tablet out it had a crack running along the front of the screen and the bottom half of the screen would not respond to touch. After seeing that it would cost 80-90 dollars to replace the screen and lcd I decided that it wasn't worth it. I would replace my tablet if I had the money because I know that it was probably my fault that it broke. Even though it had its issues I would happily get another Nexus 7 if I had the money because when my tablet was working I had a great time with it. It had good battery life, a bright screen, responded well to touch, and handled nicely. Also  early on,for no apparent reason my power cord  broke. I would still recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet
Reviews.Author: Kadzhibongo "Vsevolod"
Reviews.Content: It is amazing. Excellent tablet for a reasonable price. The higher resolution HD screen is great for reading and watching videos. Jelly Bean (4.1) is really good. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: top class tablet
Reviews.Author: Yiannis Socratous
Reviews.Content: The price is very good compared to other tablets. Size is excellent for its use, browsing, email, social networking and reading. For me this is not a replacement for my laptop but more of a supplement. Battery lasts very long. The cellular is a plus since I can use it when no WiFi, but keep an eye on your data plan, it uses more mbits than cellphone.

Reviews.Title: Excellent device
Reviews.Author: Gunnarman
Reviews.Content: I bought this recently and I am completely satisfied with it. The HD screen is gorgeous and I was amazed at how slick it moves on your fingertips. I thought the design looked boring when looking at it online but I think it looks great in person. The price is reasonable and I found reading to be very easy wit the ability to edit pages in an eBook and zoom in on text while using Google chrome. Chrome is also fantastic; it works just as well as it does on PCs. The only thing that bugs me a little is the fact that there's only one camera. Taking pictures of anything but yourself is difficult because of this. I seriously don't think its a big deal though. I'm just happy to have a camera.Overall, this is a beautiful device and everything about it satisfying to me. The screen is amazing, as well as the experience of watching shows and movies. The reading is great, the sound quality is great too. The apps are nice too. Basically everything is as it should be. I recommend it if you have the cash.

Reviews.Title: Nothing to dislike about.
Reviews.Author: Otulea T.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love it. Very fast and a lot of memory at 32g is fantastic. It has all of what I need from a mini tablet. An improved camera and back - mounted instead would be nice. But that would drive up the price on it.

Reviews.Title: love it and no problems so far
Reviews.Author: Goings
Reviews.Content: The Asus Nexus 7 is a great, convenient tablet. I have had no problems with it so far. The size makes it easy to carry around or fit in a pocket. It also fits nicely in one hand for use. The screen is crisp and clear. The battery life is good; I can get about 2 days of use before recharging. The app store is very versatile and offers a wide range of apps.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Tyler
Reviews.Content: Have a few issues, the speakers are weak hard to listen to movies or games . other than that very fast tablet and its just what my gf wanted

Reviews.Title: Love this thing.
Reviews.Author: stony
Reviews.Content: My first tablet and I wasn't sure if I would like the size.  Now I rarely use my laptop, the Nexus is all I need.

Reviews.Title: The Nexus is a great tool and source of entertainment
Reviews.Author: Sandra P. Lachs "HR maven"
Reviews.Content: It has so much capability and the resolution is excellent.  I would highly recommend to a friend or family member.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet, Better and cheaper than iPad mini
Reviews.Author: Gun_Monkey
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 is my personal favorite in the realm of tablets of it size. Based on objectively comparable features, it is better generally better than the iPad mini, other than in the case of cameras, as the Nexus 7 has no rear camera to take pictures. This tablet is also a bit smaller than the iPad mini, making it just the right size to fit in a cargo pants pocket. The Android operating system, however, is more compatible with other devices than iOS, making it easier to import pictures and other files to the device. The Android operating system also allows for much more personalization than iOS. The Nexus 7's powerful hardware, crystal clear display, and exterior construction also set it above most competitors of its approximate size including the iPad mini. Surprisingly, one of my favorite features is the backplaye, which is plastic, but has a nice grippy, anti-slip texture that contributes to how perfectly the Nexus 7 fits perfectly in one hand.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Máté B.
Reviews.Content: This is a very good tablet for who don't want to carry big, heavy devices. The navigation in the menu is very smooth, good display, and you always get the newest android when it released.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Onir Pernia "Onir Pernia"
Reviews.Content: I honestly recommend this tablet to anyone.PROS:- It's fairly easy to use.- It looks and feels great on your hands.- I personally love the fact that it is in the 7 inches form factor.- The back has some sort of texture that adds a sufficient amount of grip to the device.- Runs pretty fast and has astonishing graphics.CONS:- You have to manually add VPNs for abroad use.- No default tethering option.- No cellphone (unlike most samsung tablets).- No whatsapp - like apps.All the cons have some ways around them, but you are required some technical knowledge. Most of the stuff can be found on xda forums though.

Reviews.Title: What I expected and arrived in time. Thank you!
Reviews.Author: Bea Langsdorf
Reviews.Content: I've ordered this product as a raffle prize for a trade show.  The Nexus 7 had the Tegra 3 NVIDIA chip inside that makes all video images and gaming an awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TABLET AT A GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: Alejandro
Reviews.Content: I have been using it for a month for working and playing and works perfectly.Highly recommended for all purpose

Reviews.Title: Best 4G Tablet
Reviews.Author: Lucinda O.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tablet. I can do literaly everything on it, and it's just the right size, not too small, not too big for travel.

Reviews.Title: Best recent purchase
Reviews.Author: Skylar
Reviews.Content: This tablet really is the pinnacle of Android tablets. Not because of power or flair, but because it's well supported due to being google's own tablet.Android was long shunned because of poor performance and lack of the variety of apps that Apple is able to provide on its own app store. I'd have to say after using it for a few days that the app store is no big deal. Not even a factor in the decision any more.Given that, this tablet does have its advantages over the more expensive Apple counterparts. These include the ability to customize the way it looks (without rooting). This can of course be done on Apple devices via jailbreaking, but I never recommend hacking a device unless you're completely dissatisfied with it. If you want more of an apple themed lock screen, there are some downloadable from the google play store. If want a live wallpaper of swimming koi that you can scare away with the flick of a finger, then you can have it. Overall I think the aesthetics of more recent android versions are better than many iOS features these days.Pros:-Approx. 6 hours battery life on non demanding games-One of the cheapest tablets on the market!-32GB space. I have over 2300 songs on it and there's plenty of space for all the games and videos I want-Great Wi-Fi range. I've seen this one mentioned before and it holds true with my Wi-Fi-Small enough for comfort, large enough for decent viewingCons:-Lower resolution than the full sized iPad. This isn't really an issue that I've found comes up, but there you have it. (still beats the more expensive iPad mini by a fair margin)-Low volume. I've found that a lot of my music isn't as loud as I'd like (probably too loud honestly). This hasn't really been an issue, but something I'm nit picky about because I'm an audiophile sometimes.Well there you have it. If you want to save some cash and get basically every feature you could find on the iPad mini, then get the nexus 7. I do have to make note of the potential upcoming reveal of the "nexus 2" though. If it starts in the same price ranges, then I would definitely wait ad buy one of those.

Reviews.Title: best 7 inch tablet so far
Reviews.Author: Pedro Gallegos
Reviews.Content: Ready out of the box, beautiful screen and core performance, battery lasts about 10 hours and takes about 2 to 3 to charge. Front camera works well for video calls. But the tegra3 stands out with impressive graphics and performance. Got nexus 7's dock and you can get pretty good sound out of the 4 pin connector

Reviews.Title: Satisfied!!
Reviews.Author: Seye Popoola
Reviews.Content: The product was delivered in good time. This is the 3G version. Only issue was that I did not know beforehand that it uses a micro-sim and not the regular one. Haven't used it for so long but enjoying it so far, definitely probably the best tablet in its size category.

Reviews.Title: Pure android
Reviews.Author: Kalpesh Patel
Reviews.Content: The best part about this is the support from Google. All the latest updates would be pushed to this device first.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Aljareda Lee
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with a tablet, but I am a well experienced PC user.  This table was so easy to use and meets all of my requirements.

Reviews.Title: SO AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Ronnie J. Osburn
Reviews.Content: Screen looks amazing, the pure android experience is great. Android has really matured as an mobile OS and this device allows it to shine. The only knock against it is the lack of LTE, but AT&Ts; 3g is more than usuable in southern California.

Reviews.Title: Asus Nexus 4G is value for money
Reviews.Author: Sreekumar K.S
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing Tab from Asus and Google. All the features are worth the money. HSPA+ (3G+)supported, so u r online while moving. The only thing can go against this is lack of calling facility. But I believe with the VOIP technology we can over come that. Graphics quality and multiprocess with its 1.2 Quad core Processor has amazing quality with out any delay or hangs. I would recommend this to who all looking of an amazing 7" Tab

Reviews.Title: nexus 7 32gb 3g
Reviews.Author: Gustavo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet nexus 7 32gb 3g through amazon website and I am thrilled about it.It is made in superb quality, very stylish, the product was as described in the ad, and the vendor fulfilled 100% the delivery on time.very recommendable for next time.

Reviews.Title: best tablet option for android users
Reviews.Author: N. Joyce
Reviews.Content: I was able to setup the tablet in a few hours downloading all of already purchased and downloaded Google apps.  Battery life is great. size is great for reading or games.  We also bought a case that allows it to stand up in its one.  Great for videos or movies.  You have access to Google and Amazon stores.Great tablet.  Check out comparisons of nexus, kindles and iPads.  I am not an i anything so didn't compare the iPad :when making my decision.

Reviews.Title: Great alternative to laptops
Reviews.Author: scott482002
Reviews.Content: I purchased two Kindle tablets as gifts and decided I'd like to try one.  I chose the Nexus 7 because of the Android OS.  As soon as I logged in to my Google account, all of the Google based info was transferred to the tablet.  I was thinking I would spend hours manually entering my info.  It's fun and flexible.  I decided to go with the WiFi only because I primarily use it at home.  I also switched to an Android based phone and now it's linked to my tablet as well as my computer.  Last, there are hundreds of apps to choose from and you can download them from your computer directly to my tablet and phone.

Reviews.Title: Great for travel
Reviews.Author: L. Rodrigues "Lu Rod"
Reviews.Content: Small size, very portable.This is my first such device. I would have given this a 5-star if they'd been clearer about how to use and set up the programs. Apps that you'd think were included, like the camera, had to be searched and downloaded. All in all I'm very happy with this device.

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: james ashleigh
Reviews.Content: really like the nexus, lovely screen, good build quality, the gsm option makes it  a truly mobile device. the processer is fast and jelly bean is clearly the best android yet. on the down side, the battery could be better with about 6-7 hours of use. the lack of expandable memory and no HDMI are also both dissapointing omissions from what is otherwise a very capable little tablet at a great price.

Reviews.Title: The best tablet
Reviews.Author: Fernando Gabriel Muñoz Mena
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled with the features of the tablet, I like the product and  I am thrilled with the features of the tablet

Reviews.Title: Great smaller tablet.
Reviews.Author: Raymond Lancione
Reviews.Content: This tablet is awesome and comes packed with features for the price.Access to the great Android Google Play market.  You can enjoy almost all the apps you enjoy on your Android phone.  From Nest's mobile thermostats, to Minecraft, to Facebook.The device is super fast with it's qaud-core processor.  It's also great with battery life.The only problem is the brightness is slightly dull compared to other tablets.  It's harder to see outside.  It also does not have expandible memory so you'll be stuck at 32GB but I haven't ran into any storage problems.  I paired this with a Bluetooth keyboard that also acts as a case.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: candy18 "candy"
Reviews.Content: The nexus 7 tablet is a good tablet for its price. i would suggest that the tablet came with a guide to tell people what to do if their tablet powers of.the first time it happened to me i was extremely upset i wanted to return it right away but then i tried holding the power button for a minute and it turned on this usually happens when the tablet is out of charge or if you press power off on  your tablet.overalls this is a good tablet and i would suggest you buy it.update:if you have a choice between this or an apple product i would suggest apple. Nexus (google) doesnt have a place to go to if your  device breaks, but apple will give you store credit for a broken device. my tablet broke about 6 months after buying it, it might have been from the way i used it im not sure. The place where you insert a charger became to loose to hold a charger  and charge so unless held in a certain way it would ( rarely ) charge. i dont know if it would be hard to get a refund from this seller because i got it as a gift and i have no way of knowing where the person who gave it to me got it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent device!
Reviews.Author: Georgi Dimitrov
Reviews.Content: Definitely a 5 star purchase.It's always in my pocket, ready for reading, surfing, navigation, media playing or gaming.The display is brilliant. The battery lasts exactly two days with normal usage.You will not regret if you buy one!

Reviews.Title: I'm loving this little tablet
Reviews.Author: jamurphy "jamurphy"
Reviews.Content: I received the 10 inch Kindle Fire HD for Christmas but never liked the platform so I exchanged it for the Nexus 7 and I've never regretted it. Oh sure, I can't stream Amazon Prime Movies like I could on the Kindle and I don't have Dolby Stereo but I can at least use Google Earth and a bunch of other apps that wouldn't work on the kindle fire hd.  The nexus is easier to use, more intuitive and I just like the presentation of the apps better with the small symbols rather than the enlarged kindergarten style of the 10 inch kindle fire HD.  the 7 inch size of the Nexus is more portable than the 10 inch  kindle and I can still see and read everything with ease.  The price is a definite plus compared to the iPad mini.  So what's NOT to like about the nexus 7?  I haven't found it yet.

Reviews.Title: Really good compared to iPad
Reviews.Author: R. Thomas "rthomas"
Reviews.Content: I had the iPad 2 but it was just little too big for me. So after doing a ton of research I decided to buy the nexus 7. This devise is fast responsive and works just as well as the ipad2. The display is very good and the program choices are on par for the most part with the ap store.I use google drive to back up important files but an expansion slot would be the one item I wish this had along with a rear camera.I am still happy with the product as this is much more portable then the iPad and the functionality is the same as the iPad but heck of a lot cheaper.

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet
Reviews.Author: SteveC
Reviews.Content: Was delivered in two days, as ordered.I charged it up over night, and it only took a few minutes to power it up and get started getting familiar with it.The display is great for watching video and reading. I now have digital magazines through my local library, which read well on this device.I find myself spending quite a bit of time using this instead of my laptop for non productivity related use, but still need the laptop for getting some things done.All in all, a great birthday present to myself.

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Camilo
Reviews.Content: This tablet is amazing price and is very fast. It was a gift for my wife. She had a Galaxy tab 7 2 but the nexus 7 is faster and is always updated.

Reviews.Title: An awsome tablet!!
Reviews.Author: trent
Reviews.Content: + amazing screen all around makes other screens seem dull+ slick and incredibly responsive touch screen+ does it all (with some app downloads) [music]  [video]  [web browser]  [gaming]  [snes/gba emulator]  [gps]  [notepad] [newspaper/magazine/book reader]  [piano]  [guitar]. the list goes on and on+ a ridiculous amount of customization available through apps and widgets-the only thing that could be better would be a longer lasting battery, but no real complaint here, it would have to be bulkier for the battery to last longer

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: perboe
Reviews.Content: Is an excellent tablet and also an excellent e-reader.Is small enough to carry anywhere and light.The battery stands for a long flight ( 12+ hrs reading)

Reviews.Title: Best 7in tablet (Asus nexus 7)
Reviews.Author: Zion
Reviews.Content: the Nexus 7 is by far the most greatest 7 inch tablet I have one for almost 3 months and I am just amazed by what I can do with it the Nexus 7 is a great Android tablet to have the tablet is a very very good product it works very well I use it everyday I use it for books music and videos games it has an amazing HD display Google Play Store is just amazing the web browser is awesome the player is customized to look good and I just love this product.I would recommend this product to people looking for a portable tablet need to take with them on a trip on a plane on the car anywhere they travel. the reason why I rate this product 5 stars is because I have had no problems with it is the best tablet I have ever used I use it everyday it's a very good product for daily use. I would recommend you to buy a case just in case because you could tend to get scratches on the back.

Reviews.Title: Still the best all around 7 inch tablet out there after 9 months
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: What to be said that hasn't already? Nothing, really.Pros:-Excellent battery life-1200x800 screen-bluetooth and NFC-pocketable, even with a seidio active case on it-no proprietary connectors like Ipad, Galaxy Tab, and Nook hd. Just a micro USB connector.-easy to unlock and root. DO THIS FIRST THING AFTER TAKING IT OUT OF THE BOX IF YOU HAVE ANY PLANS TO DO THIS AT ALL. Just Google "nexus 7 toolkit".- 32gb onboard storage- one of the first devices to get latest software updates.Cons:- no micro SD slot(expandable storage)- not a fan of the headphone jack being on the bottom.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Tablet For The Price
Reviews.Author: Sacha Potter
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted a tablet and recently decided to buy Nexus 7. I own a Galaxy Nexus knew I wanted the "pure" Android experience. I chose the nexus 7 over the NExus 10 because I thought I would use a 7" tablet more than a larger one. Plus for the price is was a great deal.For those looking at small tablets and are considering an iPad Mini, give the Nexus 7 a try (unless you're already committed to the iOS camp). The Nexus 7 gives up some screen space and the great Apple design/build quality but you save $180 (for the 32GB models). That's is a pretty substantial savings. Go to your local Walmart or Staples and give one a try; you never know!Anyway, I've been using this tablet for a bit and here are my impressions so far:Pros:-Price!-Speedy-7" size ia a good balance between screen size and portability-Comfortable and easy to hold-Jelly Bean is a great OS, very customizable-Wi-Fi reception seems better than most smartphones I've used-The dimpled back cover is a unique design element-Screen is crisp despite the modest specs-Guaranteed to get the latest and greatest OS updatesNeutral:-Speakers are adequate but not great-Build quality is adequate but not great-Screen color/contrast/brightness is average but not great-No rear camera does not bother me-Battery life seems fine but not stellar (lots of variables however)Cons:-No SD card slot-No MHL video out-No notification light (probably to save on costs)This tablet walks the line between price and features/quality very nicely. My only real complaint (and this isn't just Google) is the lack of an SD card slot. I know Google just wants us to use their cloud services but I've love to load up all my music and videos for trips. You can always use an OTG cable and a flash drive, but that is much more cumbersome.However, for the price, I can overlook these relatively minor flaws. This is a great product for the price and I wholeheartedly recommend this to anyone looking for a small tablet. For some reason, this vendor is selling these for $10 more than the Google Play store and some local retailers (although you may pay sales tax).

Reviews.Title: Best budget friendly tablet out there!
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Fast, portable and good looking. Great displays and the latest version of android is smooth. Not quite the i-pad killer yet but knocking on the door & for a fraction of the price!

Reviews.Title: Well worth the trade!
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: Now I did not buy my nexus from amazon, I got it from Newegg.com. I sold my iPod touch 4g that I had since release and loved and put tons of money in into iOS. I wanted a nexus since release and now I finally got it. Its really the full android experience which I never had before on my phone's. The tablet is so fast it goes through the OS and games like slicing butter with an exact knife. The 7 inch form factor is great too, I can fit it in my pants pocket with no problem! This is a must have tablet if you know you want to play games on a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Asus nexus
Reviews.Author: dorothy patnode
Reviews.Content: the nexus is user friendly and thats what I was looking for in a tablet , I can  put it in my purse and go anywhere with it , in case i need to use it for navigation purposes. I'd like the camera to work both ways though , but am happy with the way it is .

Reviews.Title: excelent
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Emán
Reviews.Content: The best tablet.... Android jelly bean is faster.. Is a good choise, i like it nexus 7 ... :) .

Reviews.Title: I really like it - but no sound is a pain.
Reviews.Author: ChrisUK
Reviews.Content: My first tablet experience and although I like it in general, no sound from audio files seem to be a known issue. I just need to find out how to cure it hopefully so I don't have the hassle of returning it.

Reviews.Title: Quick processor, responsive display and beautiful!
Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a totally custom tablet, this one is for you!  The only reason for the 4 stars and not the 5, is camera placement, needs a rear camera and a hdmi port.

Reviews.Title: Best 7in tablet!
Reviews.Author: Batmanfan2
Reviews.Content: When I first booted up my first Nexus 7, I was truly amazed! The text was crisp, the video playback was amazing (As good as my HDTV) and the speed was amazing. I downloaded 15 new apps from the Google Play store and it took less than two minutes!The things I like about the Nexus 7 are the speed, I absolutley love having the quad core speed. And that it is jelly bean 4.1. I like Jelly Bean more than ice cream sandwich because the applications run a lot smoother.The things I don't like is the front camera, it is absolutley dreadful! Nexus should have not created the camera because it makes anything that looks good into super unattractive! I wish Nexus instead of putting the camera in, swap it out and put a micro sd card reader (You can buy an OTG cable to by pass that). The next thing is the speakers, don't listen to this tablet without headphones. When I cranked the volume up for music it either goes into static mode or just distorts. Plus it does not get very loud when I'm watching movies via Netflix. Those are my only gripes.In summary this tablet is wonderful, it was my first tablet ever and I'm glad that I choose this as my first. The speed is wonderful, the resolution is fantastic and it's Google's tablet so updates come frequently. It's not a perfect tablet, I experience extreme lag when I update just 5 apps, the screen takes a while to move side to side. I've had only a few crashes, nothing to severe. Overall great tablet, highly reccomend!

Reviews.Title: So happy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my Nexus 7 and meets more than I even thought it could do. Love the mic feature for sure on doing emails on the nexus. Love the search, books down load were easy and on my own even able to hook up to my library. I have watched movies, camera is unimportant to me and still need to work on how to use and delete.  At 70 I never knew this could be so much fun and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Nice hardware
Reviews.Author: Shawn T. Rutledge "ecloud"
Reviews.Content: I won't rate the OS because it's just generic Android Jelly Bean.  (And that's a good thing, compared to some of the vender-customized versions.)  I bought it for some development work and for trying out different operating systems.  I think the future of such devices is to have a choice of OS's, just like you can have with a laptop; so the important thing is how hackable is this hardware?  The Nexus 7 happens to be popular for that sort of thing, so you can choose between various versions of Android and other Linux distributions such as Mer with KDE Plasma Active, Ubuntu with Unity, and Bodhi with Enlightenment.  I'm sure more are on the way.  I installed TWRP and the multirom hack to be able to choose the OS at startup (via the touchscreen even).I also like that it feels solid, and I like the rubbery feel of the back.  The display is really beautiful too, and high enough resolution.  Maybe it's not "retina" but it still looks better than last-generation tablets, and it doesn't tax the GPU the way a 2k resolution display would.  So considering the Nexus 10 is so hard to find right now, maybe it's OK to wait until the next generation of GPU before getting a retina Android tablet.  The microUSB port has host mode, so you can plug in such things as keyboards, USB sticks and so on via an adapter (not included but cheap to buy).The minor downsides I've found so far:- no microSD slot.  32GB is enough, but it would still be nice if it were expandable.- the desktop dock is hard to find and costs too much- there should be a keyboard which attaches to the tablet and uses the 4 gold-plated contacts rather than using bluetooth, and basically converts this tablet to a laptop.  But nobody has made it yet.  Instead you can buy a bluetooth keyboard which is the same size, props up the tablet when you are using it and and acts like a screen cover when you're not.- there could have been a Wacom tablet with a stylus like the Samsung Galaxy Note series has.  It's too bad only Samsung is doing that so far.  But then again this one costs half as much.  When the 8" Note comes out, I suspect it will be quite competitive.- the accelerometer shows up under /sys/bus/iio but NOT under /dev/input.  It's still possible to work with that of course, but not treating it as an input device makes it less straightforward.  Of course this is not Google's fault or Asus' fault, just a Linux driver idiosyncrasy that is consistent between Android and all the Linux distros I've tried so far.

Reviews.Title: Wondeful tool
Reviews.Author: Javier C. Gomez "jg_65"
Reviews.Content: I had held off from buying a tablet for a long time due to the fact i felt these are more for entertainment than anything else,  however due to a recent increase in projects at work,  I figured that there must be a way to use one to help get more organized.After reading reviews and the fact i am an Android fan due to the customizability of the environment i chose the Nexus 7 in early December. Do not regret that decision one bit.Being I already have an Android phone my tablet synced automatically.  Once I got proper productivity apps like Evernote,  the google tasks and calander,  it really did in fact turn into a great productivity tool. After some training of my own habits I now am tracking and managing my own projects far more effectively than before.  Using the widgets has allowed me to customize the tablet interface precisely as I want it.As an added bonus I can read books and have downloaded and watched movies and TV for short domestic flights.This is still mainly a tool for entertainment I think,  but the tools are there to use this for work related tasks as well.This has really worked out fantastically for me and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: only one drawback
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected.  Runs anything I've been able to throw at it so far.  The only drawback is the lack of a SD slot

Reviews.Title: 7 inches is big enough (what she said?)
Reviews.Author: Shaun Russell
Reviews.Content: Not only is the 7" more affordable than the full size tablets, its the perfect fit for your hand and the screen is more than big enough. I would recommend this tablet to anyone. The only problem is the lack of a backfacing camera, but this is a minor issue for me as i don;t take photos with my tablet. Love it, Love it, Love it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent 7 inch tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had 2 Nooks and a Toshbia net book and this is the best tablet by far.Very satisfied with its performance

Reviews.Title: Great little tablet
Reviews.Author: E. Morrison "E.M."
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect size for a palm sized device. The OS is smooth and responsive. The GPS receives a strong signal in the house. The screen is adequately bright and vividly colorful. Battery life is decent. Overall both my wife and I are extremely pleased with this tablet.

Reviews.Title: First tablet
Reviews.Author: Poppy "Poppy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this from a local Staples as my first tablet. I have had an iPhone since day 1 and am experienced with iOS, but for several reasons I was not interested in the iPad: mostly because of the price. So this was the best option.I did have to exchange my first Nexus 7 the day after purchasing, as I found a line of dead pixels and I knew it would bug me forever if I didn't get a new one. This kind of thing happens all the time, and the exchange process took about 2 minutes with 0 hassle.This was my first experience with Android anything, and at first it was confusing, but I picked it up very quickly and at this point I'm liking it more than iOS. It's fluid, user friendly, efficient, fun to use, and I have a little more control over everything.I'm not much of a movie watcher or game player - I use this tab for Skype, reading, browsing the internet, banking, paying bills, working (using Google Drive and Gmail constantly) and social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc). It does all of those things beautifully - I just wish more of my favorite apps were designed for tablets. Blown up phone apps looks pretty bad. But that problem is being fixed.Battery life seem solid. If you are only doing light browsing and emailing it will be good for at least 2 days, possibly more. We will see how it holds up.Fantastic value, great tablet. Might even go for the Nexus 10 later on down the road.

Reviews.Title: Works As Advertised
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Do your homework before making your purchase.  There are lots of tablets available, all with something just a little different to keep down costs and make them unique.  This tablet has most of you want - nice resolution graphics, most recent version of Andriod, not locked in to Amazon (like Kindle) or B&N; (like Nook), not even Google - but doesn't offer MHL to display the output on another device.  For me the 7" screen is fine for what I need.One other note:  be aware of potentially security exposures with Andriod OS.  Apps you download from Google Play or the Amazon App Store do not undergo the same rigor as apps available in iStore for Apple devices.  There are several Android apps that can access sensitive information on your Android device - things like on-line passwords, credit card numbers, etc.  I don't use my Nexus to do on-line shopping, on-line banking, etc.

Reviews.Title: excellent value
Reviews.Author: Chaz Palio
Reviews.Content: great tablet for the price point! have literally zero complaints, exceeds expectations :)battery life is much better than I thought it would be. Battery can easily last me all day with heavy usage

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet Period
Reviews.Author: Riusaki
Reviews.Content: The best part about this tablet is how fast it is.  The Google Now feature alone is worth the price of admission.  I don't know how people can buy other tablets that are more expensive than this.  This is the best tablet ever made period.I give much credit to Amazon for introducing the Kindle Fire (which I also own) at such a low price point which has now spawned affordable tablets for the masses and without it we would not have the Nexus 7.If you are looking to see what Android is like this device will make you a believer.  Only thing to complete my Android arsenal is getting my hands on a Nexus 4.  Currently using a T-Mobile G2 (HTC Vision).

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: RA
Reviews.Content: I managed to hold off on getting an iPad for years-I played around with my friends and while I liked them I just felt they were a little too big for what you get. As smaller tablets came out I still held off because they just seemed a little under powered and over priced...not so with the Nexus 7. After I got my mom an iPad mini I started shopping for a tablet in the 7" range and wow what a killer device. I'm not a small guy but even with my large hands some tablets are oversized in this size range (iPad mini is actually 7.9") and the Nexus 7 fits perfectly. Very flexible device, excellent display, CAPACITIVE touch screen, and solid build quality. I bought this on Amazon and 32 gigs of storage for under $300 is an amazing deal (equivalent iPad mini is $429!). Tip: root or jailbreak your phone (android or iPhone, respectively, and is 100% legal) and this thing works on the go with free tethering, must have.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Marques
Reviews.Content: Very nice tablet, fast for games, easy to handle and lots of free apps with nice features.Bad things: no micro-SD card slot neither HDMI output (but it was expected due to the low price)

Reviews.Title: Well worth It!
Reviews.Author: Matthew McConnell
Reviews.Content: Product is a great value for the money.  All the specs of higher end models without the high end price tag.  We also received it within two days!

Reviews.Title: Problems too soon. Disappointed with seller.
Reviews.Author: jar
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my son on Christmas Day.  On January 5th, he began having problems with it powering up and down.  He contacted Google, who directed him to BuyBuy the Amazon seller.  BuyBuy wuld not except the return, saying it was over 30 days since date of purchase.  It was exactly 30 days from purchase, but not delivery.Before he began having problems, my son had been thrilled. We had a Kindle Fire in the past for almost two years before having any problems.

Reviews.Title: Display malfunction after less than 6-month of occasional usage
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. Very nice display. However suddenly started to behave strangely, with the image jumping around and bleedings, then stabilized in a state where half the screen is pale, lacking intensity, and also some "bleeding" in that half part. I used it occasionally in a nice and thick leather cover. It never fell on the floor. I never hit it hard. It is just very weak I guess. And the display problem, categorized as LCD internal "cracks" problem is not covered by warranty as I was told by the retailer, who asked ASUS and co. Then it would cost ~90% of the price of a new one to repair. It is the end of the story for me with tablets, android and Google. My small light portable PC is so great in comparison (though cost 6X this tablet).

Reviews.Title: Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Toni"
Reviews.Content: After much research, I decided that the Asus Nexus was the best choice for a tablet. Since this was my first tablet I looked forward to the day it would arrive. My excitement turned quickly to disappointment as I learned I had a faulty unit. From the first moment I turned it on, it wouldn't work right. I would have to tap the screen over and over and over again to activate it, and then I would end up somewhere other than where I had wanted to go. The more I tried to maneuver my way through its programs, the worse it got. I'm glad I purchased it through Amazon though, because the seller had a good return policy, and all I had to do was print out a return label and drop it off at UPS, postage paid. After reading what others went through trying to deal with Asus directly, I would never buy another product from Asus unless the seller had a fair return policy.

Reviews.Title: Good While it Lasted
Reviews.Author: Jay-V "Jay-V"
Reviews.Content: I loved this product for about 3 months. Then one day it stopped turning on. There was nothing I could do to get it to work.Meanwhile, my first generation iPad still works as well it did the day I opened it 3+ years ago.Asus makes great monitors and laptops, but I will never buy their tablets again.

Reviews.Title: Nearly perfect.
Reviews.Author: RB Reed
Reviews.Content: After owning a Nook tablet for the last year or so, I was amazed at the power and versatility of the Nexus 7. The Nook was very restrictive about what I could install and it seemed that they went to great lengths to dumb down what an android tablet could do.That is definitely not the case with the Nexus. I still use it as a reading device, but now it has pretty much become my main computer. I've been building my own computers and writing software since I got my first Atari 400, but now I rarely sit down at my desktop, anymore. In fact, when I do use my desktop I am usually controlling it from my Nexus. There are some tasks, like video editing, that are easier to do from the desktop, but I've become hooked on working from this little monster.I have resisted getting a cell phone again, but I'm able to text for free using Google voice. I'm also impressed with all the text to speech and voice command apps that are built into the new android jelly bean os. I have never used Siri, but it can't be as accurate as Google voice. No, it's not 100%, but darn close.The only criticism I have is with the WiFi version. I understand that you need to install a SD card for the 4G version in order to get access to a network, but why remove the slot from the WiFi version. 32G is a lot of storage, but storage space is something you can never have too much of. I tried to load my music collection onto the Nexus and ran out of space. My workaround is to put it on a big flash drive and connect it with an OTG cable when I want to listen offline. Not a perfect solution, but it works when I need it. I would rather be able to put it on a SD.Bottom line, though, is that I'm extremely impressed and very happy with my Nexus 7.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Tablet at any price.
Reviews.Author: aqcrc51
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 is simply put an amazing tablet.  It could easily sell for $100-$150 more.  32 gig for only $250 is the best value in tablets.  I am not a person who is brand myopic.  I own 2 Ipad2's and Android phones.  I simply look for the best product.  If you are looking for a full size large tablet, I think the IPad is the way to go.  I however wanted something a bit more portable and also something that wouldn't break the bank.  Enter the Nexus 7.  It is every bit as fast, smooth and beautiful as my Ipad. It has great games, apps and the Android experience is wonderful.  The only downfall to this tablet is no SD card slot, however the 32 gig, HD display and lightening fast quad-core processor make up for it.  There is nothing my Ipad does this can't.  Is is simply much more comfortable to hold and easier to carry.  Simpy put, it fits into the pocket of my suit / sport coats, which is what I want.  No reason to pay $200 more for an Ipad Mini that isn't in my opinion isn't quite mini enough (wont fit into pockets) and cost almost as much as my full size IPAD. when at home my Ipad is my go-to device.  However, if on the road or work, Nexus 7 all day.  BTW love the soft touch backing.  Don't have to worry about it scratching or sliding across a surface.  If you are thinking about buying one.  Stop thinking and buy the 32 gig version.  You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Probably best 7-inch tablet in the market
Reviews.Author: Aleksei Kostin
Reviews.Content: Actually this is my 2nd tablet and I compared it with Ipad2 32 Gb. Seems that Nexus is easier in syncing with my google account - all my apps were synced in a couple of minutes. It is really best value for money. Will definitely recommend this tablet to others

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: F. A. Perez
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about buying this table since my best friend had bought an android tablet before (Samsing Galaxy Tab Plus 7") and it wasn't a good choice, but I have to say that this Nexus 7 is great. It's fast, has GPS, the size is perfect for my hand and the price can't be better than this.I didn't choose iPad mini because android tablets can be customized easily than that one.Go ahead, you won't regret.

Reviews.Title: NC N7 user
Reviews.Author: puppypad
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great, But don't try to compare to iPad (apples & oranges) not the same.The Nexus7 loads fast, lot of free apps, love the google talk. There is no need for sd slot apps just don't up much space. Adobe Flash is discontinuing flash for android so complaining about it won't help. You can download Photon flash it takes a little getting use to but works. I have read a lot of what this tablet does not have, But I rate on what it dose have, speed,space, size, apps, great battery life. Bottom line for the $ great buy.

Reviews.Title: asus nexus 7 inch 32g  tablet
Reviews.Author: karl
Reviews.Content: first of all amazon is afirst class operation.I am 65 yrs old never had a smart phone.this tablet was very easy to learn.the tablet is quality product. It is so easy my wife took over and i am fixing to order another unit.I ordered unit during Christmas rush season unit arrived 2 days later, I am impressed.I never write reviews but in this case i did. kl

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet!
Reviews.Author: Rodney Heath
Reviews.Content: I have tried other tablets and read many, many reviews and this by far is the best for the money. It does everything that a tablet should do. From running the latest apps & games and does so much more. It's so easy to carry this with me wherever I go to help me stay informed and organized. It fits right in my pocket instead of hauling my laptop everywhere. The battery life on this is really good but playing an HD game on it does drain the battery a bit quicker but other than that this thing can go quite a while on a full charge. Great tablet, great price! 5 Stars! I would give it 6 stars but it's not possible! You will NOT be disappointed if you buy this tablet! Your wallet will thank you too.

Reviews.Title: on par with the best
Reviews.Author: mandatsgunny
Reviews.Content: moved all social apps from a corporate pc to the nexus...all running, no problem...and that's just the tip of the iceberg...recommend you get decent screen protection and a case..

Reviews.Title: Compared to the rest!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Sanders
Reviews.Content: I ordered a Kindle, a Nexus and the Samsung Tab 2 for Christmas for my kids ages 22 and 24. I figured they could try all three and whichever they chose I would order a second one.  Well, they had great things to say about all of them , but by far the  Asus Nexus did everything they needed.  The storage is great,  as well as the speed  and graphics .They are both die-hard Android users.  The only tablet that came close  was the Kindle but the user interface on top of the Android OS made it difficult for them to navigate..... Since we did a product comparison , I can truly state the Nexus was the best!!!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Robert C Lewis
Reviews.Content: I already have a good 7" tablet but this is a great 7" tablet.  The addition of the keyboard cover makes this a great companion.  Price was less than expected.  As usual, the Amazon shopping experience was flawless.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, Versatile Product
Reviews.Author: R. Carroll
Reviews.Content: I have to question some of the negative reviews about this product.  I own an iPhone 4S, a MacBook & an iPad 2, but purchased the Nexus 7 because of good reviews online and from friends.  It's a great product that works without any hitches that I've found after nearly a month of serious use.  I now prefer it over my Apple products due to its convenience and size.  To me it's every bit as intuitive as an Apple product.  It also has the benefit of being almost $200 cheaper than a comparable iPad Mini and is more versatile than a Mini or a Kindle, as it has apps for reading books via Kindle, Nook, Play or Adobe.  The email and Chrome browser function well and I can smoothly watch Netflix in HD. I purchased mine from Walmart for $248 in early November.

Reviews.Title: Google Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: John M. Calva
Reviews.Content: Excellent device. It does everything it claims to do for less than a ipad. I couldn't be more satisfied. Great apps makes it easy to use for anybody at any age.

Reviews.Title: Perfect 7 inch tablet
Reviews.Author: J. Sale
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet it dose it all watch a movie check your email surf the web.Read books and also apps for shopping lists and more.Speed is great, I like the resolution. The size is perfect. The 7inch tabs are perfect to take with you.The only neg no front facing camera I don't need this.Has a video can to Skype.  No expandable memory so buy the 32 gig.I love it this tab.

Reviews.Title: Versatile tablet
Reviews.Author: Sarah Richey "Revreader"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet so that I could have access to a variety of all APS, as well as the Google' Nook & Kindle readers.  The screen resolution is wonderful and the tablet is responsive & easy to use for work and play.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy A Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: ARM_Son
Reviews.Content: Bought this tablet and the screen cracked while it sat in the drawer of the bedside table inside its leather cover and it was less than a month old.Obviously a design fault and there are a lot of unhappy people out there who have experienced the same problem. See link to forum[...]We got this one from ASUS .Do NOT do business with this company. When I called them up they told me that the screens were not covered but the warranty and it would cost me $181.00 plus postage to get it mended.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality build
Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: This broke where charger connects to device. Although I could still get a charge during it's first yr of use, it has been pure frustration. Now it just won't charge and in trying to put it in the position where it would charge, the glass broke. I bought it from Sam's Club when it first came out and was supposed to get $25 google play credit. Customer support was lacking in trying to get this issue resolved, so I eventually gave up. DON'T BUY THIS TABLET!

Reviews.Title: I'd give this zero stars if I could...
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: It was shipped and received in a timely manner, no damage to the box or anything of the sort, however the tablet was defective, right out of the box. There's only static on the screen and the resets as per online guides were of no use. This is pathetic. Organized a return the very next day (today) after receiving it.

Reviews.Title: A half baked product
Reviews.Author: Wojtek Sokolowski
Reviews.Content: I bought N7 (16GB) directly from Google about 5 months ago.  The main purpose was communication - sending and receiving emails, making phone and Skype calls, browsing the internet, Google drive, and connecting to various financial and non-financial services.  All of these functions can easily be performed on a smart phone, but I wanted a bigger screen.  My first disappointment was that many  service apps do not work on N7 so I could not even download them.  As far as calls are concerned, the only application that to my knowledge allows making phone calls from N7 (as opposed to redirecting calls to an external phone which is pointless) is Talkatone and it crashes regularly, about every time I try to use it.  Skype seems to be working OK, but does not seem to support Bluetooth connection.  The touch screen keyboard is a step down from previous versions of Android or Ipad, as it does not have a "pop-up" display of letters being touched, it merely highlights them which is difficult to read.  The speaker sound quality is rather mediocre comparing to Ipad. Another annoying feature is that the synchronization function indiscriminately imports every email, phone number, or spam sent to my Gmail or Skype accounts, so my address book is littered with hundreds of totally useless entries or multiple entries for the same contact.The "upgrade" to Android 4.2.1 that Google pushed was a disaster - the device became more sluggish in response and crashing from time to time, and Bluetooth stopped working properly - a problem reported by many users.  Google technical support is a bad joke, a complete waste of time as all they send you is surveys how they are doing.  They are doing terribly.So to sum it up, the functionality of N7 is lower than that of my smart phone that I bought some 3 years ago for half the price.  The only functions that work seamlessly on N7 are email, net browser, and Google drive, everything else is at best so-so or outright bad.  Bluetooth does NOT work at all, so this device is useless to anyone who plans to use this function extensively.  It is not a big deal to me, I can use a corded headset, but it is disappointing.  I do not own an Ipad but many of my friends do and they seem to be happy with them.  I wish I could say the same about N7, but unfortunately it gives me mostly frustration and so-so service.  So if you want state-of-the art tablet, stay away from Nexus 7. It is a cheap half baked product.

Reviews.Title: Malfunctions
Reviews.Author: Susan Massi
Reviews.Content: I tried two Nexus 7's and had to return both.  First one was extremely difficult to unlock and once it was unlocked the touchpad wouldn't work.  Nothing happened when you pressed the icons or tried to swipe and the screen just flipped out.  Second only just wouldn't turn on, despite charging it overnight.  When I returned it there was someone else there returning his Nexus 7 for the 3rd time for similar reasons!  He also said his wife had returned her's twice.  After doing further research I come to find out that apparently this is a common problem, so I'm not sure how this tablet gets such good reviews.

Reviews.Title: Just love this tablet
Reviews.Author: Pushka "Calliope"
Reviews.Content: I originally purchased the 16gb model when the Nexus was first released.  I loved it but quickly ran out of space as I like have several movies and pictures, for travel.  So I purchased the 32gb model as soon as it was released.This size tablet is the perfect size for me, large enough to see well and small enough to carry in a bag.  jellybean firmware is excellent - very smooth and fast, and google are constantly updating the firmware to take advantage of new developments.  Easy to use the google play store, and also the Amazon app store together.  Great colour screen.  For me, this is the perfect device.

Reviews.Title: Product bricked right of brand new in box
Reviews.Author: lim jun jie
Reviews.Content: Product doesn't even work. Only show a black screen of death when I power it up. Totally disappointed in Asus products now.

Reviews.Title: Never dropped and the screen still cracked after one month
Reviews.Author: Jarvis
Reviews.Content: I used the Nexus 7 for about a month and loved it. However I took it to a coffee shop about 100 ft from my place and put it into my pocket and walked there and by the time I got there the corner of the screen cracked. I've never dropped it, but I found out later that the screen is not Gorilla Glass and cracks easily. Once cracked the touch screen stops working and becomes a expensive paper weight. The warranty doesn't cover it and the repair price is almost the price of the 16 GB model.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: RacerR4c3r
Reviews.Content: I am an Apple device user, not because I am a fanboy or shareholder, or no other bias, but just because since the day I moved from Win Vista to Mac OSX, and iPhone, my life became less cluttered, and less of headaches. Last year when Nexus 7 was announced, I realized that there is some "spark" in this tablet and it hit the right spot where I can carry this device in my jacket, giving me exact balance of portability and size. In last 12 months, I went through 3 of these devices, and here is the breakdown.(the only reason I kept on buying them was due to its right size, iPad mini is bigger for what I would carry)1. Original 16 Gig, 250$ N7, came with a squeaky glass. It worked fine but the sqeaky glass always scared me, when will this thing fall apart? Sold it, to upgrade to Cellular N7, and to get rid of the squeaky glass.2. Cellular 32 Gig, N7. Worked fine till 2 months later, the speakers died. Google play messed up replacement, refused to send another device and refused to give my money back. Credit Card company had to intervene to rescue my money. (I am not buying anything from Google play, their support is horrendous, and the staff manners are unheard of)3. WiFi 16 Gig N7, 200$, from Office Max. Similar story, 2 months into using, Missed touch inputs, USB cable breakdown, occasional tablet freezes, getting hot on its back, occasional unsolicited restarts. Sold it again.None of my devices were manhandled or dropped. They were treated with same care and dignity as rest of Apple devices.I am not comparing contents on Apple and Google ecosystems, as what I need is universally available. I think it is more of an ASUS issue than Google, but if Google is going to use low quality hardware to keep prices low to capture market from Apple, who always deliver quality products, I think Google is liable as well.Compare this to my 3 year old iMac, 2 year old iPad, I never had any such issues with them. They Just Work.

Reviews.Title: Started out great!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Morris
Reviews.Content: Two weeks later it died.  yes, I made sure it was charged.  I tried the reset trick.  Nothing.  Just died.  I read about people taking off the back cover because the battery connection gets loose.  Too much work for the price.  Luckily I purchased through amazon and will be getting a full refund.  I purchased the kindle fire, hopefully will have better luck.

Reviews.Title: STAY AWAY FROM ASUS
Reviews.Author: Andrew Stevens
Reviews.Content: I have had the 32GB 2012 Nexus 7 for less than a year and it has been a terrible experience.The performance has gotten progressively laggy and the battery performance has gotten worse. Some is expected, but it has been worse than I hoped for from a Nexus device. If these were the only problems I’d probably give 3.5 stars.HOWEVER, (this is going to be a ridiculously long story skip to the summary at the end if you want)maybe 5 months after I got it, the OS wouldn't boot. Just the X showing forever, restarting the bootloader didn't help. After calling and chatting, Asus agreed to take it back. They sent the RMA form, but no shipping label. Then I had to convince them to pay for shipping, and they caved reluctantly, said they would 'make an exception'.It takes them a month to turn it around. The confirmed that all they had to do was reinstall the OS, no hardware work, and it took a month. Fine. Whatever, it was working again.2 months later the OS stops working a different way. It keeps throwing up Android System errors more and more often, so I try a factory reset (standard fix) but it won't even get through the device setup because the system errors keep popping up and preventing it. So then I go through the same process as the first time - call, chat, RMA, chat again to get them to pay for shipping (this is Feb 10th) I send it back (note: perfect physical condition, just OS problems).After a couple of days I get the confirmation from FedEx that it has arrived at Asus in Texas. 5 days go by, I hear nothing and the RMA status online still says 'waiting' or something. I chat online, the guy says he'll flag it as urgent (which they already said they would before I sent it since it was the 2nd time it broke and I’ve already been without it for a month). Next day I get an email saying it's being shipped back unrepaired because it was received broken. They don't call me or email me to find out if I sent it that way or if it was broken during shipping.I get it back a couple days later and there are multiple cracks covering the whole screen. Maybe it broke during shipping, maybe the tech dropped it on the floor and let it sit there for 4 daysI call Asus and chat with them, and they tell me there’s nothing they can do because they received it broken. I already know that FedEx isn’t going to talk to me about it because I wasn’t ‘the shipper’.So then I file a complaint on Asus’ website (3/22). This is when I start documenting all of the ridiculousness.On 4/1 I started a chat since I had gotten no response, in the complaint system it still just said that it was “In progress”, like it had for the last 10 days since I filed it. They tell me that their system is down and they can’t look up anything.Mind you, Asus has set up their systems so you can’t contact anyone directly, so every time I contact them I have to tell them the whole story or tell them to go look up my file then wait 5 minutes (ignoring the initial message it sends at the beginning: “Hello Andrew Stevens, thank you for contacting ASUS support. Please give me a few moments to review your information.
