I will be with you shortly.” and I wait 5 minutes and they know nothing about my case).So I suggest that they contact me when their system is back up. He says that’s a great idea. Guess what, they don’t. I chat the next day, 4/2, their system is back up.They train these people to be closers. Not customer service. They say whatever they need to get out of the current chat session and on to the next one.In this chat session then on 4/3, 4/4, they tell me they’ll escalate the case, they’ll have their supervisor call me and they’re very sorry but Asus doesn’t do replacements and there’s nothing they can do. I don’t get any calls, no help at all. They also tell me I should file a claim with FedEx. I tell them I already did (repeatedly) but FedEx told me (as I expected) that they would have to deal with Asus for the case since they were the shipper. The Asus rep finally tells me that the shipping claim will be handled by ‘someone at corporate’ and he can’t give me a phone number, can’t check on the status for me, and can’t tell me what’s going to happen.Also on 4/4 they finally respond to my original complaint:“I apologize for the issues you are facing. As Nigel had explained we had received thetablet with physical damage that was not reported to us in the inital contact whenrequesting an rma for your tablet therefore we had returned the tablet unrepaired toyou.”and that’s all….no help at allFinally on 4/7 they call me (outside of the hours that I told them I’d be available, with no call back number) and tell me (once again) they can’t do replacements so I should send it back in and they’ll request to replace it. They don’t tell me they’ll email me the RMA form or a shipping label, they just leave it at ‘send it back in’.So I chat again on 4/8, I didn’t have to convince them to give me a label this time, but I did have to ask for it.I send it in, they receive it on 4/15.I get a call on 4/22 saying the motherboard and screen have been replaced, and they want me to pay for return shipping. So I don’t care at this point, I’ll pay the $7 or whatever.It’s now 4/25 and they still haven’t sent me the form to provide my payment information for shipping. So who knows when I’ll get it back and if it’ll actually work then.SUMMARY:DON’T BUY ANYTHING FROM ASUS

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Lawrence J. Lester
Reviews.Content: I charged the device.  It wouldn't boot up.  The device was not eligible for exchange so I called ASUS to access the warranty and received a huge run-a-round.  Samsung here I come.

Reviews.Title: ASUS NEXUS 7 TABLET IS NOT A QUALITY PRODUCT! LOOK AT THEIR REVIEWS
Reviews.Author: Jill V
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Nexus 7 tablet. It was absolutely wonderful for 4 months. Since that time I have had to return it for repair twice within 30 days for the same problem. Their customer service is terrible & they would not tell me the parts they replaced even though I had their part numbers. The extended warranty company I purchased through Square Trade was the best & only people who do what they advertise. They have even offered to refund the full purchase price of the extended warranty I purchased due to the defective product that I was sold. I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND TO PURCHASE ANY ASUS PRODUCTS UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES! I received my Nexus tablet back ONE week ago today and I am still having the same problems! They want me to contact my internet service provider and take it back to where I purchased it to see if they will give me a refund! THIS IS THE 3RD TIME & NOBODY AT ASUS IS THE LEAST BIT HELPFUL! I HAVE SPENT $462.03 IN PRODUCT & SHIPPING COSTS ALONE. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT!!

Reviews.Title: defective tablet - Asus Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: jacques de stadelhofen
Reviews.Content: End of November 2013 I did order a Tablet Asus Nexus by Google.It had problem : difficult to put on, always cutting the screen image...Therefore, I tried to return it after a month of really frustrating experience.Much to my surprise the Tablet came back to me but with the same problems.Now, I am still with this tablet, with a dead screen!Impossible to find a fair reply from amazon as the delay to re-return the tablet was January 31, 2014!.

Reviews.Title: Decent tablet for seniors
Reviews.Author: JWink
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet as a holiday gift for my mom, who is a senior and has no computer or internet skills, as a way to hopefully get her online and using the net for things that would make her life a bit easier.  I actually found this tablet much cheaper than here on sale for $149.00 from that grouping website if you know what I mean.  For that price, I couldn't resist getting this.  Yes I know it is last years model versus the 2013 version but since I am getting this for mom who won't stress this tablet out with any kind of high end applications or music or things that like, for the different in price from the 1 year old version and the new, it was worth it to me in savings.  Since I wanted to check this tablet out and get is setup before giving this as a gift to make it easier for her, I opened it and got things set up.  Initial setup was pretty easy and basic, with choosing the language and email and your Wi-Fi, pretty simple stuff for anyone with basic computer skills.  The most time consuming was the system updates, with the tablet coming with version 4.1 on board but having to be updated three times individually to get the latest android operating system that is currently available (Jelly Bean) I believe.  Not sure why you couldn't just update to the latest version without having to update incrementally.  That would have frustrated someone like my mom who wouldn't have had any idea how to do that.  but never the less once that is complete, the use of the tablet seems very simple and straightforward like most android style tablets.  For those like me, who are not necessarily looking for the latest and greatest to give as a gift, I will compare the new nexus (2013) versus this model (2012) version so you can decide for yourself whether the extra expense is worth getting versus this model.This Nexus 7 had a three-piece layered design, boasting a textured backplate, grey plastic middle and Gorilla Glass front, the 2013 model has a single-piece smooth chassis that wraps around its glass front which for some may make you feel that the 2013 feels a bit more high end.  The 2013 Nexus is a bit slimmer and weighs a bit less than this version although in my opinion, not significantly so.When it comes to software the 2012 and 2013 Nexus 7s are all but identical, with upgrades to the latest 4.3 Jelly Bean version of Android available for both.  Now whether the 2012 version will continue to receive updates that remains to be seen, of course you could also say that next year with the 2013 version.  Like all electronics these days, no matter what version you get, you are almost always out of the loop within a couple years.  But for now, to get the same operating system for a cheaper price, this is the better deal.This Nexus 7  1280x800 HD, 216ppi display is decent but the 2013 Nexus 7, has a 7in 1920x1200 1080p HD 323ppi display which definitely means the new version has a brighter crisper display versus the 2012 nexus.  A definite advantage to the new Nexus but you do pay for that in cost.The 2012 Nexus 7 is fairly powerful, with a quad-core Tegra 3 processor and with this model having 32 gb of storage space.The new 2013 Nexus 7 has a quad-core 1.4GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon S4 processor.  Although the new version is a bit speedier, for someone like my mom, who will do basic internet surfing and not be playing any heavy duty games, there will be little difference in performance and both tablets will do well.  If you are getting this for a gamer, then the 2013 version would do better for that.The 2012 Nexus 7 only has a 1.2MP front camera designed purely for video calling versus the 2013 Nexus 7 that has a 5MP rear and 1.2MP front camera.  Considering I have a hard time getting my mom to use the digital camera I bought her a couple years ago, the camera difference is not of great importance to me.  I personally would prefer a regular quality digital camera over using a tablet or phone anyways for that purpose.The  2013 Nexus 7 has a smaller battery at 3950mAh versus the 2012 Nexus 7  with a 4325mAh battery.  Granted the power management is better on the 2013 Nexus 7 model but  the 2012 model does a decent job at lasting an adequate amount of time.This  2012 Nexus 7 comes with 32GB version and you can get an comparable 2013 model with a similar amount of space but aside from the difference price per gigabyte is a better deal with the 2012 version.Granted the 2013 version is an improvement overall from this 2012 version but this 2012 tablet is a good tablet overall and should serve the purpose for what I am getting it for, which is a senior who has little internet and computer experience.  If you find the deal, like I did at 149 then this is worth getting for someone like my mom as they don't need the latest and greatest.  My biggest challenge with this tablet is not the specs but is teaching my mom how to use it and getting her to use it so that she doesn't get frustrated and make it a coaster for her coffee.  Wish me luck.  :-)

Reviews.Title: Serious touchscreen issues--avoid
Reviews.Author: Julie Mahurin
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet a year ago and unfortunately, didn't use it very much during the first 30 days I owned it (when I could have returned it for a refund).  The touchscreen is terrible.  Sometimes it doesn't register my touches, sometimes they are registered completely wrong, sometimes it is possessed by a phantom toucher when I'm not even holding it.  I returned it to the manufacturer twice but they couldn't fix it either time.  I'm not sure what, if anything, they did to try to repair it, because it was simply sent back to me with no explanation or documentation both times.  I used to be able to get it to work for a few weeks by doing a hard reset (erasing all data and reloading the os).  The only reason I kept bothering is that I like to use it to check out library books, plus there was that $250 my husband spent on it.  I never was able to use it for anything else because it was not practical to use it for music, photos, etc when I kept having to reset it and erase everything so often.  The latest reset didn't even work--I can't enter my wifi password because my phantom typist goes crazy every time I manage to get the keyboard onscreen.From what I have heard, the new 2013 models have many of the same problems.  Don't waste your money until Google/ASUS acknowledges and fixes these problems.

Reviews.Title: broken screen after 2 months of use - kiss it goodbye
Reviews.Author: jqpitts
Reviews.Content: Bought this new Google Nexus Asus mid August. Screen was broken mid October by a light drop while inside a good case. Asus support no good. Not covered by warranty. Only wished had read these reviews before I purchased one.

Reviews.Title: 6 months
Reviews.Author: MikelB
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item in Late Feb., 2013, it is now Sept. and the tablet will not start at all. Not bad tablet for the money, but didn't last as long as I had hoped.

Reviews.Title: Two strikes and your out...
Reviews.Author: L. Williams
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for the Google Nexus 7 but they fell flat. I bought this to not only read ebooks but to also surf the web. The first one I ordered from Amazon was defective. I sent that tablet back and got an exchange which worked great. But unfortunately I wasn't happy with it. Most of the sites I visit use Adobe Flash. After reading various sites about how to install flash onto a Nexus 7, none of the tips worked for me. Sure, I can still use the tablet to download ebooks but I was still disappointed that most of the sites I visit wouldn't be able to work properly. I went ahead and promptly returned this tablet. I'm currently searching for something that will work better for me.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this...yet
Reviews.Author: M. Hunter "Miles"
Reviews.Content: Pros* Form factor is great - you can hold it like a big phone* Screen is predictably good* Sound is surprisingly goodCons* Crashes (spontaneously resets) itself on average 5 TIMES A DAY!

Reviews.Title: Google "Nexus 7 won't turn on", BEFORE you purchase!
Reviews.Author: John M. Brandauer
Reviews.Content: My enthusiasm quickly diminished when I was unable to turn it on.  The quick start manual says the battery may not be fully charged, so I tried to charge it.  No response, catatonic, dead and useless.  Wondering if there were others with similar issues I Googled Nexus 7 dead, and immediately found an array of issues associated with my lifeless Nexus 7, both software and hardware issues.  There are some steps you could try, they did NOT work for me.  The Asus website acknowledges the issue, but offers essentially no useful information.  The product forums at Google have 13 pages with 322 posts from users trying to help each other get their Nexus 7 to turn on and or take a charge.  If you are fortunate enough to get your Nexus 7 to turn on, you are forever at risk of the battery discharging and being eternally locked out, unable to recharge.These issues are well documented, at least since November 2012 and are apparently unresolvable by the Google / Asus partnership, as of August 2013.Have since purchased a Nexus 7 2013, this is the tablet to buy!  Breathtaking display, ergonomic, good WiFi, effortless Bluetooth, excellent battery life, the second edition, 2013 model is a joy to use!

Reviews.Title: False Advertising
Reviews.Author: Bruce  Hoins
Reviews.Content: We did some serious comparisons before choosing this version of the Nexus 7. We compared it to the new (2013) Nexus 7, The Kindle Fire HD, a few different Samsung's, and chose this one because no matter how much drive space you have, you will always run out, eventually, and usually before you expect to run out.One of the features this one lists is a Micro SD Card slot, which none of the other current 7" tablets have. We were severely disappointed that this one, in spite saying it has one, DOES NOT have an SD Card Slot. If we had known this one didn't have the slot, we would likely have gotten the 2013 version of the Nexus 7, or the Fire.Definitely false advertising on Amazon's part here. Note that according to ASUS there is indeed a version of the Nexus 7 that does have a Micro SD Card slot, this one just isn't it.

Reviews.Title: Charging issues out of the box
Reviews.Author: S. Sykes
Reviews.Content: purchased one just before the new version came out.  I don't need the minor upgrades in the new version, so I thought I would save myself a few dollars by getting the old version while it is on sale.  Big mistake.  The thing has battery and charging problems and searching the web showed they are widespread.  It is apparently also fussy about the cord.  What is the point of a standard charging/data cord if you do a special version of it?  Further research shows that dealing with the ASUS warranty service is liable to take years off your life, so I'm not going to even bother.  I'll just call this a $170 dollar mistake and know to avoid ASUS products in the future.  I also feel betrayed by the company who promised to not be evil.Bitter?  Yes, I expected better from Google.Follow Up.  Since I was not going to try to go through the warranty system anyway, I decided to open the case and check the battery connection.  Opening the case voids the warranty of course.  The battery was not connected.  It appears to be a design fault that would even allow this to happen.  I won't bore you with the details but I was able to plug the battery in and get the device to accept a charge.  I'm still grumpy, and the non-standard cord is still an insult to open standards, but at least my device works.  Hopefully most of the rest of you won't have this issue.  If you do check out ifixit.

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice media player. Tablet computer? Not so much.
Reviews.Author: Ludwig
Reviews.Content: If your life is all about watching movies, listening to music, & reading recreational literature, and you're happy to get all your content from online sources, then you'll definitely want to consider this tablet: it has a nice form factor, a nice screen, is plenty quick enough, and is reasonably inexpensive. And you can tweet and find the closest Starbuck's or Costa's on it to boot, though given the form factor you will of course have to hunt and peck. Its major limitation is the rather scanty 32GB of internal storage, not much even by media player standards (more on that below).If, on the other hand, you have actual work to do, and want to use this device as a tablet computer, you'll probably be unhappy with it. The really big problems are the 32GB internal storage, lack of an SD card slot and the exclusive use of the MTP/PTP protocols for USB access to that internal storage, with consequently severe constraints on the ability to synchronize your own files to/from this tablet to any other machine. The first two might have been bearable (which was my calculation when buying the device), but the third (discovered only after my purchase) turns these limitations into a handicap. There are partial solutions to the problem (e.g. Nexus Media Importer, Dropbox, Stickmount, Samba, MTP mounting and a few MTP synch utilities, etc.), but many of them are tediously interactive (i.e. resistant to programming/scripting), none of them are completely satisfactory, and the less inadequate ones will all require rooting the device.I'm using Samba & Stickmount and thanks to FunkyFresh and Chainfire can probably live with it for a while, but I must say my encounter with the Asus/Google Nexus 7 has started me wondering about getting an actual tablet computer like Microsoft Surface or some other device that has been designed to support more than personal entertainment. In the meantime, I don't foresee decomissioning my Vaio anytime soon.Update:Rating revised to two stars. I'm replacing the Google/Asus device with a Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 8 that has SD Card extended storage. The whole Asus/Google MTP/PTP emulated "SDCard" business just got too limiting/cumbersome/confusing/annoying to want to live with any longer. I don't plan on buying any future internal storage only devices from Google/Asus or any other vendor.

Reviews.Title: Cracked Screen Repair Costs $$$$$$$$$$$
Reviews.Author: SuperTeacher
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the most important thing to know in deciding whether or not to buy this is that if the screen cracks, the cost of repairing it is absurdly high, about the cost of a NEW Samsung Galaxy Tab 2. Unlike many other things out there, a DIY repair on this is not feasible at this time due to the way it is assembled and the difficulty and expense of getting the screen/digitizer assembly. At this time you can't. There is a very good youtube on how to do the repair, but I didn't watch it all the way through due to the parts availability issue. In researching this, there were a sobering number of reports of what can only be described as spontaneous cracks appearing while the tablet was just sitting on a table overnight. Asus has not been too willing to cover this from what I've heard.  Others have written at length about the functions of this tablet and my experience has been no different, that part is great. I'm going to mothball our Nexus 7 till the parts become available for a lot less and buy a Samsung or generic tablet in the mean time. Checked the cost of having the Galaxy Tab 2 screen fixed and it's about $60, didn't check part cost only. Hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: Has Potential, Doesn't Follow Through
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Estep
Reviews.Content: To start, I'm technologically competent and yet I'm on my third physical device. On top of that, I rarely even try to get it to work anymore, which is disappointing given that it's been only two months since I bought the first one and it clearly has potential.As a note about all Nexus 7s (not just mine), Bluetooth is a little messed up. Things it should pair with it won't. For me specifically, that's my Bluetooth speaker, which I would be very annoyed about if not for the stuff that follows. I know the tablet is cheap, but this is just not right.The first one I got essentially gave me the middle finger whenever i tried to use the internet, whether that was browse in Chrome or stream through Hulu. Given that I bought this device to essentially be my TV (Hulu Plus and NHL Gamecenter, primarily), this was a significant problem. It simply refused to connect to one of my routers and while it would connect to the other, that's as far as it ever got. Note that I have an Android phone and two laptops, none of which have a problem with either router.I bought a second unit to make sure it wasn't just me. Turns out it wasn't. The second unit worked as I expected it to work, connected to the internet, browsed, streamed, everything. I returned the first one and then the day after the return period for the second one, the second one stopped booting. I eventually got to the "dead Android man" and internet research told me this could only be fixed by sending the unit to ASUS. This was a relatively easy process (though not free, which annoyed me) and ASUS did exactly what I expected them to do, return a different unit to me (confirmed by serial number). I'll give them credit for being fairly quick and not giving me much hassle when I first contacted them, though I told the rep straight out what I had done, how it hadn't worked, and how the internet said it needed warranty service.It's been a month and I now have a third unit. This one is back to the Wi-Fi issue I had with the first one. I'm planning some more tests to see what I can do because I really want this to work. Like I said, I have an Android phone and this is a nice size for a portable TV (or TV replacement, in my case). I have a stand-case that will prop it up on my desk. I did actually get the third one to get online for about an hour before I took a plane trip and was able to rent and download the 7th Harry Potter and watch it on the plane. That was very cool and confirmed that I wasn't crazy to try this. Too bad I can't do it again.EDIT (05/09/2013): I did go back and try to make it work. For whatever reason, I didn't have to do anything. The only persistent issue I have now is that sometimes I need to actually stop apps that stream content, put the device to sleep, and wait 30 seconds or so. After that, I can turn it back on and stream content again. It's a little annoying, but it at least works. I do use it regularly and am finally at least happy I spent the money on it. Bluetooth is still an issue and the Wi-Fi isn't perfect, but it's also a $250 tablet, so what can I really expect I guess. I upgraded my rating to three stars. I'd give it four if not for the lengthy challenges to get to this point.

Reviews.Title: Wouldn't Turn On After First Day of Use
Reviews.Author: Rashid N. Hart "Vergoni"
Reviews.Content: This tablet failed to turn back on after just a few hours of use on the same day I took it out the box for my son. This was really annoying as the item was a gift. After searching google with "my nexus 7 tablet wont turn on", I found a slew of other users that bought the tablet and experienced the same thing. I got the tablet back on after reading different "solutions" like holding different buttons down simultaneously, pulling off the back cover, etc, and was eventually able to get it back on. It's working now but this problem seems common and should be addressed. My cheaper Galaxy Tab 7 seems much more sturdy and has never given me any problems even though this Nexus 7 is supposed to be better. I'll give it 3 stars because when it's on, it actually works even though its superiority over the Galaxy Tab 2 is barely noticeable (if at all) in my opinion. If I had to do it again, I would gift another Galaxy Tab 2. It's super lame and embarrassing to give a gift to someone and have it break down on the first day of use.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Booyah
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like the Nexus 7.  I'm not an Apple fan because I think their stuff is overpriced.  But I'm disappointed.I like the feel of the Nexus.  The beveled edges and rubber backing make it easy to hold.  The screen looks great.  Sound isn't bad at all.But there are things I don't like.  One problem is that you can't log out of gmail.  This is probably the most noticeable problem with using a smartphone OS for a tablet.  You don't share your phone, but a tablet is something that not every member of a household might have.  It's a perfect thing to leave on a coffee table that anyone can pick up.  While I'm happy to have other people use my tablet to surf the web or check their email, I don't want them having access to my email account or the ability to download apps without a password.  It's an example of Google not seeming to understand why anyone would care about privacy.  There are paid apps that will put a password on other apps, but they all seem to be laughably easy to get around, even accidentally.  Even if they worked well though, this is a problem that shouldn't need an app to solve.The other thing I hate is the battery life, especially on standby.  It seems like this thing always needs to be charged.  I tested it recently: I fully charged it and then left it on standby without touching again.  It was dead in less than 48 hrs.Another problem with the battery is that you can't easily close programs. You have to go through an indirect force closing process.  If I'm going to be on a long trip, I'd like to be able to squeeze every minute out of my battery, but the Nexus makes it hard to do that.Final annoyance: the home button isn't a physical button but a virtual one that's always on.  It's really easy to accidentally brush that button while playing a game.  That gets annoying.I don't hate the Nexus 7.  It's just needs better battery performance and some OS adjustments that recognize the difference between tablets and phones.

Reviews.Title: Most powerful 7" tablet on the market, even more powerful than iPad 3
Reviews.Author: Richard Baker "BinaryMessiah"
Reviews.Content: So here I am with my first tablet, I swore up and down that I had no use for one because I have a laptop and a 4″ phone. Why would I need a tablet? Apparently for a lot and this is one of the best devices I have used in a long time. It's sleek, powerful, and well designed. Why a Nexus 7? Well, the 7″ size is perfect where it isn't too small or too big. I don't like 10″ tablets because they just feel big and clunky. You are probably wondering what's under the hood, why not an iPad Mini, and is the screen nice?The Nexus 7 is powered by Nvidia's Tegra 3 chipset which is one of the most powerful on the market. Directly competing with Apple's A5x chipset in their iPad 3, the Nexus 7 is extremely powerful for a 7″ tablet. This tablet has a whopping 16 cores, a quad-core 1.3Ghz CPU and a 12 core Geforce ULP GPU. The tablet CPU has a fifth core that is dedicated to running in a power saving mode during times of low processing needs. That is one powerful tablet. The Tegra 3 chipset allows for some of the most advanced graphics seen on a tablet as well. Games like Dead Trigger, Dark Meadow, Zombie Driver, and a few others optimize their games for the Tegra chipset adding extra effects and higher FPS. The tablet has 1GB of DDR3L RAM rather than DDR2 RAM which is in both the iPad 3 and Mini and it twice as fast. The Tegra 3 chipset is even more powerful than the iPad Mini and iPad 3 with the Mini having a single core 1Ghz CPU and the iPad 3 having just a dual-core 1Ghz CPU. Even the ULP graphics chip is more powerful than the iPad 3′s with 416Mhz. If that doesn't impress you...I don't know what will.Asus just stopped producing the 16GB models so only the 32 are available now, but that's fine. 16GB really isn't enough space anyways, but there is no expandable storage options. You can use an OTG cable and a USB stick, but most people won't know to do that. 32GB is plenty for games, movies, music, and books. I have over 30 games on my tablet and still have plenty of room. I found the battery life is pretty decent for a such a powerful device. Running high graphic games you get about 3 hours and everything else will last you most of the day, but that's with Wifi on. With it off it is probably 30% less power consuming.The screen is gorgeous. Being better than the iPad Mini with a 1280×800 resolution rather than 1024×768. It also has double the ppi at 216 rather than 163 for the Mini. It also is 16:10 aspect ratio rather than the Mini's 4:3 aspect ratio so it is a widescreen tablet. The text is crisp and and images are sharp and vibrant. You won't be disappointed watching high definition movies or games. I also found the screen to feel very nice to touch and my finger would just glide across. The tablet is also fitted with scratch proof Corning fitted glass, also known as Gorilla Glass to some. The glass is alkali-aluminosilicate sheet glass which is the best out there right now. On the back the device has a bumpy, leathery texture which makes holding the device easier. I love this texture and feels so much nicer than the hard plastic of other tablets with their sharp edges. You also don't have to worry about setting it down and scratching it up. The whole device just looks so sleek and smooth.The tablet comes stock with android Jelly Bean 4.1, but as of a week ago the new 4.2.2 update is out. Nothing else to expect software wise other than a great Google Android OS experience. However, if you're a gamer check out Nvidia's TegraZone app to get started on what games were specifically designed for the Tegra chipset. My only complaint is that there is no rear-facing camera. Just a front facing 1.2MP camera for video chatting. However, most people don't use their tablets for taking pictures (unless you are one of those iPad people)Overall, the Nexus 7 is one of the most powerful tablets on the market, and the most powerful 7″ tablet you can get your hands on. With the 12-core chipset, bright vivid screen, and sleek design, any hardware fan will want this tablet. For the low price of $250 for 32GB of storage...nothing beats it! Once you pick this up you will realize why it was chosen as 2012′s best tablet.

Reviews.Title: Really nice tablet
Reviews.Author: Jose
Reviews.Content: Really nice tablet, Works really well for seeing videos, readings papers/news and playing games. Good ratio quality price. Totally recommended if you are looking for a new/first tablet. Supported by Google Inc.

Reviews.Title: Buggy
Reviews.Author: jack
Reviews.Content: It is totally dead and cannot reboot it at all. I am returning it now. Hope it improves in the future.

Reviews.Title: the best
Reviews.Author: Marcel  R. Georgi
Reviews.Content: great at all levelsfast light easyI only wished that they had a 10"as good as thatbut they don't :-(

Reviews.Title: Super duper
Reviews.Author: Yemi
Reviews.Content: Arrived earlier than i expected. Opened the box from Fed Ex expecting to see my new rMBP and saw the nexus. It was Christmas all over again. Synced quickly with my play account and all the apps on my HTC One X transferred.

Reviews.Title: great so far but read this...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: i love my Nexus 7 so far. i have been using it since Christmas. i have had no problems except the headset jack. many people are sending theirs back over this simple issue so i wanted everyone to know how to resolve it. I had read that the key to getting the jack port to work was to push the headset jack in until you hear it click. This never happened and I got minimal or no sound. i was about to send it back. Today I read that since the bottom of the Nexus 7 is angled, you need to insert the jack into the port at the same angle. Duh, it worked perfectly, clicked into place and voila, full sound and the jack will not pull out accidently. Yay! Happy customer.

Reviews.Title: Damn best thing for the price
Reviews.Author: ian
Reviews.Content: For $230, I get a quad core, 32GB tablet, with a super crisp screen and gorilla glass displayPros+Quad core tegra 3 processor+Light Weight+Latest and greatest android version+Ultra durable cornering Gorilla Glass 2+High resolution display, great for games and movies+Pure android, no cluttered or cumbersome appsCons-No expandable memory port-No mobile data (mobile data version is available)-No Rear Camera-Speakers aren't the best (but what built-in speakers are?)Don't get the 8gb version, if you're going to use it for movies and lots and lots of apps, don't get the 16gb version either.  Over all this is a damn good tablet considering how cheap it is. There's only a few things about it that juuust keep it from being perfect

Reviews.Title: fast shipping!
Reviews.Author: jessica
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet for my son for his birthday and he loves it. Shipping was very fast! Couldn't ask for a better product.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: JSM69
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have a large great HP laptop & wanted a smaller more portable convenient tablet. I did a fair amount of research on tablets before ordering this Asus/Nexus 7.  For me, when buying a smartphone or tablet/computer type item, it comes down to just a few basic features: battery life; screen resolution; size; overall memory (internal/external GB) & RAM & GH speed with core type; the operating system; price; and the company reputation.  Considering these main features, it was between the Kindle Fire HD & this Nexus 7 2012.  They are so much better than Apple or Samsung.Anyway, I chose the Google Nexus 7 because the price was right, the reputation & reviews good, & I have Android Smartphones & love them, so there is no getting used to a different operating system.  And, you get a really good deal on this older model, which comes with Jelly Bean 4.1.  The 1st night I had it, it upgraded to Jelly Bean 4.3, which is great...then the next day it upgraded again to the new current Android Kit Kat 4.4.  My "old model" is now brand new.  It has a sharp HD display, long battery life, plenty of memory & a fast quad core processor.I love it & highly recommend this tablet!

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Ivan
Reviews.Content: 200% meet my expectations. Lightweight, fast and usable! 3G network is working very fast.Sure i will recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: nexus 7 tablet
Reviews.Author: Lillie Colbert
Reviews.Content: It does not do all the things I though it would. There was no instructions included in the box. But it over all its nice tablet.

Reviews.Title: Not happy that tablet broke after 14 months.
Reviews.Author: Emma Cappucci
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet last year and was extremely pleased with it.  Unfortunately, when I was in the hospital battery ran out and I wasn't able to charge it.  When I try to put the cable in the tablet, it doesn't seem to make a connection.  I believe some of the pins are bent.  My warranty expired and it costs me almost as much as getting a new tablet to return it for repairs.  Looking into a different brand that may also have expandable memory.  So sad :(

Reviews.Title: Good tablet for money.
Reviews.Author: jeff watkins
Reviews.Content: This is a good tablet for the money. I have bought four of these. No complaints except the glass display could be more robust.In all fairness, these were bought for 10 year old boys.

Reviews.Title: From KFHD to Nexus 7 0 - Love It.
Reviews.Author: Burton D. Wizeman
Reviews.Content: Well Amazon, I had the Kindle Fire HD and loved it.  After Prime went up in price I was disauded from renewing it.  Without Prime, the KFHD loses its place in the pantheon of pads.  It is not as versatile as a true Android pad.  I do miss the excellent audio of the KFHD and I believe it was a bit more responsive to the multi-touch.Yet, the Nexus 7 rocks!  With a less restrictive environment for the user, the capabilities and choices open up immensely.  I have had a blast with the Nexus 7.  It has been a smooth transition from the KFHD and I like it much more.  So with the 7 you can get the Amazon apps for reading, ordering etc.  Plus, you get the Google Play store and better integration of the Google family of apps.  It was a great decision and I recommend anyone wanting to jump on the special deals (145-160) on the 32gig Nexus 7 to do so.  Even though this is the 2012 version, if you have been using the KFHD it will be a plus to you not in speed or hardware but in choices for software and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: Great for a while, now won't turn on or charge.
Reviews.Author: Jasmine Mayes
Reviews.Content: I've had this tablet for about a year, and it was great! I used it in my classes to take notes and I loved to use it to hold all my music. Back in February of this year (I got the tablet in February of 2013), it started not charging. Now, it won't even turn on.I'm very upset and disappointed because I wish that this would have lasted more than a year. Still hoping that maybe I can get it to work again, but it doesn't look like it will anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: horrible product. Asus sucks.  never buy anything from asus
Reviews.Author: Xianfeng Zhao
Reviews.Content: after a year, it is stuck in boot loader. Can't boot up. Can't load any new boot loader. Asus wants to charge me $200 to fix it. no way. Blood suckers. asus product sucks!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Cheated!
Reviews.Author: R. Givens
Reviews.Content: This device would not even turn on about a month after it was purchased!  By the time I went online to try to return it, the window to return the item had already closed.  Unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 Tablet
Reviews.Author: Devotional Toys
Reviews.Content: My husband used this to read books and play 1 game.  All of a sudden we couldn't get Wi-Fi on it.  When we took it in they said it was an internal problem and could not be repaired!  There is nothing you can do without Wi-Fi, as you cannot buy books, play games etc.  We are VERY unhappy and would like something done about it!  It says it cannot be returned but less than 6 months of use for something that was this cost is just not right.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: my3freaks
Reviews.Content: We have 3 of these in my house now.  It's a nice size, easily portable.  My husband and I got ours when they were first available, and there is still nothing that it won't run.  My son just got a great deal on this model last week, and is also loving it.  The only negative thing I have to say is that for me, I didn't like using it as an e-reader.  There are some great apps for reading, but I didn't like the back lit screen for reading at night.  For anyone who wants Android, this is a great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Please read before you buy the 2013 model
Reviews.Author: Gary Kozuma
Reviews.Content: I had no problems at all with this tablet. Fast, great screen (although a little on the glary side), and google constantly updates Andriod so you don't get stuck in an old version like with a Samsung. The battery life stinks. But the trade off is it's thin and light and at this point in time, it's very inexpensive.Now for the 2013 model. If you buy it, you will be very disappointed. First off, it's barely faster. The screen looks a bit better and the battery life is for sure better, but here's the rub: #1 it's doesn't work. Apparently there's a compatibility issue between the screen resolution and Android, which means between azus and google. It will make you crazy. #2 the form factor is different, so you'll have to buy a new case.

Reviews.Title: GOOGLE NEXUS 7 TABLET MALFUNCTION
Reviews.Author: Richard Hugh Blackford
Reviews.Content: After purchasing this device less than six months ago it now does not work. Does not turn on...nothing. This is absolutely criminal. How can I have this problem corrected. I would like to return this item and or have it repaired/replaced.

Reviews.Title: it was amazing
Reviews.Author: Jessica A.
Reviews.Content: It was excellente,I'm writing to you on it.I love this Nexus Google 7Omfg I was looking for this because I love YouTubeAnd Google ...

Reviews.Title: Tablet
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Works like expected. Its vanilla andriod, so its lean. Vanilla andriod does leave you wanting some of the extras like Samsung galaxy has to offer.Good buy. I recommend this. I also suggest the new 2013 model too.

Reviews.Title: loved by an 8 year old!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Dunkle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for a grandson...his older brother has a nook...with a long road trip to Florida looming at end of month...something was needed! I set it up for him..and it seems to be a nice tablet...a camera app has to be downloaded to use the camera...something I think should have been on the device on arrival..but have that squared away..it plays fast for games, which is the primary use of course... this does not have a micro card slot...but I just hooked it up to my laptop and downloaded four movies easily...with loads of memory to spare! I feel this is a great tablet for the money! Youtube is the way to go for help...and...although I don't have it set up yet...this device can be used as a phone when properly set up...will be doing that on the next visit to Grammy's!

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this to drivers, readers and music/movie funs. This is what I use it for and it works very well for me.It is light, nicely designed and batery lasts more than 8 hours and is good to take on trips.The only thing that i struggle with is glare, but I intend to buy an anti-glare screen protection and it should solve the problem.Thank you!

Reviews.Title: I do not recommend this product.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "John"
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge google fanboy but this product is garbage. Major battery/charging issues. If you do a few google searches you'll discover it wasn't just bad luck but actually it's a known issue with the 1st generation. I'm going to try my luck with the 2nd generation, I sure hope it won't be another regretful mistake.

Reviews.Title: Good item, Poor listing by Amazon
Reviews.Author: Jedidah
Reviews.Content: My issue is not with the product but with how Amazon posted it. It came up as a 2013, its actually a 2012. Disappointing. I was going to send it back for the 2013 but this would be the 3rd time canceling an order and repurchasing because the first time I got it, it did not have a MicroSim port, and that was not mentioned in the item description. As if that was not frustrating enough, I talk to a representative who could not help me because she did not completely understand what I was looking for. I'm done. Don't take descriptions for face value, that's what I'm learning here. Another thing, the box says its a 2013 Nexus, even though the tablet info says it's a 2012!!

Reviews.Title: WIFI problems!!
Reviews.Author: Kawser H.
Reviews.Content: MAKE PROBLEM IN NET CONNECTION!!!!llllll So horrible!!!!  Need good WiFi router. So be careful before purchasing this tab. But all others are awesome.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: TonyaMah
Reviews.Content: The third in our family- very easy to operate and is quick to get on the internet ...replaced my kindle.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Ruby
Reviews.Content: Just as described.  Very easy to use.  I have a Droid phone so everything was familiar.  The size is great!  It will easily fit into a purse or backpack.  Great for traveling.  Fast operating system.  I recommend the Nexus 7 Tablet.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Mugopain
Reviews.Content: this item was new and works great.  using it to run my kegorator.  perfect size.  wish the bezel was thinner though.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: Jose Luis Fernandez
Reviews.Content: very nice piece of tech .  the only thing is the tablet doesnt have flash in the camera.thank you. very fast.

Reviews.Title: Very cool!
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. I take it with me everywhere and it has completely replaced my laptop. For the price, I think this tablet is a great value.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: arthur v.
Reviews.Content: Great tablet. I also have the 10" tablet by Asus and love them both. I got the smaller one for traveling and gaming mostly. A good tablet especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: This is exactly what I wanted.
Reviews.Author: Demosthenes
Reviews.Content: I am finishing college and my laptop finally gave up on me, I thought I would go with a tablet for its replacement.  This tablet doesn't require me to carry a separate backpack like my laptop.Pros:Small but not too small (7" display)WifibluetoothappsCons:no rear facing camera/flashThe next model up addresses my gripes but this tablet is truely great and I will be using it for its lifetime.

Reviews.Title: great product!
Reviews.Author: SDQ 301904 Jose Saint Hilaire Ramirez
Reviews.Content: I gave a 5 star rate to this product because all is like the review said, is new, working just fantastic.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE it
Reviews.Author: Angel Wilborn
Reviews.Content: I bought the WIFI only one and I love it. All my books, games and apps in one place.I use t more than my laptop now.

Reviews.Title: LOVE it
Reviews.Author: Dinar Choudhury
Reviews.Content: this tablet is greatttt. fast clean and perfect sizee. except it doesnt come with a camera app, but i just went to the play store and downloaded and random camera app which worked fine.

Reviews.Title: delivers on every level
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is the tablet you can buy for under $150.00. It's super fast I can run graphic intensive games and not notice frame drops. I love the screen resolution its great for reading ebooks and comics. For the price you really can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Turned on once
Reviews.Author: MD
Reviews.Content: Ordered a like-new tablet from Warehouse Deals and it came on once with the charger then wouldn't come on again. I will be returning! Terrible, because it was a birthday gift.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Tablet
Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: This was a gift from my daughter and I love it.  The size is not too big or too small.  It has a long-life battery that does not need charging every hour and I use it a lot.  The screen graphics are bright and clear.  It functions seamless without lagging.  I absolutely love it!!

Reviews.Title: port quites working - unable to charge - AVOID THROWING YOUR MONEY AWAY
Reviews.Author: Onlisound
Reviews.Content: So disappointed in this Google Tablet purchase - AVOID, IT IS LIKELY YOU WON'T BE ABLE TO CHARGE after just a few months of use. We'd bought a ASUS Google Nexus factory reconditioned (our mistake), and it worked for only 4 months of light use before the port quit charging. A google search (ironic, I know) reveals literally thousands of other users that encounter the same problem. The only solution is a very expensive repair (which will only restore it to the original flawed design) or to purchase a docking station, which has it's own problems and mixed reviews. It may or may not charge unless you sit and hold it down on the charger. On top of that, sellers are scalping users because the problem is so common - docking stations prices have increased from $40 to 70- $95 IF you can find one in stock for the very same, reportedly cheaply made dock. This is a nightmare - we thought we had a great Christmas gift for my grandson, and instead it is essentially trash. Shame on you Asus and Google.

Reviews.Title: NEXUS 7
Reviews.Author: Ron Boni
Reviews.Content: New to the tablet world. I was recommended to get this model, and I'm glad I did. Love the size and the graphics. Now just have to play around till I learn more about it's operation. Direction booklet is useless.

Reviews.Title: Returned this item
Reviews.Author: Mccoy
Reviews.Content: Item was okay, but it couldn't rival the iPad mini. I found its size to be difficult to navigate. The screen quality was good though. Battery life was good.

Reviews.Title: Totally worthless...
Reviews.Author: Timothy A Collins
Reviews.Content: I am now the proud owner of two of these tables that will not connect to the verizon network.  I was led to believe they were by reading through the questions left by the manufacturer.  It was a lie.

Reviews.Title: Customer service sucks
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It worked great for two month then would not boot up , I sent it in to get fixed. I never got a email saying they got it , after two weeks I called to see where it was and no one knew . Now after 3 months the speaker sounds bad . I`am  not going to send back to their repair center and go throw all the hassle I went threw before.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: ANN
Reviews.Content: I really have ad a good experience so far the only problem I encountered was the charger not plugging into the port securely contacted the warranty co I added and they are sending a new one

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: just an average guy
Reviews.Content: Does everything I need to do and the price was also great.  Saw no need for clearer screen and other bells and whistles.  I really only use it for email and surfing net so I may not be a good judge of what a tablet can do.

Reviews.Title: don't leave your Ipad
Reviews.Author: Victoria Harley
Reviews.Content: I traded my ipad in to get this. I had the ipad 2 and it wasnt compatible with my schools online platform. Adobe flashdrive. This tablet is too small for adult hands. I purchased a wifi keyboard and Im hitting delete more than I am typying the actual message. ALSOit has a terrible battery life ! It dies faster than my android phone and I use this tabletr less ! I should have gone for the Ipad mini.

Reviews.Title: Nexus7
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: This is my second  Nexus 7. The first was great , second one just  as  good. Better because of price . JB

Reviews.Title: ASUS Google Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: Nice tablet.  It is very responsive and quick.  The touch screen is just right in sensitivity, not too much or too little.  Google has this setup to automatically update Android operating system and apps to keep it up to date.  Plenty of memory also.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with it
Reviews.Author: rj
Reviews.Content: This was my first tablet. I am a technology professional and bought this just to play around with. I have all the computing power I need with my other devices. I didn't need the feature in the 2014 model ( wireless charge and dual side camera) so I bought the 2012 model for $100 less. Also I only needed the wifi and not data capability. I know linux and am debating whether I should try to root this. So far it has performed well and I have been impressed

Reviews.Title: Too glitchy...should have waited for better platforms to come out.  TERRIBLE FOR MUSIC.
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Works OK most of the time.  Screen is dull...colors aren't nearly as vibrant as iPad.  I've had a couple instances where it won't charge, and I've had to let the power drain until it turns off for it to start charging again.  Very laggy.  Music management and Amazon platform is ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE.  I've never used anything worse and more user unfriendly for managing music.  Shocked that Google/Amazon/Android created such a terrible music platform.  I'm have above average skills with computers and technology, and the music app frustrated me to no end.It works for basic web browsing and reading books / PDF's, but not worth the glitches and practically useless for music listening.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Hazel Joy P Vicente
Reviews.Content: Tablet was bought for my mom and she's quite satisfied.  There was one time the battery was fully drained and we were worried because it could not power up.  After a few minutes of charging plus a little research on Google, we finally managed to power it back on.Very good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Melloschello
Reviews.Content: I got this for my teenager! He loves it! Works great for all he wanted and he was pleased at the quality. He is a big gamer and loves music!

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Juan Figueroa
Reviews.Content: A great tablet, i recomend you, some bugs in SO but its OK; The battery life is good, the screen are very brilliant and you can read outside in a sunny day.

Reviews.Title: overall good
Reviews.Author: Bryan James Adams
Reviews.Content: Had this for 5 months now and have not had a single issue with it.  Always turns on, never glitches and for being a small camera on it it actually takes pretty good pictures.  Only thing i would like more out of it is a rear facing camera and expandable memory, otherwise its a great tablet for the price.

Reviews.Title: pretty fantastimystifyingly great.
Reviews.Author: Zane Zents
Reviews.Content: Works awesome, perfect size, buy it even if you can't afford it. If you are considering a tablet, this one is it!

Reviews.Title: Great little device!
Reviews.Author: Lynnett Villa
Reviews.Content: I just got this little jewel two days ago. I had a nook that was fine, but when my main computer had issues, I ditched it and got a wireless printer and this. So far s good.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: Ruthie
Reviews.Content: I only have the wifi version.  Not sure yet if that was a good idea or not.  I did take it on a recent trip and used it pretty often.

Reviews.Title: best tablet for the price!
Reviews.Author: Dino
Reviews.Content: in that range of price, this tablet is the best. my father learn to use it so quickly and he is very happy as the tablet performs really fast and is more than enough for his use. got all the way upgraded to 4.4 using the update system in it.

Reviews.Title: I like it out of the box, I did not like it after the update
Reviews.Author: Mario Munguia
Reviews.Content: Got it brand new and I like it ,nice for surf  the web, too small for video player,fast, light too many issues with the autorotate screen after the update but works great,love the back leather feeling.�

Reviews.Title: Great Utility and Android OS
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Taylor
Reviews.Content: It works smoothly and functions well. I never thought a tablet could organize my life so well!! The UI is very friendly and it just feels very sophisticated.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Google Nexus 7 - 7-in 32GB, Tablet
Reviews.Author: Brown Sugar
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Google Nexus 7 because a friend recommended it.  I initially had a 7 inch that was 16GB.  This one seems to be much faster.  I had only one problem with it.  There was one website that I pulled up but it would not allow me to click enter.  I haven't tried that website since but will try it again today or tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Hayashi
Reviews.Content: It is just great! thanks a lot! I would like to recommend my friends.I believe that they would like it.

Reviews.Title: responsive, light, and beautiful
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: Everything I wanted in a tablet. Google Play is great, and once I install the F-Droid free software repository I found a bunch of no-advertisement apps as well. I love this thing.

Reviews.Title: must buy!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This tablet is perfect for what I use it for at home and on the go! BUY THIS PRODUCT NOW!

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet
Reviews.Author: David Morgan
Reviews.Content: Aside from an occasional lag in screen orientation, this tablet exceeds my expectations! Tons of storage, awesome screen sensitivity. Pre-loaded apps are just what I need, & downloading is fast. Thanks to my wife (for the gift), Google, & ASUS!

Reviews.Title: Love my Nexus Tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I got my order on time and it works great and I can do everything I expected to do.Very happy with purchase!

Reviews.Title: My favorite piece of technology that I have
Reviews.Author: Catherine Partch
Reviews.Content: This is the best tablet I've ever bought. Definitely better (especially the price difference) than an iPad mini. I'd buy it all over again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: This is an excellent 7 inch tablet. I love it.
Reviews.Author: Victor Ml Espiritu
Reviews.Content: It's screen is sharp. Its microprocessor is fast enough. Its apps are plenty. It's only defect is that it doesn't have a back camera and doesn't have expansion card. But all in all it is an excellent tablet.

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: I M Someone
Reviews.Content: I like it. I traded in my Kindle Fire HD and an older Kindle Touch, which were nice. The Fire HD isn't sold as a tablet, this one is. I was looking to upgrade to a tablet. I like this Nexus 7 very much.  It has 32 GB storage capacity with a quad core CPU and 1 GB of DDR3 ram to boot. It's display is 1280 x 800 and it is fast and downright likeable. I recommend it, especially at the price paid of $159.00.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: sppiseth
Reviews.Content: even it is old version of nexus 7 but quality is better than other tablets of same prices and better specification

Reviews.Title: My only problem was was the yellow tint or the warm colors
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: I was able to play a lot of games flawless and was able to try out the Tegra versions of games that exclusive to the Nvidia Sheild on this tablet but the yellow tint and not as bright screen hold it back for me. I got the 2013 Nexus 7 instead and sold the 2012 because its a bigger upgrade but for now for $160 for the 32gb thats a steal this was a very powerful tablet and after the 4.4.2 it was running as good as the 2013 but like I said it didnt solve the yellow tint and Google wont replace it since its out of stock from them. I got the 2013 which the colors looks a bit more natural a bit of the yellow tint on this one also but not as noticeable as the 2012 edition. I guess Im cursed at getting these Nexus 7 tablets with these bad screens with bad color temperatures but I say get this one, it can still perform well in todays standards of Android tablets and if your not so into wanting high pixels on a small 7 inch screen.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Google Nexus 7, 7-inch, 32GB, Tablet 2012
Reviews.Author: Mattie
Reviews.Content: Gave it to my son as a Christmas gift! He really likes it! it's what he put on his wish list!

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Zakir Millwala
Reviews.Content: I am very well satisfied with the product purchased and the delivery arrived on time which held the key as i had to send the tab to my family back home.The tab is currently working on KItkat where as my LG G2 D802 has still not received Kitkat update....

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Jean M Greis
Reviews.Content: I am able to do everything I want on the Nexus. I bought a keyboard for it and now I barely use my home computer anymore.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Dukagjin Sahatqija
Reviews.Content: I really cannot find anything that I don't like in this tablet. I have chosen the old model of Nexus 7 because it satisfies my requirements at more than reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: So addicting! :)
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I am so glad i bought it.  I've had a few flubs (ex: Once, and only once, i turned it on and all of my widgets had disappeared .This has not happened since and once in very great while it'll kick me off an app.)  I use it all the time ad I love having it for netflix and hulu. :)  I reeeeally wish there was an app for amazon instant video though...I'm sure there's a good reason there isn't but I'm hoping there may be one in the future.

Reviews.Title: Handy
Reviews.Author: Homecare
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this product for value and performance. Great while it lasted but wish it had lasted a little longer. Longer life with lighter to moderate use.

Reviews.Title: great little tablet
Reviews.Author: dallas822
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted to get a tablet for her sister for Xmas and I was given the tapsk of finding one.  To get a 10 inch one name brand you will spend $299-399++ so we quickly decided on the 7 inch variety.  Having owned inexpensive 7 inch tablets, I knew we needed a name brand even though I search through all the knock-offs on amazon.  For the money ($160-185) it is hard to beat the Nexus as compared to Asus, Samsung, Dell, Apple, & Toshiba. Plus the Nexus was highly reviewed & highly recommended by techie friends of mine.  The nexus is easy to use and my sister-in-law loves it.

Reviews.Title: Awesomeness
Reviews.Author: skye
Reviews.Content: It does everything my Ipad could not. I enjoy the compact size of the product itself. I would definitely buy another one for my son/wife.

Reviews.Title: Worked great till
Reviews.Author: James Boylen "jimmy boylen"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is wonderful with its high specs(at the time) and its nexus experience. It did everything I wanted in the perfect form factor. It was working fine until one day for some reason it wouldn't turn on, I left it alone for a while(about a week) and it still wouldn't turn on. It was already out of warranty at this time and sites told me it could be a bad connector inside, I opened it up unplugged and then replugged the battery and it turned on. When I closed it, it was working perfectly but it had no wifi and when I finally got it to connect it only had 1 bar, even directly next to my router I only got 2. This product works perfectly until you try to fix it yourself. Overall 3-5

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I got my Nexus 7 on March 6, 2014 and I am pleased with it. I have had no problems with it, I watch a movie on and the quality of the movie was crisp, I plan on taking this some time when I go camping this summer to watch movies on it so I don't have to take my laptop, the battery life has been go so far but I really won't worry about that since I can recharge it at the campsite or by my power inverter. Well worth the money I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet for your buck
Reviews.Author: Nephtali Valdez
Reviews.Content: Bought this at $150, remains one of the best products I have ever bought to this day, I must say I get more use out of this bad boy in comparison to my Surface 2! Must buy!

Reviews.Title: Its exactly what i expected
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Santos Tejada
Reviews.Content: I bougth this to my brother, and he's practically in love with it!! He says its more than he wished it would have been

Reviews.Title: Good basic tablet
Reviews.Author: kathyt
Reviews.Content: Needed an easy to use but reliable tablet to primarily check and send emails when traveling. Was recommended by my son-in-law  and he was so right.My first experience with the android operating system and touch screen - but finding it easy to use after initial help setting it up.Picture quality is excellent and I know I will be trying more apps in the future.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Google Nexus 7, 7-Inch, 32GB, Tablet, 2012
Reviews.Author: RLT44
Reviews.Content: I purchased the tablet some time ago for my wife...she uses it every day, several times a day. WORKS GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Carol Oliver
Reviews.Content: Love the tablet. Not too thrilled about the battery life. Takes over 12 hours to charge when 11 months old. Called their customer service and no one was understandable. Asked to talk to a supervisor and they didn't have one there and they would have one call me. Returned my call over a week later and I wasn't home so I haven't heard since. That was 2 months ago. What good is customer service if you can't understand them and they don't get back to you?

Reviews.Title: very good product
Reviews.Author: Pablo Esquivo
Reviews.Content: The  table looks and work perfect, The time was spend to delivery was very fast.I have some problem with the usb cable, some in the mini usb dont put easily in the table. One of the security pins are stacked. The cable doesnt work fine

Reviews.Title: SSD memory corrupted after 16 months
Reviews.Author: Matt A
Reviews.Content: I bought this 32GB first gen N7 in November 2012 when the 32GB was first released. It's really the perfect little tablet for media consumption. The screen is also a great size for games, it handled Angry Birds, Candy Crush and the other addictive games in the last year and a half without a problem.More recently I'd been using it as a kitchen clock and web browser to look up recipes and letting it sit on the Nexus 7 dock when not in use. This is when I started noticing that it would restart every so often, about a month of this and now it comes up with a screen asking for a password to decrypt the tablet. After searching the problem Google help told me this was a common problem and that Android couldn't read the SSD and thus assumes that encryption is turned on and asks for the password. Sometimes restarting it again brings it back to normal, other times not. It got worse and worse though to the point that now it restarts every 30 seconds loading the home screen and having several apps crash. I did a fresh restore back to stock Android, deleting all my information, as Google suggested. This seemed to work for all of about an hour. Now it's back to restarting non-stop. At this point I've had the tablet for 16 months. The original warranty was 12 months and the problems starting creeping up around 14 months. I was planning on getting more Nexus 7 tablets and even have a larger ASUS android tablet and 10" ASUS Windows 8 tablet but after this I'm not buying another ASUS product again. At first I bought a C720 Chromebook to replace the Nexus 7 with but after getting two units that would shut off randomly I went to the HP Chromebook 11.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: M. Gaines
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a gift for daughter this is a great gift. She has loved this from day one. . .

Reviews.Title: Great tablet at an amazing price!
Reviews.Author: Veronica Fabila
Reviews.Content: This tablet met my expectation of what I was expecting and more. It's very fast, no lag at all. Has great features. There's no sd card slot but that makes no difference to me since thus tablet has 32 gb of memory because that is plenty for what I need. The size is nice, not too bulky, not too slim. The sound quality is better than I expected, it's pretty loud. The price is amazing, well worth every penny. I highly recommend this tablet. You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Hannah
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 is really fabulous. And I really like Google. The only reason I am rating a 4 and not a 5 is a. the text-to-speech voice is AWFUL. b. there is a weird permanent streak on my screen. I bought it used, so that it probably the issue, but it irks me a little.

Reviews.Title: It's a good tablet, but...
Reviews.Author: antonio espinoza
Reviews.Content: It's a tablet that works well, but I have problems with the charging connector. Sometimes charge, sometimes not. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: ispeedca
Reviews.Content: For the price 179$ its great. However i would get an asus memo pad hd 7 instead just because of the price difference.179$ vs 129$.It seems faster then the memo pad but still i would go for the cheaper version.

Reviews.Title: Worked for a little while
Reviews.Author: Alexander Paul Kleinheider
Reviews.Content: The rating is for the tablet's usage, whether it worked or not. Ok so I bought this and only worked for a couple days then it just wouldn't turn on. Got my full refund and quick but for the time I used the tablet it was amazing. Best tablet I've used hands down. I've used iPads for a long time and this one just blew my mind. The level of customization is insane. To me better than Galaxy Tabs and iPads.

Reviews.Title: I Love it.
Reviews.Author: Manuel T. Castor
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine got the newer Nexus 4, but I am finding my still very useful and I use it all the time. Not only would I recommend any of the Nexus series but I would insist that they purchase them

Reviews.Title: Nice gift
Reviews.Author: Noriko Blalack
Reviews.Content: Great! It was a nice gift to my grandson. I am sure he is enjoying the tablet on daily activity.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Jodi
Reviews.Content: This is our THIRD Nexus 7. We really like this product ( can you tell). It's incredibly user friendly.  We bought them to be used as e readers......we hardly ever use them for that now!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: NCgirl62
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this product.  I received it as a gift and I like it so much I bought this one as a gift to give to someone else.  The price compared to others is awesome.  Also has a great battery life!  Buy it!!!

Reviews.Title: tablet
Reviews.Author: alicia otto
Reviews.Content: My tablet is working good, but I owned one before but it got broke and this tablet replaced it so I could use it for school

Reviews.Title: It quits after four months
Reviews.Author: Armando Sencio "computer starter"
Reviews.Content: I seems to like it at first, but had difficulty configuring many programs since I'm overseas, wi-fi connectivity problem and costs, then four months later it does not power up anymore.  I bought this tablet due to recommendation from my shipmate, for the price I paid of $204.00 warranty should be beyond a 30-day period.  I still have to deal with customer service whatever they will say, I'm afraid I may end up with this high price product considered junk and will not work anymore.

Reviews.Title: fast processer
Reviews.Author: DEXTER /T'DAD, W.I.
Reviews.Content: sharp pictures, fast browsing, smooth back-  no more messy finger prints.much better quality than the the matricon tablet by nero , which I had before and up to this day the screen is totally frozen.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 - take 2
Reviews.Author: Angelique M. Armstrong
Reviews.Content: this is actually a replacement tablet, purchased to replace the refurbished model that was purchased in August and died in December.i chose to get another 2012 model because a) i have 3 cases for it and the 2013 requires a different case, and b) i don't use the tablet for photos so a front-facing camera isn't a requirement... nor is the lighter weight. it surprised me how quickly i became addicted to having the Nexus 7, and how miserable I was for the 2 months I was without. the amount ASUS wanted to charge to repair was more than buying this unit (with higher storage capacity, even).this is a good, solid device that i highly recommend if you're just getting into the world of tablets or looking for a good quality tablet for a child.

Reviews.Title: nexus google
Reviews.Author: Lucy Aceves
Reviews.Content: I rate it at a 2 because it turns off and i have a very hard time turning it back on again. Please note, i treat it with care, it is out of reach of children, never has it been dropped. I always have it in a case. Not sure if its a glich.

Reviews.Title: great tablet, but where are the updates to kit kat
Reviews.Author: phillip smith
Reviews.Content: this tablet is everything they say it is. clear beautiful screen, fast and easy to use. Yet its feb13 and i still have not been updated to kit kat. anyone else having this issue.??

Reviews.Title: Best 7" tablet for price
Reviews.Author: W. Dibble
Reviews.Content: While the Nexus 7 (2012) is now over a year old, the tablet is very powerful. Being a Nexus device makes it all the more tantalizing. If you like HTC's Sense, or Samsung's Touchwiz, that's good and all for you, but I prefer the clean Android experience. The stock Android interface makes it a fantastic bit 'o hardware out of the box, and the battery is in good shape. My mom's had hers a year now.Now for the bit that I like. I'm an Android modder at heart. I value devices that are as open as possible, and the Nexus 7 is a perfect device in that regards. You can compile your own Android flavors easily for it, or download just about any ROM on the market. Furthermore, that makes it perfect for developing apps as well.The bad? Well, no rear-view camera, and that's about it. To be fair, I almost NEVER use the rear-facing camera on my Nexus 10, but being able to use it for photosphere would be nice.

Reviews.Title: best tablet on the market
Reviews.Author: karyn wilson
Reviews.Content: I love my Nexus. I use it 24/7 literally. The app market is great, the tablet runs multiple apps at a time without slowing or freezing, it is easy to transfer extra files to a computer to free up storage or to import files, the speaker is nice & loud, & I have never completely filled my storage space even after I downloaded an extensive music collection, books, apps, and pictures. The camera is nice but I wish it was on the backside. I was able to use it to take video during a flight for my mother & it turned out nice but obviously not as good as a digital camera. There are many free apps to choose from on the market. If you are looking for a few starter apps to try I reccomend chef tap (recipes), bulba the cat (game), duolingo (teaches Spanish) & season zen HD (wallpaper).

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet!
Reviews.Author: JHaveman
Reviews.Content: This 7 inch tablet has been a lifesaver. Its very portable, and at the same time is much more effective and convenient than a smartphone. The tablet is well built and functions smoothly. Software is upgradeable to the new 4.3 kitkat OS and runs it well. The only disadvantage I have found is that I wish I could get more life out of the battery.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I chose this tablet.  The screen is sharp.  It was a good price and it immediately updated to the newest Android version.

Reviews.Title: Very good tablet
Reviews.Author: Lena Carlson
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I wanted to try something different from my iPad 2, which I still love. The Nexus can do things the iPad can't like native floating video, floating browsers, emulators, some better apps like trackers (music making software). The only thing I don't like is the storage space. I rooted my Nexus just to be able to transfer freely between my external hard drive and the tablet, and somehow that messed up its ability to read the hard drive at all. One thing I really liked was that the model I bought let me plug in my Wacom Bamboo Fun Pen & Touch to draw in Sketchbook Pro.

Reviews.Title: Late review
Reviews.Author: James Kight
Reviews.Content: Bought this one a while back, just didn't write the review.One small complaint is the lack of auto rotate. Not really a big deal, because there's an app on google play that will allow this tablet to rotate, just seem like it should have been already on the tab.My wife uses this thing daily, posting to FB, reading email and what not, she loves it. Fast enough to do everything she wants, and with the built in 32gbs she has tons of room left.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: Does everything I need in a tablet, not quite as fast as the new 2013 version, but this is very affordable and can run any app that I've come across.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Google nexus
Reviews.Author: Brian "LabRat"
Reviews.Content: Love this product. Runs great. Tried using to replace kindle, but in the end it can't beat the e-ink, the screen still hurts my eyes. Great also to keep the kids busy. I utilize it instead of my laptop where ever possible.

Reviews.Title: Fantasticly Wonderful
Reviews.Author: mike mcconnell
Reviews.Content: It is just what the doctor ordered. I had a Nextbook tab and it was locking up more than anything else. My new Nexus 7 has cured me of all the headaches I was having and so much more. Download speeds are great and the graphics unbeaten. To say I love it would be an understatement. Thanks Asus! Another job well done...

Reviews.Title: just the right size.
Reviews.Author: carla weaver
Reviews.Content: I am still learning what my new tablet can do.  It appears to work great and is a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: Good small tablet
Reviews.Author: L. Powell "geekgoddess"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this on a whim in December 2013 through Groupon.  I got a good deal!  So far it has preformed quite well.  It updated itself to the latest 4.4 version of android within a very short time of owning it.  It is pretty speedy and although I don't use it every day it has been performing well.  I would recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Carlos Franco
Reviews.Content: The nexus 7 is a powerhouse I knew this when I bought it. It has a 1.2ghz tegra 3 quad-core, 1gb of ram, and up to 32gb of storage. It does have a front facing camera but to be honest I'm not a fan of that my GS3 has a better front cam and the other thing I don't like is that the memory isn't expandable, I would've liked to add a SD card but it's not an option. Those may seem like big faults that would require a lower rating but this tegra 3 quad-core is super smooth even better than my friends iPad 3 so for that alone I still give it 5 stars super awesome tablet!

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: D. Delisle-mccartney
Reviews.Content: Great tablet at a reasonable price.  I love it.  Great for e-mails, games, reading, calling, watching movies etc.. provided you can connect to a router.  A true quality product.

Reviews.Title: bad product without a reasonable life span
Reviews.Author: Sergio Viana
Reviews.Content: The life of the tablet did not reach one year.  Now is dead after 8 month of use.The touch screen does not have good sensitity and the plug to connect the tablet and charge the battery is weak, so after 5 month of use started the problems to keep the conection and charge the battery.Too slow to start up.The updates of the operative system did not work well. After every update, the operation became more slow and the settings were changed without notice.The technical support is not good (at least out of USA). Some European countries do not have any service centerDid not have frontal camera

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet under 200 dollars
Reviews.Author: AmazonReviewer
Reviews.Content: I love this Tablet!! It is very portable, light and Fast. The games are very HQ and it is nice for reading books as well. This fitted my needs Perfectly.ProLightPortableSmallCheapConsNo front facing camera(The 2013 Nexus 7 has 1)Doesn't take micro sd cardNo very high quality CameraBattery Life

Reviews.Title: Amazon is best place to shop.
Reviews.Author: seuwema
Reviews.Content: I recommend this tablet to everyone who needs one. very amazing.  I received it as promised by amazon. great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Love it....
Reviews.Author: Tina Cotto
Reviews.Content: My kids take it everywhere we go. They love it.. It truly has made trips alot more easier. lol Thank goodness for these tablets

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS THING!!
Reviews.Author: Hali Burley Price
Reviews.Content: I could not afford the iPad etc. so I found out about the Google Nexus 7. It was a great price, so I ordered it and in fact, ordered one for my husband, too. Merry Xmas, Honey!We do not have cable or regular TV service, but we have internet and wi-fi. It is the perfect device to carry around with you - to listen to music, to read email, to check Facebook.
