I must say that since I gave the Nexus to my wife, I'm using it more than I'm using my Ipad 2. In fact, I'm thinking about abandoning my Ipad altogether!

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Bonita L. Roberts
Reviews.Content: Product met expectations. It is ludicrous to demand a certain number of words be typed into this space. Two more.

Reviews.Title: Rock Solid Android Tablet
Reviews.Author: K. Culp
Reviews.Content: I bought this at a local retailer. Highly recommend, I've owned a couple of Android tablets over the last year... this is by far the best one. The price of the 32GB recently dropped down to the same level as the 16GB, although for most people 16GB is probably enough. If in doubt (use games, plan to store lots of media) go for the 32GB model. I decided to do the 32GB because there is no expansion slot. In general, I try to stick with the "Nexus" on the phone as well because these units get updated from Google directly (at least for a 2 year period in the case of my phone). Of course, the first Android tablet I got only had about 6 months of updates (won't name the brand). My other tablet was 7 inch and this was my "sweet spot" as I can handle it easily etc. My adult kids have big iPads and the recent mini was somewhat attractive to me. Actually, I bought 2 of these (spouse) and my wife who is technically impoverished did fine with this as she has been using the Android phone. It really boils down to your ecosystem and we've leaned toward Android over the last 2-3 years. Not a retina display, but much higher resolution than the iPad mini, also this unit has a quad core processor and 1GB RAM. I can honestly say it is smooth as butter and we are happy with both Nexus 7 tablets. If you don't have any investment in the Apple line, definitely save some money and get the Nexus... I would say the 32GB Nexus is about $130 cheaper than a 32GB iPad mini and you will be happy with it. Do get yourself a gmail account (free and really a must as it integrates a lot of the things you do on the tablet - although I sync with a email/calendar server (Microsoft exchange) at work with no problem. Some new features of Android 4.2 (as of this writing) are Google Now (a Siri like program), and a "gestures" keyboard (a must as I hate tap typing on a keyboard - with this you "slide" your fingers to each letter and it is much faster). Screen brightness, battery life, Wifi ease of use etc. all are excellent. High quality materials - especially the glass - speed and ease of use easily match the Apple iOS tit for tat.

Reviews.Title: Still not sure
Reviews.Author: David W. Hunt "Skipper"
Reviews.Content: The best feature is the ability to dictate search requests to Google.  The voice recognition is very good, and very fast, and far better than SIRI.  But the results are stuck on a small screen.The Nexus 7 is very fast for Google searches using the installed Chrome browser.The NOW feature seems somewhat helpful, so far for me primarily for appointments, weather and traffic home.  Note that it is VERY hard to turn NOW on if you do not do so during the initial set up (check for on-line tutorials AND additional instructions if you want to, since the NOW option is in a tiny menu hidden under a keyboard if it is not activated).  I suggest you activate it during set up and turn it off later if you don't like it.I had higher hopes for using the Google Maps application on Nexus 7 on the road, but it is usable even without active WIFI and is does give turn-by-turn directions.  You must download the relevant map area, which is not an intuitive process, and the range of the map is limited.  But the real problems are:(i) You must select your route while connected through WIFI, since it cannot create a route without a data connection. You must plan your final destination before leaving WIFI coverage. DONT fully exit the application on the road, or you cannot get the route back - you can suspend it.(ii) As far as I can tell, it does not allow a route to more than one location.(iii) Dynamic rerouting works once you gave a route, but it is not very resposive - it did have the better route than a Garmin once, but you must wait quite a while.  Also, the maps stopped scrolling as I drove.(iv)  Be very careful, since it does NOT incorporate HOV restrictions and tried to route me on a restricted route.(v)  Also, forget about POIs on the road.  But with a WIFI connection, there are some good searching map-based searching tools.Speaking of the screen, for some reason Nexus 7 will not change to landscape mode except for videos and Skype.  It would be much better to have an unlimited ability to change from portrait to landscape to blow up text on the screen.The video playback of Ice Age (included for free) failed on several attempts.  It appears Nexus 7 does not have a very good WIFI antenna.  Playback quality was just ok with a great connection.The one speaker is almost useless - poor sound, low volume, wrong place for a movie.Skype was spotty, probably due to the weak antenna, although it did work very well once.  The pictures of me looked even worse than normal for Skype since the camera creates high contrast images, with lighted areas of my face washed out and shadows totally black.  The pictures of were very small due to the extreme wide-angle lens, which might be just as well given how bad they looked.  Also, you are forced to use landscape mode on Skype, so your camera is on the side - that is a real pain.You can access most Amazon contact using free apps.  Google refuses to allow Flash 9, so you cannot play Amazon movies or see animated radar maps, and who knows what else.  I find this totally unacceptable - an obvious attempt to force you to use the Google Play Store exclusively for movies.Be aware that the device requires you to sync up to a Gmail account for many features.  When you do, you have total Google integration either forced on you (Gmail/Gmail Calendar), or immediately available (Google+).  Good, if you want it.The Google Play Store demands to save a credit card to the Google Wallet on the Nexus 7 even to downlaod a freebie.  I do NOT trust the Nexus 7 to have my credit card number.  The device is not secure.  I am not sure I will ever buy from the Play Store as a result.The Nexus 7 can track your location using GPS, or by triangulating your position from known WIFI locations (a feature available on Google maps).  So, even though it is not able to use cell towers to figure your location like a phone, it may have a rough fix on you.  Decide if you want the Nexus 7 to collect this much information about you, which I am sure it will send to Google.  It can be turned off.The Nexus 7 is good about warning about many privacy issues when you load an app, but there are no details and it is not obvious how to selectively disable features of an app, assuming you can.  You have to wonder about the apps based on all the warnings.There are tow totally annoying ads from the Google Play Store on the home screen by default.  TO DELETE THEM, hold your finger on the ad, at which point an "X" will appear at the top of the screen - drag the ad to the X and it and all of its progeny are gone.  However, the top half of the home screen will remain blank und unusable.  If you add more than three shortcuts and one widget, you end up with a two page home screen, each of which is largely blank.There is no way to put the device into screen off mode to save the battery.  The default time is really short, and if you increase it through settings you basically have to live with more battery drain all of the time or turn it off entirely.The Nexus 7 takes some time to start up from off mode, no time from the screen off mode. The device is normally on all of the time, with just the sceen off.So, while I like it, I am concerned about privacy issues, quite disappointed about the Google Maps integration, annoyed by the refusal to allow landscape mode on demand and the insistance on Skype in landscape mode, annoyed by the Play Store ads and the loss of home screen when they are deleted, totally annoyed by the refusal to allow Flash 7, and disappointed by the poor antenna.  I may or may not keep it.

Reviews.Title: Form and Function!
Reviews.Author: MPBenR
Reviews.Content: Thus far, this tablet fits my bill. It's compact, powerful, attractively made, and very affordable. The google Play store doesn't receive the credit it deserves - there are so many good apps and having an android device already, I have wonderful access to reliable, dependable, quality applications. I was concerned over the 7" screen size, I'll admit, as I'm a student using the device first for reading and second for goofing off. Text books are very readable and easy to access with any number of powerful apps (Kindle, Play Books, Adobe Reader...) and novels are no harder to look than on any other LCD screen of comparable devices; that said, I can't say it reads like E-Ink but I dont mind for one!For this price and with a good battery life of 10-11 hours of reasonable use, it's perfect for a student on the go.The Tegra 3, 2gb internal memory, and 32gb of storage in addition to limitless cloud storage assuming you have access to WiFi which is very fast on this device, i must add, give it solid futureproofing.iPad? Not badNexus 7?New Kid on the Block; New Cool Kid on the block.

Reviews.Title: All you need
Reviews.Author: Raymond Marx "Space Trucker"
Reviews.Content: This one for all tab is all but, perfect. It will do for all but, large tasks and as more and more comes on the Play Store for it, it becomes even better and better. The only regret I have is, I didn't get the 10"! Now if I can only find a great base for it, that has a speaker and USB ports.

Reviews.Title: Battery DoA
Reviews.Author: Jason L.
Reviews.Content: I bought the Asus Nexus 7 32 GB Tablet as a Christmas gift for my father.  As soon as he tried turning it on by holding the power button for a few seconds the unit would not start.  I told him he probably needed to charge the Tablet for a few hours before being able to use it unplugged.  He charged the unit and when he he unplugged, the unit would just not power on.  It would only work when the power adapter was plugged in.I am RMAing the unit through ASUS and we'll see how the returned unit works.  Also, ASUS didn't provide anything for shipping fees and shipping materials.  I have to ship the unit when it returns BACK to my father as well.  What a big disappointment purchasing this product has been.  Will update.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 32g
Reviews.Author: kurt3228
Reviews.Content: My wife has been wanting a tablet for quite a while now. We were out with friends and they were talking about the IPad tablets they each had. I'm not an Ipad fan or Iphone for that matter. I had been looking at and comparing many tabs out there and ran across the Nexus lineup. I was really surprised at the specs and reviews (especially the ones that rated the Nexus above the Ipad mini). So after lunch with friends we went to the store that had a great price on the Nexus and I purchased the 32gig 7 for my wife's birthday, without here knowing of course! When we got home I put all of her information into it which loaded her apps, set up the wifi and it was ready to go.Pros: Very fast, clean look, great battery life, picture is amazing. I would definitely recommend this tablet, also since it is a Google/Asus product, updates are guaranteed unlike updates from other manufacturers running the android system. The Jellybean 4.1 system is smooth, fast and simple to use.Cons: There is no slot for a SD memory card, I don't know why although 32 gigs is should be enough. I probably should have dropped the extra $50 and got the one with network capabilities ( I found out later that you can purchase one from google that is unlocked and with AT&T; sim card for $299). No data plan or contract required! These weren't available at the time. I was able to purchase an app called tablet talk that lets the tablet function as a phone and you can text message with it using your cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Simply Awful
Reviews.Author: mg111
Reviews.Content: After making the decision over two years ago to go with Google, I recently decided to stay with Android for a tablet. After researching tablets, trying a few and considering value for the dollar I settled on the Nexus 7. HUGE mistake. First I have now had TWO of these tablets as the first one was defective out of the box. The first had some buffering issues and a defective headphone jack. I've now had the replacement for a couple of days and have found the headphone jack is also defective on this one. Multiple pairs of headphones tried, all of which work perfectly fine in other devices.The second major issue is the buffering. Watching a standard definition video,, high definition, doesn't matter. CONSTANTLY buffering. I'm fairly tech savvy and have been trouble shooting and adjusting settings. Checked the wireless signal which is rated excellent and has no issues with other devices and is only a problem with the nexus. Needless to say this one will be returned and I'll be getting a refund.If considering venturing into the android tablet market go with a quality brand such as Samsung. If you're not sold on Android go with an iPad. But whatever you do don't waste a dime on this junk by Asus

Reviews.Title: Worked well
Reviews.Author: eric hunter
Reviews.Content: Till I broke my screen. Otherwise worked great! Now I am trying to decide if I should replace the screen on it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: D. M. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I previously had purchased a Nexus 7, so I decided to purchase another for my husband.  After plugging it up to charge the battery, it only blinked and would not charge.  I had to return it.

Reviews.Title: Slow shipping and suspect battery
Reviews.Author: S. Meiers "tekrytor"
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 is great but it seems this the battery is not holding a charge nearly as well as my wife's Nexus 7. I suspect these 2012 models batteries are aging. The shipping was also slow.

Reviews.Title: Ugh
Reviews.Author: JakeN440
Reviews.Content: Product works but the screen is glitchy and randomly presses spots that i am not, still wondering what to do with it

Reviews.Title: initally great then all down hill!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Initially my daughter loved this device ( she 13 and only had it for about 6 mo).  Had tons of great features BUT then cord would not stay plugged in to make connection to charge then just would not even hold a charge for a couple of hours.  Their customer service center sucks!  Could not be of any help said I could pay to send it in then would 90-150$ to fix it depending on problem. And take up to 2 weeks to turn around. Would not promise it would be fixed or replaced.  We had on similar problem with a kindle and there were no questions ask they shipped us a new one before the old one was ever returned and never had another problem.  Wish all apps we on kindle that are available on nexus it would totally not be question in my mind replace it.

Reviews.Title: Too many issues to use on a regular basis.
Reviews.Author: cb
Reviews.Content: When getting ready to purchase this tablet, everything about it looked really great. I like the physical design and size. The software used is really great. The fact that it is Google makes it even better, especially for syncing purposes. The problem = there appear to be a large number of defective models in existence. The primary issue with my particular device is instability when it comes to tracking my fingers. This has become so much of an issue that it basically renders the device useless. I bought the device to use as a quick reference with PDFs and other documents, and also to search the internet; the stability issue makes it very hard to actually scroll through documents and typing using the 'swype' function is virtually impossible; additionally, the screen frequently experiences 'phantom touches', causing inappropriate clicking and accidental mistakes. Forget any sort of gaming. Warranty services provided no help. Further research into the issue seems to indicate this is the result of a grounding issue that affected many of the Nexus 7 devices.Likes:- Physical design & size- Software design & syncing abilityDislikes:- Large # of defective models - results in touch input instability- Warranty services: To no avail, I went through a long period of communication with warranty services to try to fix the issue. They finally suggested that I mail the device to their warranty center, which I did and which resulted in $20 out of my own pocket. When I finally got the Nexus back, the only thing that came with it was a sheet of paper that summarized the complications I stated in my claim; there was no indication as to any solution they tried to implement, or if they attempted anything at all. The defect remained unresolved and communications from warranty services ended.- Processing: The device seems to run slow pretty often; however, this may be partly secondary to the grounding issue mentioned previously.

Reviews.Title: Junk! horrible warranty service, major reliability issues
Reviews.Author: Construction pro
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for exactly one year and I regret ever buying it.  I have been very gentle with it and never damaged it.  However, I have had to send it to Texas 3, yes that's right, 3 times for warranty service.  Twice I had to pay shipping to get it there - about $30 worth.  The first time they had to replace a defective gyroscope- it suddenly stopped rotating the screen.  The second time it would continually try to reboot itself.  A complete reset would not fix the problem.  They sent it back saying nothing was found defective, but they obviously reloaded the software because it worked when it came back- for about 1 month.  Then it broke down the third time.  It just suddenly tried to reboot itself and wouldn't quit with the little swirling colored circles on the screen.  It would not even let me complete a factory reset and it stopped even turning itself on.  Each time it breaks down, you have to send the thing to Texas for service.  They keep it for over a week after they receive it, before they ship it back to you.  When they do ship it back, it is Fedex, and if you are not home all day to sign for it you have to go to Fedex to pick it up- a 1/2hour drive each way for me.  The total turn around time each repair is about 3 weeks from the time you ship it out until it arrives back at your local Fedex.  In one year I have lost all my data 3 times, have been without a tablet for 9 weeks total, and now I am awaiting it being shipped back to me the final time.  The thing is, my warranty expired during the time they were working on it, so next time it dies on me- that's it, I'm out my time, money, and data.  Really horrible way to treat an Asus customer!  I have an Asus desktop and 2 first gen Nexus 7's and a second gen Nexus 7.  I doubt I will buy another Asus product.  Beware!  By comparison, I had a Bosch circular saw that died after a year and a half of light use.  It was out of warranty, however Bosch fixed it free of charge and I got it back in exactly 1 week from the day I dropped it at UPS to go to Atlanta.  Asus needs to take a lesson from Bosch on how to do customer service.  Asus, you have lost my loyalty.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: rb
Reviews.Content: I've had this unit for almost 5 months now, and really can't think of any complaints.  The size, video performance, ample storage capacity, and rapid processing all meet my needs quite well (I have not used it for processor-intensive games, so can't comment there).  Given the price drop since the 2013s arrived, it is a great value for the money that does everything it claims to do.  I would buy it again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: Asus Nexus 7 Tablet
Reviews.Author: hornet64
Reviews.Content: Love it !!! It is easy to use and as soon as I started it it updated to Kit-Kat 4.4.2.I would recommend it to anyone who would be interested in this type of tablet.

Reviews.Title: Simply Great!!
Reviews.Author: kokimac
Reviews.Content: It was a really good purchase, I have been using the Google Nexus without any problem at all!, :D :D

Reviews.Title: Returned it for an iPad mini
Reviews.Author: A.Tyler
Reviews.Content: I had to return it.  The OS system is slow, clunky, and felt rushed.  I can not get used to how slow it is, and how often it freezes or force closes.  I am sitting there waiting for apps to open, getting forced closed on.  I thought this was the way to go based on reviews and the price being less than an Ipad mini.  It's not worth the frustration of how this runs, which isn't very smooth.  Save your money and get an iPad mini instead, the operating systems are night and day. The apps feel rushed and cheap, and there isn't that quality you would expect.  I know Apple has there problems too but there app store is just way above anything else.

Reviews.Title: DOA
Reviews.Author: Joseph Bergeron "Brobot"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet and it doesn't even work, I charged it, does't turn on, no google logo, no battery meter for when your android device is dead, nothing! I even called ASUS and they won't replace it, they told me to call amazon, and amazon will only give me a refund

Reviews.Title: Stopped work in less than a month
Reviews.Author: nicko post
Reviews.Content: The device stopped worked in less than a month. I guess i got a bad one, but before the mishap their was nothing much to complain about

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: n. french
Reviews.Content: great tablet for the price, not disapointed at all!  Use it daily!  I got a super deal from Amazon and opted for the 32 mb for a steal of a deal!  I would recomend this to friends, it has worked flawlessly!  very pleased

Reviews.Title: Beware of ASUS
Reviews.Author: Richard G. Shieldhouse
Reviews.Content: I tried the new Nexus 7 out, and fell in love with it's speed, brilliant display, etc. However; two weeks after I got it, the machine refused to charge (a complaint I've received elsewhere).I called ASUS customer support and sent it back to them. (Unlike responsible mfrs., they require customers to pay for shipping.)  Several weeks later, I received no word from. Went to their website, plugged in the RMA number and learned they are awaiting customer response.  Customer response to what?  I called and got a rude agent on the phone who said they don't notify customers of problems.  She said she would escalate the RMA and I MAY OR MAY NOT RECEIVE WORD FROM THEM. I asked when I MAY hear from them and she said they can't tell me that.  2014? 2015?  They can't tell me. (By the time I receive this thing, the 50th iteration of the Nexus 7 will be out.) I've pretty much written this one off. I could have paid a bit more and gotten an iPad Mini, which I could have marched into the Apple Store had I had the same problem. I've learned the hard way that sometimes it's well worth the premium to pay for good customer service. (Like paying $100 more to fly to Europe on Lufthansa, Air France or KLM instead of nickel-and-diming US airline.)  With the Google name on the product, I assumed it would have quality support.  Not necessarily so.  If you buy it directly from Google, Google will support the product.  If you buy anywhere else, you are left with ASUS's worst-in-the-industry customer support. This a black eye for Google.  They need to find another way of producing, selling, and supporting this product.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: John Schlegel
Reviews.Content: It worked well for the first 25 days and then it wouldn't connect to any WIFI.  It was a constant struggle and it wasn't my internet.  I could connect with my laptop and desktop but not the tablet.I loved the tablet itself but they need to work out the kinks.  The customer support from ASUS and Amazon was fabulous and I got to return my product for full price and received a different brand.

Reviews.Title: My Nexus 7 has become an indispensable tool
Reviews.Author: Parker Frontier
Reviews.Content: I got this as an upgrade/replacement for my old Kindle, which finally died. Oh, the Kindle Reader app is excellent, but I've gotten so much more now--the world of Android Apps is incredibly diverse and powerful, and most of it is free. The display and controls of the Nexus 7 are best-in-class, battery life is as good as advertised if not better. It's also great for watching crisp, high definition content from movies and TV to Hulu+.  I'm so happy that I switched, the Kindle seems so primitive an.d limited in comparison

Reviews.Title: But it didn't have an sd card slot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The information on this was vague that it might have an sd card expansion slot.  I know I would love it but I want/need an expansion slot.  Which is why this isn't a Kindle or and (uhhh!!!) iPad.  I want the Android OS and not Win 8.  It has gone back and Samsung Note is the winner

Reviews.Title: BEST DANG TABLET!
Reviews.Author: Chancellor B.
Reviews.Content: BEST. TABLET. EVER.Excellent processor speed, respectable storage capacity, fits perfectly in most jeans' front pockets, so responsive.Only two things disappoint me about this tablet: 1) no microSD slot (which I think is fixed in the new variant? IDK) and 2) it does have a slow start-up time, a little over about two minutes.Beautiful battery life, powerful wifi reception. I love it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for streaming and browsing
Reviews.Author: Jason Akin
Reviews.Content: This is a great form factor and won't break the bank. I've got full-sized iPads, but this fits the hand better and has much more storage for half the price.  The screen is obviously not as big as other tablets, but that's just less letterbox compared to iPad mini.  I had a Motorola Xoom with Android 3 Honeycomb, but Android OS has really arrived with smoother animations and a better look and feel in 4.1

Reviews.Title: one tablet is giving trouble
Reviews.Author: Matthew Beal
Reviews.Content: I buy three tablet two of them is working ok but one is defective it keep shuting off,at one time it took over seven hours to start

Reviews.Title: This thing never worked very good
Reviews.Author: Bill Jennings
Reviews.Content: This thing had problems since I got it.  It ran very slow.I have it for a month and now it will not even power up.

Reviews.Title: Love Google. Love Android OS
Reviews.Author: dharmanurse
Reviews.Content: I bought my Nexus tablet last year on pre-order. This one I bought for my fiancé. Never had any problems with either tablet. I wouldn't buy or recommend any other. I only wish they had the 32 gigabyte version last year when I got mine.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Porras
Reviews.Content: This product is was it was advertised, real good, never owned a tablet before, but this one is a pretty good one.

Reviews.Title: Love my Nexus
Reviews.Author: skottie
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying my Nexus tablet, comparing various tablets and all the features they offered. I decided that overall, the Nexus would work best for me as far as usage and value. Even the sales person at Best Buy didn't try to change my mind and told me where I could buy it locally if I wanted to (since Best Buy doesn't carry the Nexus)! I thought that said a lot. I have been very happy with my Nexus, and it does all that I need it to do and more.

Reviews.Title: already doesnt charge
Reviews.Author: Aaron Campbell
Reviews.Content: ive only had this tablet for a month, it already does not charge, piece of junk, i want it refunded, horrible buy

Reviews.Title: I think it should have a two way camera front & back
Reviews.Author: Tatherree K. Zanders "Reddog"
Reviews.Content: its not compatiable with  adobe , also I only have had it 5mos and having problems its does not come on at all stop working don't kno why

Reviews.Title: Worth it
Reviews.Author: Maverick Top Gun
Reviews.Content: Holds the device firmly with full access to the buttons. The magnet in the cover keeps the front closed and turns the screen on and off when it's taken off. Cheap and very sturdy.

Reviews.Title: Worth the $199 when I bought it.
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Morales
Reviews.Content: At the beginning I was a little unsure about buying a Nexus 7 or an iPad mini. I'm not gonna lie I chose Nexus 7 because of the price not the functionality, after a couple of hours I was convinced this product is really good not excellent yet, but it's really good!It does a lot of things that the iPad doesn't do for example it can show you subtitles if you use .srt files, It can play .avi .mp4 .wmv and any dot you can think of you just have to have patience to look for the proper app in order to reproduce your video files.The video is really really nice, however playing a .mkv the video is very slow and the video doesn't play as smooth as I would like.. so no .mkv , besides that I believe this is a great tablet to anyone who doesn't want to spend a lot of money but still want to have a good product able to do a lot of things that the competition does and more (like the subtitles for example).

Reviews.Title: Great for watching youtube videos in bed!
Reviews.Author: Pepa
Reviews.Content: I'm thinking my elderly mom might even be able to learn how to use this.  Easy to hold for long periods, but wear glasses with UV filter to protect the eyes!

Reviews.Title: Could be better
Reviews.Author: patrick
Reviews.Content: My nexus 7 decided to destroy all of my data one day while I was using the android file transfer program, and my device has gotten very slow ever since then. I called tech support, but even they had no clue why I had this issue, but wanted to replace my tablet. Several other people I have asked about their experience were mixed as well! Wait for a newer one!

Reviews.Title: Most fulfilling purchase in a long time!
Reviews.Author: Angelo N Murano
Reviews.Content: I initially bought this tablet just to have something to do on a long flight.  It was great for that, and now I find myself using it constantly in place of television as I watch Netflix with it.  There is no camera but I intentionally chose it for that reason.  I have a camera for taking photographs so didn't need it on the tablet, and the lower price point without the camera made the Nexus 7 very attractive.  32GB of memory has been more than enough as I've only used 3GB after 1 month of usage.  Just a note that you will actually only have around 27GB to use as the system will be taking up around 5 of the 32GB.  The UI is great.  Coming from an Android phone (the Galaxy S3), the transition to this tablet was seamless as it had exactly the same features that I was accustomed to.  Battery life has been good as well.  It will last around 8 hours with intensive use (continual streaming on Netflix), or 2.5 days with minimal use (occassional checking of email).  It does take quite a while to fully recharge (10+ hours) so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 is the Best Tablet
Reviews.Author: H. Slater
Reviews.Content: I wanted a tablet because I needed to have a larger screen than my smartphone yet still be portable. The Nexus 7 meets those needs and then some. I've had this for about a month now. It's easy to use. I like the auto-rotate feature. I like to keep up with the current news and this is so easy on my eyes when reading, whether it's the latest news or a good ebook. Can even upload photos and videos and share them with others. I also like it for playing games. So much better than on the smartphone. There are lots of great apps in the Google Play store. Many are free. I haven't used the front facing camera so can't comment on that. But it should be fine for hangouts, etc. I can access the internet and social media by turning on WiFi. I have a router at home so internet access is readily available. The sound quality is very good. I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations!
Reviews.Author: alcstein
Reviews.Content: It does everything very well.  Seamless connection with out having to worry about setup.  I have only had it for a short period but I wish it had built in Flash Player and a rear camera.  I read that there is a work-around on the Flash Player, but I haven't tried it out yet. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: 5 STARS
Reviews.Author: Cary M. Christian
Reviews.Content: Love it so far. Just the right size.  I am learning new things that I can do every day - which is marvelous!

Reviews.Title: Taking Time to learn
Reviews.Author: Margaret M leBlanc
Reviews.Content: I like it, but I am still tring to learn all the features. I purchased the book Nexus 7 for dummies

Reviews.Title: Defective!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly James
Reviews.Content: Waste of time and 1 day shipping for me! Seller will not replace, only refund. Only reason I ordered from Amazon was to avoid the ever so evil Walmart. The tablet is great, when it works. My store bought one works great! So the three stars here are for the tablet it self. Would have had all five it my experience was a pleasurable one. Thanks Obama!

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: D. Newton
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my aunt and she absolutely loves it!!  Easily transfers her pictures, videos, and music plus has a clear and crisp look and feel.  It's a great and cheaper choice than the Ipad

Reviews.Title: Best tablet ever
Reviews.Author: Adam Rutledge
Reviews.Content: 1sr let me say I movie this tablet. Pure android so no delay with updates. With its quad core nvidia CPU, makes gaming, streaming video and doing anything a breeze. Has amazing batter life. Then there is the size. It perfect for 1 handed opperation. Reading your magazines and books is a pleasure with this tablet.I would highly recommend this over any android tablet. Why? Price and no bloatware and then there is the instant updates.Go buy it

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: jorvan
Reviews.Content: Asus Nexus 7 is a excellent Tablet. its screen resolution, sound and performance are excellent, however I consider to the camera is not well.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet - Good Value for money!
Reviews.Author: Miss K V Scholts
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet as I had it on loan from someone prior and was very impressed with the ease of use and user friendly interface.Although the iPad battery life is superior this tablet has no need for difficult file conversions to add films to it, is easy to hold and on top is great value for money.Am very happy with this purchase

Reviews.Title: Rerated
Reviews.Author: James J Baum
Reviews.Content: Cannot rate product, because battery would not fully charge, thus it would not turn on. Returned for refund.After attempting to use Nexus 7, I discovered, via internet forums, that battery not charging is a very common problem. There are hundreds, if not thousands, of buyers who experienced similar problems. Buyer beware. Be certain, before purchasing, that you get a favorable return policy; i.e., no charge for returning product, immediate refund upon return. Hopefully, Asus will soon correct the problem, as there seem to be many satisfied users. I will pay a little extra and purchase this item locally.Amended Review. Purchased locally, so that it would be easy to return, if same problem occurred. This time, everything about Nexus 7 just as I expected. Would recommend to anyone not expecting a large screen iPad type instrument. (This time I got 16 GB version. Can use USB flash drive if need more storage).

Reviews.Title: Best tablet I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Juan "Combo Breaker!"
Reviews.Content: To be completely honest it is my first tablet...  Bought one for my wife during Christmas and I fell in love with it too.  After fighting over her tablet I decided I needed one of my own.  I love the seamless Google integration, I know it id's the Google nexus, lol...  It is the perfect size to watch movies on Netflix, read books on my kindle app and surf the web.  My arm never gets tired of holding it.  I give the nexus 7 tablet five stars for getting it right!

Reviews.Title: Ex Ipad 3 user
Reviews.Author: Antonio Fermin
Reviews.Content: This tablet is too good to be true, as an EX iOS user I must say its by far better than the Ipad mini and Ipad3. Shipping was great also. You've earned 5 stars :)

Reviews.Title: Great so far, need futher improve.
Reviews.Author: Caixinzhong
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 is great as any other tablet, but it has no back camera, which means it can't use some of the camera require APPs from GOOGLE PLAYSTORE, slightly disappointed.Other than that, it is much more responsive than other tablets I used before, screen looks great too,

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This tablet is everything I expected from reading the specs/ reviews on the internet and even more. I was taking it everywhere with me.Sadly the screen broke one day I put inside my pocket and flex a little bit. I do have a cover/protector but I had taken it off tha day. The screen replacement is pretty expensive, so I'm waiting to get a good deal on it, I'm actually considering upgrading from the wifi only to the 3g version and sell the repaired tablet later to a friend!Seriously! this tablet is amazing! you just need to be careful not to drop it or do what I did since the screen is a bit on the fragile side! I recommend it,

Reviews.Title: Refreshng to use new OS
Reviews.Author: Gary Wood
Reviews.Content: Its embarassment of plenty.  I didnt realise how tired I was of Windows.This tablet is fun. Also have the Nexus 10 now

Reviews.Title: Asus Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: S. Arbuckle
Reviews.Content: I ordered a Nexus 7 when they first came out and returned it within a couple of days.  The current version is much better with many new features.  I've had the new I-Pad and also returned it as well.  I've yet to try the new Win 8 tablet but I've yet to find a 'do all' tablet.  The best bet is a small laptop like my Asus 1215B or the new primebook.  I have a Nook HD+ and not much difference in size but a lot of difference in capability.  Because of different formats and some companies dedicating to IOS or Andriod but not both best select based on what you want to get to on a tablet.  No Flash on IOS made is lest usable to me - the pure Andriod works more often than the IOS.  My overall favorite tablet is the Nook HD+ (my 3rd Nook from Color to Tablet to HD+)  however, using my Nexus 7 to make phone calls over Google Voice is pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: JuanMiguel
Reviews.Content: This is the best tablet on market, simply awesome. the only thing i punt on it was a rear camera

Reviews.Title: Best bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Sjpp71
Reviews.Content: It is definitely the best Android tablet in the market, as of today. It is fast (mark: 12888, according to AntuTu), the right size for a portable device this category (I haven't had an iPad, in fact this is my first tablet, and I guess a bigger tablet wouldn't be so comfortably to hold in your hands for, say, 2-3 hours). The display is very good, great resolution. No, it doesn't have expansion slot for SD card, which would have been nice (and I defnitely would have given it 5 stars!), but the 32 gb kind of compensate  (nor it has hdmi port, but i can trade these features off for the cuad core and the 32Gb). Battery performance is quite good, you can browse the web, tweet, facebook, all day long with one charge. Recharge time: aprox 2,5 hours (don't know if it is too long or something, it's my first tablet as I said...). I like it that I can connect it to a PC and copy my stuff, without requiring any program to synchronize or something else. In conclusion, If you are looking for a budget, powerfull, 7'' tablet, look no further. It's been a month since I have it, no complains at all, nothing to regret!.

Reviews.Title: a must have if you like to read e-books or surf the web from your handheld devices
Reviews.Author: AHostileBanana
Reviews.Content: I had been spending a lot of time reading e-books on my 4-inch android phone and surfing the web on the phone's mobile browser. I had been hesitant to buy a tablet since the phone code do just about everhthing the tablet can do - but now that I've bought the device I'm very glad I did. The extra screen space is fantastic for reading, surfing, and playing games, and it is a perfect size for one-handed-use. It's also just big enough to make a good netflix viewer in your lap in bed or in a hammock, etc.Using Chrome on the Nexus 7, Droid Bionic, and my windows 7 laptop is a fantastic experience.One temporary problem: Android 4.2.1 has broken bluetooth audio support, so you'll need wired headphones until they release a patch.

Reviews.Title: nexus
Reviews.Author: Elaine Ireland
Reviews.Content: great bought it for my daughter and she loves it, uses it most of the time instead of her lap top

Reviews.Title: The perfect tablet if invested into android
Reviews.Author: ronisize15
Reviews.Content: I am invested in android apps with my phone so it made sense I stayed with an android tablet. I also didn't want to spend for the price of an ipad mini. If you use an android phone I think it only makes sense to go with this tablet. The kindle fire hd requires you to maybe repurchase apps you already paid for since it doens't have the google playstore. Which I have an issue with. This or the 16 gb are  incredible depending how much space you need. Does have a down side of not having expandable memory but 32 has been enough for me so far. I have half left after downloading all my apps which include large file games. I still have about 14 gb left. I use music through google music stream and of course internet radio. Unless you are a root master and know how to make the cheaper tablets awesome,  go with this. I got a zeki prior because of it's lower cost and ability to flash the play store and it still was in the end awful.  Having this is a total difference and worth the 100-150 dollars more. Also I personally prefer the 7 inch tablet to a 10 inch because I think it easier to hold in bed and also easier to hold to play games. Overall very pleased and even thinking about using it with a wireless bluetooth keyboard to do my online college work on the go with google docs.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Tablet
Reviews.Author: Mark N
Reviews.Content: Great quick Android Tablet. would be nice to have a place to expand storage.Long battery life unless you play a lot of major games, i.e. Angry Birds

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Great tablet my wife loves it she is on it all the time she spends 80% of her day on it.

Reviews.Title: great product!!
Reviews.Author: Elvis R. Dardon "elvis d"
Reviews.Content: i got this for my son and he just loves it.i tried it a couple of times and it works verygood and very fast.We both are happy.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Daniel D Facemyer
Reviews.Content: I could afford it and the ones who received it were proud to own it. For me it is too small.

Reviews.Title: The Best 7 Inch on the market
Reviews.Author: ben
Reviews.Content: here are the reasons the nexus is the best 7 inch on the marketpros-Blazing fast Tegra 3 processor, for you tech junkies thats probably the best one on the market. For the non-techies this simply means this thing is crazy fast-Android Jelly Bean, this is a wonderful OS, and by far the smoothest running OS android has ever produced- Full multitasking, you can run and stop apps all from one screen, this is one of the most convient things about this talet- Full google integration, this means that all future updates will come to the nexus firstcons-no back camera, this is a little problem, not really a big deal but a little annoying-Slightly google proprietary, not nearly as proprietary as the fruit stand company, but kind of annoying-no SD card, but with 32 gigs who caresoverall the nexus 7 is the most advanced and powerful 7 inch tablet and should probably be named the "fruit ninja"

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: Carlos Andres Cardona G
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, this tablet has the right tools to be a practic and really usefull tablet.The lack of, for example, a rear camera, is not actually an issue if you are not used todo take pictures with a tablet.Very much than expected from price. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: This is the best 7" tablet in the market today.
Reviews.Author: NeoEngineer
Reviews.Content: There are lots of great reviews of this tablet on the web.  We love ours and use it all the time.  It does much more than the ipad mini.

Reviews.Title: Perfect form factor for a tablet
Reviews.Author: R. Tai "bigfoot"
Reviews.Content: The 7 inch size is the perfect form factor for a tablet.  Can't beat the price and quality.  The pure android experience from the Nexus line can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: Nice first version
Reviews.Author: Micah
Reviews.Content: It's a nice first version of a Google tablet. It feels very smooth and works great, as intended. Compared with the dominant iPad, there are still some rough edges here and there as well as with 3rd party apps. I'm not quite sure where this fits into my lifestyle yet but it's certainly nice to have!

Reviews.Title: Help!
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Cris
Reviews.Content: I received this as a Christmas gift & I absolutely love it. However whenever I let my son play games on it music exerts from the games are automatically download in my music folder. Does anyone know how to block/stop that from happening.  Thanks in advance.

Reviews.Title: awesome toy
Reviews.Author: Nancy Robinson
Reviews.Content: I love my Nexus 7.it's my favorite toy of all time.it is incredibly capable and can do almost anything I want to. Google now is great. Talking to a browser is so much easier than typing.for the price I don't think you can do any better than the Nexus 7. Although,you should consider whether the 7 inch or the ten inch best suits your needs.I couldn't be happier with my new toy.

Reviews.Title: nice product
Reviews.Author: Carol Staskiewicz
Reviews.Content: easy to navigate and understand. set up not a problem. I am still learning to use it to its full advantage.

Reviews.Title: So gooooood i can't believe it!
Reviews.Author: Frogmo
Reviews.Content: I just love this thing.It is so much better than i expected.Really good battery life, beautiful screen.Easy to use and reliable.

Reviews.Title: Great piece of kit. Shame no flash
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the nexus. Feels solid in the hand and is the perfect size. Smooth swipe action and crystal clear screen. Gps works a treat unlike my galaxy s2.Tiniest gripe would be no flash support but that is the way the market is heading. There are ways around it though....Firefox Beta...Great travel companion.Overall very happy

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet
Reviews.Author: S. Yordy "WebManStan"
Reviews.Content: We examined all 7 inch tablets carefully before deciding on the Nexus 7...and have had no regrets.  Fast.  Easy to set up and configure.  Great screen resolution.  Huge selection of apps.  We're addicted!

Reviews.Title: Asus Google Nexus 7 tablet
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: Awesome product! Love its functionality and extra memory! Easy to use and turns on and off upon opening and closing case.

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: c
Reviews.Content: This tablet is fast, has plenty of memory, is easy to customize, runs android jellybean, and generally makes life much easier/smoother!  I love this tablet =)

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Mamabeal
Reviews.Content: The product arrived just as featured in a timely fashion.  I am excited to see this product in action.  Come on Christmas!

Reviews.Title: I bought it from amazon
Reviews.Author: Santos Martinez
Reviews.Content: About the tablet, it was all I was expecting it was gonna be. 32 gb (actually 28 of free space which is nice) and 7 inches that may be seen like more when you get used to it. I'm giving it 5 stars because amazon didn't let me down with it, the tablet works perfectly, and the google play store has lots and lots to offer. I'm loving it.

Reviews.Title: Great while it lasted, terrible company to deal with afterwards.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This tablet was excellent, but not for long enough to warrant the cost.It was a quick and painless death, though. Just passed away in it's sleep one night.Judging from the myriad articles and videos offering solutions to the black screen problem, I'm guessing it's a common death.Sadly, in the end, none of the offered solutions would resuscitate her. She was gone for good. The grief of the loss exacerbated by the difficulty in tying up her affairs with Asus, who seemed far more concerned that someone had been in her back cover than the fact that she died so young and so recklessly. Save yourself the trouble. She will titillate you, but ultimately leave you too soon and that much lighter in the old pocket book. A not-quite-entire-summer romance.Well conceived, poorly executed, poorly managed afterwards.Save your cash and try another door.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Jacob Whittaker "jacob w"
Reviews.Content: Got it 2 days ago so this is a performance review not a review of long it will last.  The nexus 7 is a powerhouse I knew this when I bought it.  It has a 1.2ghz tegra 3 quad-core, 1gb of ram,  and up to 32gb of storage.  It does have a front facing camera but to be honest I'm not a fan of that my GS3 has a better front cam and the other thing I don't like is that the memory isn't expandable, I would've liked to add a SD card but it's not an option.  Those may seem like big faults that would require a lower rating but this tegra 3 quad-core is super smooth even better than my friends iPad 3 so for that alone I still give it 5 stars super awesome tablet!

Reviews.Title: Nice, but..
Reviews.Author: Abhinav
Reviews.Content: Feels good in hand (unlike the fruit tablet) and has good resolution for 7 inch screen. Responsive and easy to use.Takes too long to charge using USB, haven't tried the wall charger yet. Why? because I'm sending it back. My unit came with blown-out speakers. Hopefully the next one is not defective.I must add that this doesn't have "Gorilla" glass, so you may need a screen protector.

Reviews.Title: Pathetic check
Reviews.Author: Mohammad Shahid Hussain
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 nexus 7 . One is working like gem . The other one charging is not happening .Its completely a pathetic experience  seller /manufacturer is not doing the proper check.

Reviews.Title: doa
Reviews.Author: edward
Reviews.Content: this product was dead on arrival. I need four teen more words. Now i need eight. four three two one!

Reviews.Title: Tthe product was defective
Reviews.Author: Nadiesha
Reviews.Content: Bought my tablet with high anticipation only to receive a defective one. The touch screen simply did not respond! I bought one for myself and one for my husband but only one worked. That's not the bad part, because i understand that one in every 10000 product can be defective. The bad part is that i could not return the product because i bought it, had it delivered to the US and carried it home to Jamaica from there. I am now here in Jamaica with a defective product that i cant return for a refund because amazon is saying that i will have to pay for the shipping; a shipping that will cost almost as much as the item! So amazon sold me a defective product. They get a way scotch free. And I'm out $200.Hhigh way robbery. If you are an international customer, i would encourage you to avoid buying from amazon because they do not look out for you. Only Americans can get justice from amazon, everyone else is on their own!

Reviews.Title: Worst tablet ever!
Reviews.Author: Kevin L Colebank
Reviews.Content: It took 24 hours and 30 minutes to charge! It only lasts about an hour and a half on full battery life! Plus the apps kept crashing! Now I can't even turn it on! This is the worst tablet by far.

Reviews.Title: nexus appalling service
Reviews.Author: gsysps
Reviews.Content: bought nexus 7 in feb 2013 by April it wouldn't turn on or take a charge. Started the nightmare of returning to ASUS. Filled in the on line forms and was issued an RMA number on 25 April. The courier they sent didn't turn up. After lots of chasing another courier arrived. Then they lost the nexus it turned up at the repair centre in June. Meanwhile I am spending a fortune on phone calls etc. After much hassle they send it back not in its original box with no paper work and without its charger. Start phoning again. Its now 21 June and still we have no confirmation of what was wrong, what they did or that they will return the charger. If you buy (and when its working it is quite a nice product albeit with dubious build quality) just pray it never goes wrong.

Reviews.Title: gracias
Reviews.Author: JESUS ALBERTO CASTRO COLINA
Reviews.Content: gracias esta muy buena la tablet y llego en perfecta condiciones excelente 5 estrellas para ustedes una pregunta tendran aplicaciones

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: MBurke
Reviews.Content: Admittedly the device works great out of the box, but the data is clear: more than 50% of these devices fail within 6 months.Glitches are expected in new technology but this is outrageous. Of course, you can contact ASUS customer "support" but I foundit as helpful as the cable company - incompetent.  There are too many other competitors to take a risk here.I purchased 2 of these devices 1 month apart.  Both froze after a little less than 1 month.  I sent one 32G Nexus 7 to ASUS supportthey returned a 16G Nexus 7.  Dealing with ASUS has been an absolute nightmare.

Reviews.Title: The best Android Tablet I touched so far
Reviews.Author: Srool The Knife
Reviews.Content: This is not an iPad. Far from it, but it is the first usable Android tablet... It is finally smooth and responsive (most of the time). If you are looking for a tablet - I recommend iPad. If you are looking specifically for an Android tablet - this is the best one I have seen so far.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: kelly
Reviews.Content: the price and the quad core is what sold me over the kindle fire was a xmas present for the wife

Reviews.Title: Nexus product
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: I had to return the product because the battery malfunctioning. The product itself was nice and my son was excited to receive this product, but as a Christmas gift that was not working properly you can understand the disappointment.  I am still waiting for the refund?Denise Farrington

Reviews.Title: He loves it
Reviews.Author: Girlgadget
Reviews.Content: This was a gift!, so I will review this after he as time to evaluate it. On Xmas day he was thrilled!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: HuTTeReSqUe
Reviews.Content: Great tablet.  The screen quality is excellent. It's slim, and light weight and a much better alternative to the ipad and Kindle Fire HD.  Only issue so far is the volume output is kind of lower than I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Price Quality ratio!!
Reviews.Author: Alfredo Frigerio
Reviews.Content: I don't rate 5 stars because the Nexus 7 doesn't have memory card reader and also doesn't have HDMI out... BUT IN THE OVERALL IT'S GREAT! It's very fast and I'm really happy with my tablet!

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Tobyus
Reviews.Content: I like everything about this tablet, I just feel like it is missing a couple of things.  Primarily, no HDMI output capability.  And it has no SD card slot.  Other than those two things, it is great!  It plays games smooth, the battery life is great, and it does just about everything I wanted from a tablet.  The speakers aren't as powerful as any of the Kindle Fires, but they get the job done.

Reviews.Title: Love this tablet.
Reviews.Author: katelyn reader
Reviews.Content: Though I cannot comment on this company because I purchased my Nexus 7 through a different store, I can tell you how much I love this tablet!Its lightweight. Great clarity. Fast. I like my partners iPad, but I really lot the compactness of this. I almost feel like it was made for me because its such a perfect size to hold in one hand & read, shop, play, etc while I'm in bed.I'm so happy with this purchase. A fraction of the cost of Apple products & I'm over the moon!

Reviews.Title: Purchased for a teen Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: daniel anders
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my teen son for Christmas.  I assume it is all of that because he hasnt stopped looking at the screen since it arrived.

Reviews.Title: Awesome new toy!
Reviews.Author: 13 Ways And Counting
Reviews.Content: This is my third android based tablet. My previous tablets were $200 appx tablets purchased from Chinese sellers on various websites. It was an effort to save money on the more reliable models from HTC, Motorola, and Samsung. They wereok but there was typically no access to the Google app store without rooting the device. There were always battery and screen issues as well.I was very excited about having am official Google device. This thing performs. It is fast and smooth. I have a Samsung Galaxy S3 and it is a super phone. This tablet performs just as well as that phone. I have found myself going to my nexus 7 before my S3 unless I need to make a phone call.YouTube is fantastic on here, Twitter and Facebook are more engaging on the larger screen, and the games like fruit ninja are much more enjoyable. Internet browsing on the chrome browser is excellent.The screen size is perfect for ebooks through the kindle app. Speaking of the kindle; this tablet absolutely smokes the kindle fire. You get the benefits of what a kindle offers through the app and the benefits of an open android os.I would advise ordering a screen protector, rubber/silicone case, and a USB drive adapter. The essential app you will need is called the nexus media importer off the play store for a few dollars. It allows you to transfer content from a USB drive to the device. Movies, music, pictures, you can move it all with the app and cable.My best experience so far with this tablet has been using the ultimate guitar app to view tabs while I play guitar. I put the nexus on a universal tablet stamd purchased on amazon for viewing - I find the "leather" cases with built in flip stands to not only be ugly and bulky but seriously tacky as well.Overall this is a fantastic tablet and unless you're and apple fan or locked into their micro-economy (iTunes) get this tablet. It will do everything you want it to do at a great price point.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7, brilliant tablet by Go0gle
Reviews.Author: Abhishek
Reviews.Content: When google initially announced the nexus 7, I was rather skeptical of it, because the tablet market was already dominated by the iPad and a $200 tablet wouldnt be able to compete with it.But now, it has proved otherwise. It is completely changing the tablet market along with the kindle fire and introduced a new sub category within the tablet section.Starting off, the nexus 7 is still not officially available in India, so I had to purchase it through a friend in Dubai. I got the 16GB WiFi only version, a few weeks back.At the first look, the soft rubberised back makes it a pleasure to hold it and you wont feel the pain to holding it upright unlike an ipad.The screen is a 7" one, which is smaller than the iPad and the resolution is almost comparable. I was rather uncomfortable with such a large bezel at the periphery, but it actually makes it easier to hold wile reading a book or browsing the web.Coming to the software, it runs android 4.2 out of the box, and that is the latest version released by Google. Since it runs pure android without any customization by the manufacturer, and the tablet is made by google, you'll get the updates as soon as they are released. Many of the samsung tablets are only now getting their Ice Cream Sandwich update, whch is just sad, because Samsung customizes the tablet by changing the skin and adding the Touch Wiz UI.The tablet has front facing camera with is good for video calls, skype, google + hangouts etc, but only if you prop it up properly so that it is aligned with your face. In the potrait mode, it becomes rather uncomfortable to use when video calling because the camera is located in the right side or the left side and the camera lens does not have a wide angle to cover more angle.The device comes with Wifi, NFC, Bluetooth 4.0 and what not. The initail setup was very easy if you have a google account. All it asks you to do is to connect to a WiFi network and sign into your google account. It takes care of the rest. Once you start the Google + app, it automatically pulls your profile picture from there and props it into your user account in the tablet. All your mail, calender, contacts are synced. THe best part about Jelly Bean 4.2 is the user accounts.My dad uses a corporate account for syncing and it contains much sensitive information. This is where user acoounts realy shines. All I had to do was to sign in with his email account and right in the lockscreen, it provides you an option to log into either one of the accounts. The two accounts are no way connected to each other and my dad's and my data are separate.The screen is beautiful and you'll love to use it. The tablet has a power button at the right edge and the volume rocker there too. Nowhere else are there any buttons. The charging port it at the bottom and so is the 3.5mm Headphone jack.The battery lasts pretty long, even with wifi turned on, It remained for over a week with low usage and a full day with heavy gaming and video streaming.You can find plenty of apps on the play store, and even though people say that there are not many tablets apps, it is still sufficient for the average user. Most of the apps will look clear in landscape mode also, but some of them become slightly blurred.One aspect that I didnt like about the Nexus 7 is the fact that it doesnt have touch sensitive keys below the screen. When running apps there is a small black band which shows buttons for the home, return and the most recent apps keys but they take up a some screen space and make the apps look slightly stretched.The presence of the Quad Core Nvidia tegra 3 really is felt at all times. The UI is so smooth, even with the memory full and a couple of apps running.Overall, I personally recommend this device to anyone who wants a tablet, but is not a Apple fanboy.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet value
Reviews.Author: Mikey likes it
Reviews.Content: Being my first tablet purchase, I debated on whether to get a 7" or 10" and whether to go for an ipad or something else. My decision to get the Nexus 7 was a good one. It's the perfect size - light and compact enough to bring anywhere while large enough to be effective for viewing videos. It's great as an e-reader. The width allows it to be held with one hand like a paperback book, which is harder to do with the wider ipad mini. The virtual keyboard is just right - in portrait mode I can thumb-type much faster and more accurately than with my smartphone. In landscape I type even faster using three fingers of each hand. Quality is excellent and the screen resolution is higher than the ipad mini, which doesn't have the retina display. Movies are large enough to be enjoyed. 32gb is a good size, providing ample storage especially when supplemented by cloud storage. It's the perfect personal organizer and can take the place of my laptop in most travel situations. Android Jelly Bean is fantastic and though there currently aren't as many android apps as IOS apps, most of the truly useful ones exist. Since I got the Nexus, I hardly use my smartphone for anything other than calls. My laptop use has also decrease a lot, as many things are just faster and easier to do on a tablet.The minor complaints I have are: 1) there's no rear facing camera. I had assumed it would at least have a basic one and I was surprised after receiving it that it didn't; 2) the audio quality through the headphone jack is okay, but don't expect audiophile quality. My ipod touch sounds way better; and 3) the speaker is rear facing, at the bottom edge. None of these are significant flaws, given what I use it for and in light of the price. Get one. You'll love it.A few accessories I recommend are a USB adaptor which lets you expand storage by using a thumb drive, a bluetooth speaker like the JBL Flip (great for music streaming and watching movies) on the Nexus 7 and a case (the Blurex N7 case is great). I also bought a stylus, but hardly ever use it.

Reviews.Title: Value for Money
Reviews.Author: Henry from Hong Kong
Reviews.Content: Very user friendly device with many available applications. Whether you use it for fun, for business, for personal productivity, for leisure, this is a great piece of device.  You get a lot of value from the money paid.

Reviews.Title: Solid Tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Andres C.
Reviews.Content: My actual rating is 4,5. This is a great tablet for the price.What i liked:.-The screen looks sharp and it's very responsive.-Perfect grip for my mom and wife (i bought two for them as a present).-Android Jelly Bean is a plus.-The table performance is outstanding.-Beautiful package, as i said i bought 2 for presents and it was great to see them impressed by the beautiful package.-Very light tablet, not as much as the Ipad Mini but the difference is not that muchWhat i didn't liked:.-The sound could have been better.-Front Camera is not very goodOverall comments:This is a very very good tablet for the price, the only reason i gave it a 4 it was because of the front camera, but besides that its a solid tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: emilio cruz
Reviews.Content: Such a great product. I admit, I wasn't sure if I was going to be pleased with it or not, but I am very pleased with it. Great for reading and Youtube.

Reviews.Title: cost effective tablet
Reviews.Author: Cristian Berri
Reviews.Content: I like the Nexus 7. Screen resolution is pretty good even though not Retina display. The OS behaves ok. Sometimes the screen refreshes itself but it is not a big deal. This is not a tablet for working but for web browsing + gtalk + skype, it is more than acceptable. Mini Ipad costs about 200 usd more and does not have Retina Display either. I am very happy with it. My other option would have been a Microsoft Surface but I wanted to start with something cheaper first.

Reviews.Title: Product was defected
Reviews.Author: Kathy
Reviews.Content: On Christmas day we plugged in the Nexus and it did not respond. We had a black screen and not even the light came on to indicate it was plugged in.  I was very disappointed because it was a featured gift for my daughter.  I am still waiting for a response from the seller and a return label. Very disappointed because I read it had good reviews. My daughter is a teacher and was hopeful to use it for music.

Reviews.Title: I'm up in the air on this one
Reviews.Author: Pen Fanatic "Penz"
Reviews.Content: I own a couple of tablets. This one was supposed to be the best 7-inch android tablet, but I'm questioning that notion. I own the Galaxy tab 2 7.0 as well, and to be perfectly honest, I think that Samsung's personal touches to the Android software makes it a winner over the Nexus line. I can't seem to find a battery-saving mode on the Nexus, the buttons are all in the most awkward locations, and there is no way to expand or import memory through memory cards. it seems the battery dies out way too quickly, even when in stand-by mode. It seems to take a long time to charge. The screen only looks a bit sharper and brighter than other tablets I used.I wouldn't say that this is "bad". Not at all. But I think that Samsung's Galaxy is a better choice. The only drawback in the competition is that their hard drives don't come with more memory (if I could've got a 32gb Galaxy 2 7.0, I wouldn't have bought this Nexus 7). I wanted this for video games, apps, movies, music, etc. It holds 32gb, and it feels like I can download half the Play store without seeing a dent in memory. But in reality, I think that the "pure Google experience" is not as nice as people made it sound. There are too many features I enjoy that are missing.But as things are right now with the competition, I'd still highly recommend this. It's portable enough to fit in a bookbag, purse, laptop bag, or even pants pockets, it does almost everything you could want a tablet to do, it's fast, it holds a lot of stuff (the 32 gb version), and it has a lot of potential in the right hands. I treat this as my "fun" tablet: I have larger ones for work, etc. but this one is great for trips to the doctor's office, when on a long trip, when traveling, etc.

Reviews.Title: Surprised at poor performance of this tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I expected this tablet to work at least as well as my S3 Android phone.  I was surprised and frustrated at how really poorly this tablet performed.  The main problem is the lack of responsiveness of the touch screen.  I kept tapping the screen with no response; especially when trying to type in passwords.  For example I spent a lot of time trying to put in my Netflix user name and password.  The keyboard would sporadically appear, then in the middle of typing in the username, the keyboard would just disappear.  The operating system runs very slow as well, and sometimes crashes.  When I plug my SD card reader into the S3 android phone micro usb charging port, the file structure on the SD card is immediately displayed.  On the Nexus, I had to pay $4.00 for an app to use micro usb port.  This is a design problem - reason, there is no micro sd card slot on the Nexus 7 therefore, the only way to direct connect to the device is through the micro usb port. This Nexus 7 is slow, unresponsive and probably defective.

Reviews.Title: Save Your Money, Buy an IPAD
Reviews.Author: Ro "litesugar"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Nexus 7 32G at the end of January 2013 via online store and have had it since February 2013.  Within about 3 or 4 weeks it became glitch, with apps crashing.  But I could live with it because it allowed me to take advantage of the app store.  So for months, I actually enjoyed the tablet even though the screen would not fill with pictures all the way or something else would close unexpectedly and the sound was not all that great.  However, last week, Tuesday 07/09/2013 the sound stopped altogether.  I had already bought a mini speaker to compensate for the poor sound quality.  When I plugged that it in, I got sound from the tablet, but that was the only way I could hear anything.  I called ASUS support and right away they asked had I dropped it.  I had not.  I promptly sent it off on the same day, Tuesday, 07/09/2013.  Until today, I still haven't heard a word.  I called ASUS support myself and was told that they received the tablet yesterday, 07/15/2013 and that I should received a 'repaired' tablet within 7 - 10 days from 07/15/2013 their receipt date.  Mind you, they sent me the label to send the tablet back.  So now, I haven't had the tablet for a week, and probably won't for another week and will now received a'refurbished' tablet, not the brand new one I bought last then four months ago.  I REGRET THIS PURCHASE and now know I should have spent the money on an IPAD.  What a waste! All the other companies that offer tablets have no problem with sending out a new tablet when something like this happens.  I know now I should have invested in an IPAD or KINDLE.  They know how to treat their customers.

Reviews.Title: Not able to turn it on
Reviews.Author: EDWARD M VERGHESE
Reviews.Content: I bought the device and it got delivered on time. But the item which I got was a defective one and I was not able to turn it on. I tried all the steps given in the Google play to turn on the device, but nothing worked out for me. Very much disappointed with the seller. He could have checked it before shipping. Now I am going to return the device.

Reviews.Title: Production description is not complete
Reviews.Author: Raja
Reviews.Content: I thought I ordered the Nexus 2013 model with rear end camera, but I dint realise this is the older model. I should have read the other reviews before ordering this piece, but it was too late. I dint even use the product and returned it the moment I saw it did not have a rear camera. The description and product features should be updated to help prospective buyers realise what they are buying.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 not working properly within a year of purchase
Reviews.Author: Sayan Ray
Reviews.Content: And ASUS is not ready to refund/replace. They will tell you..(1) Send invoice for verifying the warranty - this will take ~7 business days(2) Send product on own cost after they confirm the warranty status(3) After you send the product, it will take ~14 business days to repair(4) If they cannot repair, they will think of replacing - in general they do not replace were the support's words.(5) Amazon cannot do anything till ASUS confirms anything.In short, stay away from ASUS products on Amazon unless you are sure about quality.

Reviews.Title: Done!
Reviews.Author: Diane P. Melillo
Reviews.Content: It is not even 8 months old and the thing is dead!  Won't take a charge, tried everything.  Piece of junk!

Reviews.Title: Don't trust Amazon with big electronic purchases
Reviews.Author: Charles Ling
Reviews.Content: My Nexus 7 was fine for about 6 months, then suddenly stopped working. Amazon directed me to the third-party seller, who directed me to the manufacturer (ASUS). I ended up getting everything fixed on my own through ASUS. This is not the first time. Amazon screwed me in a similar fashion on a ~$1500 netbook. Never again. Give some proper service and support if you're going to flay our wallets like so. It's an unnecessary hassle that makes me never want to buy big purchases like this through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Not Bluetooth 4.0
Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: The 2012 version of the nexus 7 is NOT bluetooth 4.0 compatible (aka ble, bluetooth smart ready)Get the 2013 version if you need bluetooth 4.0 (and you will!)

Reviews.Title: not overly impressed
Reviews.Author: Nick LeVasseur
Reviews.Content: Battery lasts OK, but has to be shut down to take a charge.Lots of apps available every where else will not work on this device.

Reviews.Title: Came in on time but..
Reviews.Author: Predrag Vasic
Reviews.Content: I bought this item a few weeks ago and it appeared to be doing just fine. Soon did I realized that it held its charge for a very short time. Today it finally died on me and is not turning on. I believe the company knew about this before selling it. I will not buy anymore products from this company and advise you not to either.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality, worse customer service
Reviews.Author: Thomas Harding
Reviews.Content: I bought a Nexus as a Christmas gift for my father.  A few months later, he said he had not used the Nexus at all, but it would no longer start, and the battery would not hold a charge.  It seemed to be both the video card and the battery that was malfunctioning.  In any case, months after buying it, it would not even start.  When my father was visiting, I called customer support, and was told they would replace it.  24 hours thereafter, they emailed to ask for the CSSN number with instructions on how to find it through the settings menu.  I wrote back to remind them that the device would not start and so could not find it through the settings ment, and my father had thrown out the original packaging. Another 24 hours later, they wrote back with the exact same email asking me to find the CSSN number through the settings menu.  I told them again that their machine was such a piece of crap, that it would not even start.  It was like a screaming at a brick wall.  Another 24 hours later, they Google wrote to ask me for the CSSN number again off the original packaging.  I don't think they were reading my email responses or listening to me at all.  I cannot say how frustrating it was.  After spending a half hour on the phone with their customer support again, they told me they would email the consultants that handle the emailing to see why they kept asking me for a CSSN number.  I asked to speak to a supervisor, and only then did they start to try to cooperate and break through the walls of beuracracy and send me the paper work to get a new device.  Even then it would take 21 days to get a new Nexus and they would put a hold on my credit card until I returned their malfunctioned Nexus.  I bought the Nexus because I was tired of always giving all my money to Apple, but instead I got a poor quality device, was not treated like a human and had to struggle to just get one that worked.  Apple would have made things right instantly, and it would not have been so poor quality to begin with.  DO NOT BUY IT.  You will regret it.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Raincoconuts
Reviews.Content: Asus makes good looking crap. My last purchase of an Asus product...the hardware is Wal mart quality, software always has glitches. Warranty is useless, invalid in many countries. Worthless doorstop.

Reviews.Title: Great till Screen Cracks
Reviews.Author: Big Toad
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before buying this as a Christmas present for my grandson.He loved it and it met all of my expectations.Then one night he came home from church and the screen had cracked apart while in it's case sitting on the counter.ASUS has not been any help. Now I've seen many reports of the screen cracking for no reason.I wish ASUS would acknowledge the defect.Like I said it was great while it lasted.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Tablet
Reviews.Author: Tim "Timdiana" Dunn
Reviews.Content: This Nexus 7 is terrific. After putting the New 32gb Micro Sd Card Sdhc Tf Flash Memory Card 32gb Class 10, New! Usa!, I have found this tablet to be most useful. It is great product from Nexus and I recommend getting it if you are looking for a good tablet.

Reviews.Title: Product did not work fresh out of the package.
Reviews.Author: L. Dill "Coder"
Reviews.Content: Maybe I received one that was made on a bad day, but all I got was a nightlight.  I had researched multiple tablets on-line and was looking forward to getting this Nexus 7.The outer shipping carton showed some crumpling, but the inner packaging was pristine, so I had no misgivings when I plugged the device up to charge. After eight hours, there was no sign of life except for a dim glow around the edge when it was charging. When off the charging cable, it was a brick. I charged it for several hours more, tried all the reset options mentioned in the instructions, and then set about returning the device. I might have considered an exchange, but was afraid that this was simply one of a bad batch, and I didn't want to deal with a series of exchanges through the mail. With my explanation, the vendor was reasonable and with a little paperwork and a few days, they have their tablet and I have the funds returned to my account.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet - don't like the ads
Reviews.Author: Erin
Reviews.Content: Really love this tablet.  It's a great size and easy to use.  Only thing I don't like, are the ads.
