I turned off as many as I could, but when I first log in, it always pops up with the Google Play store advertising another ap.  Can't seem to turn this off.Otherwise, very happy with it.  Great battery life.

Reviews.Title: Works great for the reason I bought it.
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: This tablet replaces a BN Nook e-reader and an Amazon Kindle e-reader. I buy from both sources, and I can read and store all my books on this one device. In addition, I should be able to buy and read e-books from other sources as well as long as they have readers available that will work on Android. I also have an Android phone, but the tablet seems to be set up a bit differently, and I haven't yet got the hang of going on the Net very well. Of course, I'm an older than dirt user..... Otherwise, so far, so good. Only other thing I don't like much so far is that it takes a really long time to recharge fully.

Reviews.Title: amazing tablet
Reviews.Author: Danny Cannon
Reviews.Content: Very powerful. Does everything I need and way more. I liked it enough to buy a second for my wife.  Truly amazing product.best tablet out there.  beats my iOS products, hands down.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good Tablet
Reviews.Author: F. Juhasz "fwj"
Reviews.Content: Not as smooth an interface as Apple but it " does what I need it to do" Some quirks I still have to get used to- for example today I was logging onto a website and the Nexus remember ed my email address after a few letters but try as I might it would not move to the log in box. Not a deal breaker but an annoyance.

Reviews.Title: My grandson loves it.
Reviews.Author: Stizzie
Reviews.Content: He is 13 and uses it in school ..... etc.It has great features and is an absolutely great android!  I wish I had one rather than my iPad!

Reviews.Title: Nice 7" tablet
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: 1. Nice quality (working smoothly after heinous international transport & no obvious defect).2. Appropriate size to hold & carry, low-key and practical.3. System of Android 4.2 is great, but still lots of minutia could be improved .4. One more back camera would be better.5. Really good value for money to some countries, even with the additional cost of transport & coustoms.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: mas47
Reviews.Content: I must says the vendor Golden_Gopher_2684 is a true professional. Golden answered all my question and service was excellent. Plus you can trust what they say about their products for sell .The Nexus 7 I purchased is a high quality unit and priced reasonably.Thanks for all your help

Reviews.Title: daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: Raymond Miller
Reviews.Content: It was a birthday gift and she has been wanting one. It didn't take her long to figure out how to download apps and other stuff from her computer.

Reviews.Title: It was not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Pablo
Reviews.Content: I was really dissapointed because did not have all the functions of other tablets. It is basic. I will try it out and allways go for another.

Reviews.Title: Low quality hardware
Reviews.Author: cyberboy
Reviews.Content: It's been only 6 weeks wince I receive my Nexus 7The good: Is a light weight tablet, very fast and easy to useThe bad: The screen cracked under mysterious circumstances. I left it on the car on a hot day, when I came back the screen was cracked, it turns on but it doesn't respond.Based on some online research this seem to be a common issue with Nexus 7 and apparently  is not covered under warranty :-(. I'm contacting ASUS customer service to see how much would it cost to repair.

Reviews.Title: love this tablet
Reviews.Author: Stephen J. Sylvester
Reviews.Content: this was a gift for my wife she absolutely has enjoyed every minute that she's had it have no complaints about this product

Reviews.Title: Two Big Flaws For Me
Reviews.Author: Bingo Pajama ""On the Quest For Meaning""
Reviews.Content: I love my Nexus 7 (I'm writing this review on it.)  But I've dinged it two stars because 1. It's action (compared to my Note 2)is very sluggish with apps launching slowly and browser pages opening slowly. SanDisk memory management routinely clocks my Nexus 7 at between 4 and 9 and my Note 2 at 11 or 12. and 2. Because the power cable supplied is so short, is a different kind of connector than the standard USB to micro USB, replacements are difficult to find. We all know the memory limits which are reasonable (though I've reached my 32G.) I'm awaiting the arrival of a 500G external for my videos to use on both this and my other device but even *if* I managed to find a drive and cable that will work on my Nexus 7, I need to haul around a whole different set of cables to charge and use OTG with it and my Note. On the plus side,  between this and my Note I haven't powered my desktop on in over a month (I've never bothered with a laptop.)

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: David Beleck "Wolfspirit99"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband and he loves it!  We have not had even the smallest of issues with the tablet.The seller had it to us quickly and everything was in perfect shape when it got here.We decided on the 7 in rather than the larger  pad so he could still fit it in a pocket if needed.  It is primarily used for listening to his music in the truck.  The screen size makes it much easier to manage music selection compared to his iTouch.

Reviews.Title: Speakers don't work
Reviews.Author: Charly Menoyo
Reviews.Content: The speakers sound at low volume that hardly hear. My brother bought a few months ago the 8GB model and is heard loud and clear well.Headphones work perfect,

Reviews.Title: Perfect gift
Reviews.Author: HarryR
Reviews.Content: It's a bit pricey but it is well worth it. Does all it's advertised to do and more. Best tablet out there. I've tried them all..I am a computer designer and engineer. This one is tops.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: charger
Reviews.Content: its really worth the money and it wasnt that expensive considering the quality! love it. shipping was fast and it was exactly as described!

Reviews.Title: my second tablet
Reviews.Author: Jamer
Reviews.Content: this replaced my Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 - and I love it. I like the size better than a 10.1, though I do wish it had a rear-facing camera.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and it is in use daily. I have experienced none of the early problems to which others have referred.I immediately put the device in a case and also applied a screen protector. So only some small gripes that are hardly worth mentioning. I do fine the on/off switch awkward.I have found reading books at night with the Kindle App to be rather bright and tiring for the eyes. It does not respond to the brightness control. I have just foune an app that reverses the black and white so that the screen is black with the print white but I have not really tested it yet.For those who wanted the home page to rotate, it now does so.It is such a versatile tool, I am happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: Best for this price
Reviews.Author: Aleksandr
Reviews.Content: For this price you can get this tablet or some Chinese one. But with this option you can be sure that you`ll always get new OS versions

Reviews.Title: A tablet to consider.. good performance
Reviews.Author: DOUGLAS I FLORES
Reviews.Content: A good tablet with good performance.. is a very good choice for do some minor task like reading email, texting and other using WiFI conections. I thinking there's a matter topic to focus is when watching videos YOUTUBE, that is taking increase the temperature at side, but isn't noting wrong to be offended.Try it. is a very nice product. Although Amz can better the price ... i hope so.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Wish I would have bought an Ipad but this is great for the road
Reviews.Author: Mr Slim
Reviews.Content: I ordered an ipad from another retailer online and they refused to ship it claiming it may be a fraud order and then someone recommended this and it was cheaper so I bought it. I really like it but because it is fairly new there is not as many cool apps and features like their is for Ipad. Everything I do online this Nexus does not work with, but it does work with Ipad so basically I have to buy an ipad now, instead of spending $700 I just have to spend $950.I can say that this little nexus is great for a portable device to take with you on the go. I bought a small case with a built in keyboard and kick stand so I can use it like a mini laptop, the case was only $14 on amazon. If I owned an Ipad and had to take it on the road I would be on edge, but this device is perfect for that. You can fit the nexus and case easily in an over-sized jacket pocket. I can stream netflix anywhere there is a wifi connection and I can watch live TV on filmon tv from the internet. This is an awesome device for traveling. I bought the 32G so I can download stuff and watch it offline, perfect while traveling. The speaker is pretty good too, I was streaming grateful dead from archive.org and the speaker sounder nice and clear but it was not loud. Listening with the headphones the sound was very, very low and it would be tough to listen to anything in a fairly noisy place using the headphones because the volume on the low side. I was surprised at just how low the volume was when I cranked it up. I would say this is the main drawback, definitely not a headphones listening type of device.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: The duck night
Reviews.Content: Such a nifty little gadget with great integration with my existing google account. The buttons could be better placed, but no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: GOOD
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: IT RUNS FAST AND I LIKE IT. IT DOES WHAT I WANTED IT FOR. IT IS GOOD FOR SOMEONE LOOKING TO USE DAILY.

Reviews.Author: Andrea Sopko
Reviews.Content: This tablet meets all my personal expectations. Wrong at a great speed, no hangups. It is small, portable and has great wifi. You wont be dissatisfied!!

Reviews.Title: Cool!
Reviews.Author: Stephen Mathews
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet and use it very consistently. I will admit that I am not very experienced with tablets since this is my first one, which makes it so I have nothing to compare it to, but it also tells you about its simplicity, but that doesn't mean it has no customization. Andriod is very very customizable. I'll start off by throwing out a few things that are pros and cons in my book.pros:Very solid product, comfortable to hold, and light.It has amazing battery life.The screen quality is right out superb for a $200ish tablet.It's a nexus, which causes you to get very prompt OS updates giving you the latest of Andriod.Speakers - they put out better sound then many laptops I have seen.It is very simple device to root.There are sleep covers for it so that it doesn't waste battery life when not in use.WiFi reception is good, not amazing, but good.Bluetooth works pretty well. I like using a Bluetooth speaker while using the shower to keep the tablet away from the steam.Charges & syncs using micro-usb so it is easier to find accessories.It normally is a pretty speedy tablet.With buying a simple, three dollar, app you can connect external storage, it doesn't even require rooting.It costs half as much as many comparable tablets benchmark wise making it a great deal.The back, as apposed to some tablets, is not a finger print magnet and it is not slippery.The Nexus is very comparable to the Kindle Fire HD but the nexus runs pure Andriod so it is much more customizable. With the Kindle Fire you are completely locked in Amazon's ecosystem unless you root it, but with the Nexus you can get the Google Play Store and then buy apps for Amazon, Nook, and such, so it gives you much more options.Neutral Comments:Size - seven inches is perfect for me. It may or may not be perfect for you, but it was for me.It runs Android which i like but it will depend on the person. The classic Andriod vs. iOS, which you'll have to decide for yourself which is best for your individual propose.It doesn't cost as much if you buy it from other retailers.Negative:It's a Nexus causing you to get very prompt updates, which sometimes are slightly buggy causing a little lag at times. You get to be used a little like a guinea pig at times. since the 4.2.1 update it has needed reboot two times, but before that it never had to. I am sure it is very temporary thing, and will be fixed soon.There is a lack of compatible apps, let alone optimized for the screen, but the Play Store is growing rapidly, so that's just a matter of time.On a side note, one thing that annoys me with this, and other tablets as well, is there pricing. let me elaborate, charging up to 50 dollars more for only 16 gigs of extra memory is a little steep causing Google to get more off those who need more memory.  I just wish that they'd not be quite as unfair against those of us that need more memory, but that is against all tablet makers not just google/asus.  That said, it is just an amazing deal for a tablet. I have  even read multiple places that Google it taking a loss on the tablet and just hoping to recoup the money through data collection and apps.  so for the price you can't do any better.Finally, I'd like to say, I have owned my tablet for three months and, overall, I am very pleased with it. The Nexus Seven is a good tablet for a mediocre tablet price. It is a solid device that I have recommended and will recommend to anyone in the seven inch tablet market.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Poor service

Reviews.Title: Ok but not as good as the ipad. No WiFi connection with some routers! What good is a WiFi only tablet that does not connect to a
Reviews.Author: C. Bryan
Reviews.Content: I have the Nexus 7 32gb with the latest updates. Being that it is WiFi only and not cellular also makes it useless at times. It only connects to certain WiFi routers. I have waisted way too much time trying to find a answer/fix. I have tried to email google through google play but they do not seem to want users to email them.When I go to certain places it will NOT connect.If you have a fix please let me know.I have noticed other things that are missing that make it less user friendly also.Poor quality DAC.Poor quality speaker.The colors displayed on the screen are not accurate at all.No SD slot, but the ipad does not have it either. No option to upload and download onto a thumb drive, etc.It is better than the Fire HD though.

Reviews.Title: Screen cracks too easily
Reviews.Author: Kimberli1004
Reviews.Content: I bought this item when it first came out and the screen had issues.  the screen would black out and then would only come back on for a moment as though it was timing out.  Google sent me a replacement and within a week the screen broke.  No excessive use, abuse...I kept it in my laptop bag for work in which it was encased in foam.  The screen was cracked half way down the screen and anything beneath the crack was non responsive to touch.  So I had to buy another one.  Should have gone with a competitor because that one broke too.  I errored on the side of caution and didn't put it in the same bag I did before.  The screen cracked too.  I have a samsung galaxy 2 that I have had for 6 month and have never had any problems like I did with this google tablet.  you really do get what you pay for.  I suggest buying something other than this tablet.  I had 3 and they are all broken.

Reviews.Title: Great device rendered useless by Google
Reviews.Author: cac22
Reviews.Content: I have purchased this beautiful Asus 7" tablet in Dec 2012. I have been a long time Asus adept and they have to steer away from Google as much as possible as Google is tarnishing Asus with their horrible customer support.Pros of tablet:-Great processor-Beautiful high definition display-Very nice design. In-hands feel and ease of use is fantastic...Cons:-No video-out, don't try HTC (80$) adapter with Cavium Wi-Fi Media app, it does not work. There is a youtube video about this and it will not work unless you have an HTC phone which the HTC media HD device will recognize as being on network and then connect to network...-Video-out: dont waste your money on an MHL adapter, it does not work either...-Video-out with iMediaShare Lite do work for files on device through any Samsung All-Share enabled tv...but there is absolutely no streaming (sorry Netflix will not work on TV via the tablet).-OTG USB access works out of the gate with "Nexus Media Importer" app with JB 4.1 version, but within 10 minutes of unboxing your Nexus 7, your device will update to JB ver. 4.2 and this kills OTG support all together. This way, if you still want to use USB via OTG Google forces you to root your device, then it works with either Nexus Media Importer or stickmount app...and voids your warranty...-Speakers are too quiet and will bust if you use Winamp equalizer Db boost or any app that boosts db...Just don't do it...You can google that...-If you bust speakers, there are ZERO vendors nor Google, nor Asus who sell spare parts (speakers).-Google Play store and horrible customer service....need it say more? (oh but I will...)I got Nexus 7 in Dec 2012. Bought the device on google play store. Was able to purchase apps until mid January 2013... All of a sudden and for no reason, all apps purchases get automatically cancelled. Credit card info on google wallet matches credit card statement, credit card has plenty of free room and bank says all good on their end and that they approve all Google Play transactions, but get immediately reversed. After countless emails, always answered by same "wait 24-48 hours" automated reply and nothing else. There is a place in the support website that makes you enter your data and then they call you. I did that 3-4 times and always speak with the nicest people, but they just take your info, apologize, then send you another useless automated reply...and you fall back in this useless never ending loop.I just recently converted all my Apple devices and got Nexus 7 and also Samsung S3 which i both loved, but Google, by denying apps purchases, have rendered my devices useless... BTW, I did enter other credit cards in google wallet, all of them good with a lot of wiggle room, got my bank to recheck address on file, so much that they are exasperated with me... and one of the last google Rep, after being on the phone for more than 30 minutes, since I was demanding a reason for the cancellations and "what can I do to fix the situation" discussion, ended up telling me that issue was on their side and they had no clue what was going on and that there are thousand of users just like me that are totally baffled...Conclusion, try windows 8 based tablets or stick to apple's products (their service is impeccable, but you pay devices dearly, but is usually worth every penny...), but just do not fall into google's customer service abyss...it is not worth the heartburns...

Reviews.Title: Electronic express sucks

Reviews.Content: had it replaces three times, never have i had so bad cust. service, honestly don't waste your money on them they are not worth, you will never get help. and just run arouds

Reviews.Title: Crap screen
Reviews.Author: Meghan Lally
Reviews.Content: This product is VERY delicate.  I had it in a case and someone dropped a heavy pillow on it and the screen cracked. I have had a nook and a Sony Reader in the past and they did not have this lack of usefulness.  I read constantly.  I take books (or my reader with me wherever I go) in my purse.  If it cannot stand up to normal wear and tear then what use is it.  I do not need a $200 bedside book.ASUS does not stand by this product at all.  They want to charge $170 to fix it.  I think I will put that to a better quality reader.  I need my readers to last at least a couple of years.I gave this 2 stars instead of one because I like the usability and OS.  However if the screen is cracked then it is completely unusable.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: G.Campbell
Reviews.Content: I can now see why Apple is King in the tablet and smartphone market. I thought having a "true" Android experience would make the experience smoother and more enjoyable. I was wrong. This device automatically updated to Jelly Bean 4.2. I like that. The update was fast and seemless.However, having used the Android OS in the past, I knew where everything was. With JB 4.2 things are changed and, personally I found them more complicated and hard to get to. Synchronization and Background data disabling just to mention a few. You also can't kill your most recent apps like you were prior to JB. You can only do so one by one. That's ridiculous.Seemingly, I erroneously assumed JB would've eliminated unwanted and needless apps populating in the background, thereby minimizing sucking your measly 1 GB or memory (RAM). Nope, not even with background data disabled.  I had to install GoLauncher to easily kill the apps and a few other apps like FMR cleaner Fast Reboot to do this on a regular basis. The amount of memory rescued or obtained is simply obscene. I can disable all "push" or notification settings but that won't help.Google Chrome is a joke with JB. You get tabs and you can't get full screen view. Kinda defeats the purpose on the tablet. At the same time, you can do so with the Chrome version on iOS 6. The same with Google Maps, no full screen view.I find the device's overall responsiveness rather sluggish, even right after you do a fresh or clean install (restore). There is no comparison to the iPhone or iPad which is silky smooth unless you update your old device with the latest firmware update which can be a problem. Case in point: updating the iPhone 4 or iPod Touch 4G to iOS 6.It's quite ironic though. I have the iPhone 5 now. I said to myself, that is going to be my last Apple device I will own unless Apple get's their act together. Now, I am having second thoughts. If a pure Android device like Nexus 7 can perform not well (to my expectations) then how can I expect,  say a Samsung Galaxy 5 or 6 to be much better? After all, Google is NOT known to listen to their customers. They are known to have very horrible customer service and don't respond to customer feedback at all. Look at how they did with the launch of previous Nexus products especially with the Nexus 4 phone?  Let's just hope that with Microsoft and Windows 8 back in the game, the smartphone market will become very cut-throat where ultimately the consumer wins.

In my case, it felt from about 20 sm height, while being in case - that's it, no more tablet. Screen replacement costs arround 160 USD! In other devices (Apple, Samsung) screen would not be broken so easy (checked more than once :)). So, my advice - avoid it.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to use - Updated 10/3/2013
Reviews.Author: J. Wells
Reviews.Content: Nexus 7 32 GB WiFi.I have had this item for a couple of weeks and have found it rather frustrating.  Despite the descriptions I had relied on with respect to how easy it is to copy music files to the device (like an MP3 player), it does not work.  I copied several GB of music files to the device and I can even see them in the folders, but the device does not recognize them.  I downloaded several apps that are supposed to 'correct' the problem, but they either crashed or failed to have any effect.C'mon now, why is this soooo difficult to do?  So far, no music and no obvious fix.The screens are not intuitive.  I cannot figure out why some screens appear out of nowhere and are sometimes empty.  There is no obvious means of managing the screens or icons.  I cannot figure out how to move icons around in order to put the most used ones on the first screen.  It goes on and on...(I have an iPhone and find that it's design is much more elegant with respect to managing content.)There is no native camera app.  You must download a special application to use the camera.  Really?The screen is really nice, though.Three stars may be overly generous._-----------------After using this device for several months, I can say that the initial review was on target. Games work well, but editing ANYTHING (email, documents, etc.) is worse than a chore.  Try moving the cursor to a point in the text where editing is needed. It's so incredibly tedious to edit text that I end up retyping the entire word or sentence instead of changing it. I usually end up back in front of my server to do the task. Reading email works reasonably well, responding to email is just frustrating.I am guessing that Apple copywrited the 'better' editing methodology and the Android devices are not allowed to use it. In hindsight, I should have purchased the iPad.Another fail on this device is that Skype does not function with the camera, only sound.

Reviews.Title: Decent tablet but needs a lot of refinement
Reviews.Author: Shishir Bhat
Reviews.Content: The build quality of the Nexus is decent but nowhere near an iPad. This tablet was meant to be a showcase for Jelly Bean and ironically it has been let down by the software. Android still has some ways to go before it is as snappy and reliable as iOS.  Apps like Facebook and Aldiko brought the tablet to its knees and the only solution was to restart it. Android now supports multiple users but it renders the tablet nigh-unusable and everything becomes slow and stuttery. Multitasking suffers, especially. The default Chrome browser feels like beta software and one has to install quite a few apps to make the tablet usable. PC connectivity is as another sore point as the device now announces itself as a media device and the file transfer is iffy at best. many files are not at all visible till you restart and you can no longer play content off the tablet directly. You can't start multiple copy tasks simultaneously. The default music and video players are one of the worst I've seen in a tablet, really poor. The device is basically gimped, there's no USB on the go or any way to mirror the display on to a HDTV.Now, the good stuff: great hi-res screen, but very dull, IMO. Great battery life and Google Now/voice recognition are the best I've used.Overall, a decent device but typical, unrefined Android experience hold it back. If you can fork out a little extra I'd recommend the iPad mini.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic, until the screen cracks
Reviews.Author: Christopher LaCount
Reviews.Content: I bought the device for my girlfriend as an early graduation gift. She fell in love with this tablet, but after day 5 of having the tablet, my girlfriend set the device down on her nightstand. When she woke up the next morning, a hairline crack had stretched all the way across the screen. She first thought it was just her hair, but to her dismay, it was an actual crack. The device became unusable because the crack split the digitizer underneath the glass. After further research, this seems to be a very common problem with the Nexus 7's. Beware if you are considering this tablet. I returned this right away and got an Acer A110 instead.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: F\
Reviews.Content: I bought a Nexus 7 a month ago, now the battery can be charged, and have to send back for service. Don't buy it , poor qualityAsus Nexus 7 1B32 7-Inch 32 GB Tablet

Reviews.Title: Never again
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these via the Amazon Woot! site, as refurbs.One turned out to be a 16GB instead of 32GB and was returned for a refund.The second lasted less than a month (it was a Christmas present).  After much difficulty, Asus said the would honor the warranty and repair it.It was returned with the same problem - and of course, the warranty has now expired.No more Nexus/Asus for me.

Reviews.Title: WiFi issues
Reviews.Author: palmerdave
Reviews.Content: Won't stay connected to WiFi, tried all internet solutions including factory reset as recommended by Asus support. Same on 2 different networks.

Reviews.Title: cracked screen
Reviews.Author: Naseem Rakha
Reviews.Content: Two days ago the "return window" closed on this purchase -and guess what? The screen just cracked. We don't know why, but a quick search on the web tells us we are not alone. Seems these things like to spontaneously crack or shatter or whatever verb you want to use. We are waiting to hear from Amazon to see if they will be good business people and help out a disgruntled customer.....We shall see............

Reviews.Title: Many faults
Reviews.Author: Charles N. Hebert
Reviews.Content: The most glaring problem with this tablet is that it seldom will restart after "going to sleep."  It is hard to turn the thing off to recycle it.  I have two other tablets, both Samsung Galaxy 2 10.1, and they work beautifully.  I live in Panama and repairs are out of the question. I wouldn't pay $2.49 for another Asus Google Nexus tablet of any size.

Reviews.Title: expensive
Reviews.Author: Baozhu Yang
Reviews.Content: It is pretty good, while the price is down after I got it. I should wait for few days or look other stores.

Reviews.Title: dissatisfied by unfair refund policy
Reviews.Author: timobell
Reviews.Content: Ordered the Nexus 7 from Adorama through Amazon as a birthday gift for my wife. My wife did not even turn on the tablet because she said the 7-inch screen would be too small for her, so I called Adorama to try to exchange it for a 10-inch screen Nexus. Adorama says that since the order was placed through Amazon, they could not exchange it. Only option was to return the tablet and they would determine a "restocking fee" to charge me. Adorama could not even give a range of what the restocking fee would be. This has left me in a difficult situation with my wife who insists on getting a 10-inch screen because she has poor vision and needs a larger screen. I have ordered many items from Adorama in the past but will not order anything from Adorama again.

Reviews.Title: The worst product ever made!!!
Reviews.Author: Juan Diaz
Reviews.Content: - Nexus 7 will not turn on.... Hold down the Power button for a full 30 seconds: realy!!! OMG- Lag, reboots issues any time... is fustrating- Touchscreen is not responsive!!!!- Unvaluable piece of "#$%&is the worst buy in my life....the best way of wasting so much technology in one package...that's why Apple is Apple and other companies will copy onlyIf true, I lost $ 260 to $ 440 plus the mini ipad I have to buy nowNo one in my family wants this thing, even my 2 year old daughter

Reviews.Title: Thin
Reviews.Author: Paula A. Sillas "paulaspoochplace"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this when I ordered my other rugs ight stand but it the color matches really good to our bathroom

Reviews.Title: I'm very disappointed with this item
Reviews.Author: Leon Prepago
Reviews.Content: i bought this tablet, and from the moment  that I tried to turn it on it had some issue ... luckly one of my friend solved the problem by doing something to the battery , but even though it is working now  that doesn't mean that  I'm not mad about that. that's why i give you this bad grade.

Reviews.Title: Asus is Excellent, but you become Google's Captive
Reviews.Author: M. Degani "The Skeptic"
Reviews.Content: The product itself is very good, and I can say the same about all Asus products I have experienced so far.HOWEVER, THERE IS A CATCH.The catch is that you might, as well, renounce your Privacy for good. Because, by purchasing any Google product such as this one, you become a slave to Google's whims. You MUST open your whole life to their prying eyes and to whatever they do with your private information and with their knowledge of your private life.In case you have already made the mistake of buying an Android system, one thing I highly recommend is to never logon to your bank or broker or to whatever else you want to keep to yourself.As important, when you buy applications from their internet store, they have the power to control your usage of that application. Specifcally, I purchased Poweramp and then discovered that it doesn't work when I have no Internet connection (let's say I want to listen to my music when I am in the Mojave Desert). That way, they keep you tethered to them via the Internet at all times.My bottom line is that I will never again purchase anything from a company that has two g's and two o's in their name.

Reviews.Title: love my Nexus
Reviews.Author: kelliej
Reviews.Content: I've only had one time when my Nexus wouldn't turn on~hubby opened it..against the "rules"? but its perfect now, works great. I love it. 32 GB, nothing negative to say. Love that it doesn't require ITunes to  download any music, apps,etc. DISLIKE ITunes. Using Google was one of the major selling points for me.

Reviews.Title: Asus Nexus 7 - 2 stars
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: Its not what I thought it would be and it doesn't meet my expectations - is it possible to return it for something else

Reviews.Title: nnot for rookie
Reviews.Author: jerry yax
Reviews.Content: hard to figure out does not come ready to use will have to get tech just to set it up

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Mark Weiss
Reviews.Content: It is the second one we have bought and we love them because they are 14 the price of ipad and works just as well.

Reviews.Title: Hated it with a passion in the first 3 minutes
Reviews.Author: 150 F3
Reviews.Content: It doesn't respond to user input. When a user presses a finger directly on a web link, something should happen. Not nothing. Not shrinking the browser and sliding it to the right. No. Just loading the desired page the link is linked to. Nothing else. Simple web browsing activity. Not forcing the user to press and press and press more than 20 times with no results. The device is unusable.The bezel is huge. The screen is small. This is not desirable. I would prefer a large screen with room for displaying information.The keyboard feature is incredibly odd and difficult to use. Numbers and special characters are not visible, so the user must activate the other two keyboard modes. This is less usable than a standard PC keyboard. I saw no USB port for attaching a standard keyboard. I would hate to write on this device. It is not usable.I wished to log in to my flickr account. My password uses uppercase and lowercase letters. It uses numbers and symbols. It was quite difficult to enter the password with this device's hard to use keyboard. I prefer separate concave keys with permanent markings on them. Unlike flat screens, they offer physical feedback instead of nothing. I have never enjoyed touch screens, and this device confirmed my burning hatred of that weak, pathetic technology.I wished to view my flickr photostream as a slide show to test the screen's picture quality. It was impossible. The device did not support Adobe Flash. The device is completely useless for web browsing without Adobe Flash. I wanted pictures, not an error message and a link to download the Flash player that led to another error message. How can a 21st century web browsing device not support Flash? It is ubiquitous and essential. The device is truly useless.I thought Google Chrome had Flash built in. Evidently I was mistaken. The Android version of Chrome is different and far weaker than the Linux and Windows version. What is the purpose of this operating system, browser, and device? How does not supporting Flash help users wishing to view Flash content?I hate this device. It does not serve my simple needs. A 10 year old desktop PC is more than capable of easily accepting alphanumeric input efficiently, responding to input from pointing devices, and running Adobe Flash in a web browser. The Nexus 7 is garbage. I will avoid all ASUS and Google products from now on.

Reviews.Title: dissapointed :(
Reviews.Author: Yelena cuentas
Reviews.Content: My nexus won't start up, i don't use it, because when i open de box the nexus never turn on. i charge de batterie as the manual say, but don't start up. dissapointed :( .... the seller or amazon doesn't worried for my problem. i lost 271$ and no one take the responsability, or any answer

Reviews.Title: DEAD in 18 Days!!!
Reviews.Author: judd81
Reviews.Content: I have always considered ASUS one of the top hardware companies in the business, as that was one of my main reasons for purchasing this tablet. Worked fine from 11/27/12 until 12/16/12 when I tried to turn it on and nothing happened. I checked charger and it will charge other devices so the problem is not in the charger, the tablet just seems like it's completely dead and won't take a charge. $255 and didn't even last three weeks, I am very disappointed with this product ASUS put there name on. I waited a long while and did much research before deciding to purchase a tablet, tying to let all the kinks and bug out but evidently they still don't have it together, should have just went with an iPad. What really pisses me off is the tablet isn't even 30 days old and hasn't been turned on more than 15 or 20 times and now I HAVE TO PAY TO HAVE IT SHIPPED FOR A RMA...ASUS YOUR CUSTOMER SERVICE IS HORRIBLE! It was $19.86 to ship it back to you!! Last ASUS product I will ever purchase due to horrible hardware lifespan, having to pay shipping to have a practically brand new tablet I just bought repaired, the fact my son won't have his tablet on Xmas, and very poor customer service. I will make sure to tell everyone I am in college with and students I tutor IT for to never buy an ASUS product. It doesn't take but once for me and on to the next brand, esp considering all the trouble I went to to get it and now my son won't have his big Xmas present on Christmas morning because ASUS and Google are producing cheap tablets that aren't worth buying, especially if they're gonna be DOA or only last a few weeks.

Reviews.Title: 'Ted' is Awful
Reviews.Author: larry e smith
Reviews.Content: Prelude makes it appear to be a PG movie.  au contraire. Foul language consistent with people of limited vocabulary and values.

Reviews.Title: DEFECTIVE WIFI
Reviews.Author: m balie
Reviews.Content: We purchased this product on the google play store because amazon was out of stock. Big mistake. When it arrived the wifi was so week that it was not usable in our house. We compared with our iPad and signal was perfect. Also predictive writing is a disaster, it is very difficult to type an email. When I called to return it to google I was charged 15pct restocking even though the item simply does not work. I understand this if I just changed my mind and the packaging was open but certainly not for a defective item. Beware!

Reviews.Title: Hold off on your purchase
Reviews.Author: Ann Geiger
Reviews.Content: Hold off on purchasing this device if you plan to connect anything to it via Bluetooth.  Apparently the latest Android upgrade (4.2.1) has a bug that makes Bluetooth inoperable for at least some people.  I could, but not longer can, connect my keyboard, phone and earpiece.  Google technical support can only say they are aware of the problem and working on it.

Reviews.Title: if it fails, throw it away
Reviews.Author: richard warner
Reviews.Content: Great little tablet.  Fast graphics, long battery life.However...  This is an ASUS, which means less than perfect quality assurance and no repair capability.Which means if it breaks there is no way to get it fixed.If you get a working one you will like it, if you get a bad one throw it away and buy an Apple or some other brand than offers a real warranty.Update:ok, not a fair reviewThe product itself is very nice, recommend the skin to protect it.  One star lost because of the camera - for me a backside camera would make more sense than a front side.  Not being to shoot at least as well as a phone defeats the purpose.  It is possible to shoot "blind" with the front side camera, not fun, just possible.  People who Skype will love it I have heard from several including tech naive friends.

Reviews.Title: WARNING: It will break and be useless - don't buy this!!! Not worth $1.00
Reviews.Author: JRR
Reviews.Content: WARNING: Screen breaks after being dropped at almost any height, even when contained in padded casing.My experience: tablet was in a padded coat pocket which fell off a 1 1/2 foot counter onto a hard wood floor. The screen had "spider" cracks across it and was totally unusable. Asus quoted me $165.00 to fix this tablet, which originally cost $199.00. You cannot use this tablet AT ALL when the screen has been cracked - IT"S A 100% LEMON!!!The Nexus is great, until it breaks, and unless you live in a padded room and never raise this device above 1 foot off any surface, it will breakDON"T BUY DEFECTIVE PRODUCTS LIKE THIS! YOU WILL WASTE YOUR $$$Amazon should stop selling this tablet until Asus fixes this defective screenDO NOT BUY!!!

Reviews.Title: Sloppy
Reviews.Author: Pearl1213
Reviews.Content: I bought this device for my wife who hogs my iPad.  I read the reviews in Amazon, concentrating on the poor ones.  I just assumed the quality control problems noted in early reviews had been addressed and choose a five star vendor.Upon receipt of device, I immediately plugged it in to charge it up the battery overnight.  The next morning I turned it on and familiarized myself with screen layout, buttons and, of course, read the instruction booklet.  I uploaded a couple of thousand of JPGS that I knew my wife would want.  I set up a few apps she uses (Kindle, Facebook, etc) and logged on into her accounts.  At this point, all was happy with the world.After about four hours of use, she brought the device to me, saying it would not turn on.  Since she is technologically challenged, I ignored her, assuming it just needed charging up.  So I plugged it in for six hours but nada.  I checked to see if the outlet has power and it did.  So I plugged the device's USB end of the charger into my desktop computer - again nada.  Nor can I see the Nexus in Windows Explorer.  It is just dead.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing purchase
Reviews.Author: Zebull
Reviews.Content: I've owned the Nexus 7 for a couple months now and I wish I could return it.  It is defined by what it can't do rather than what it can.  You can: read books and play games on it, just like every other tablet out there.  You can't: play Flash files, play digital copies of movies you've purchased, use the GPS for anything useful except when you're connected to the internet.  (This last one is a particular sore spot, since the GPS was the reason I chose it over the Amazon Fire.  - it says you can download maps to "use" offline.  And you can download maps, but you can't use them for anything useful.  It's basically a picture of the map - no search, no directions, nothing)  What else can't you do with the Nexus 7?  You can't use it to watch Amazon Prime videos even though you're an Amazon Prime customer.  You can't use it as a universal remote.  You CAN play music, but the built in speakers remind me of a transistor radio, so playing Pandora on it while cleaning out the garage is a nostalgic trip back to the 70's.  It has neither deep nor rich sound.I've gone online and it seems like there's various workarounds for some of these issues.  And certainly other tablets have speaker issues.  And it's Jelly Beans fault about the Flash files, etc, etc.  In the end, this tablet simply doesn't do much.

Reviews.Title: this tablet is very irritating if you previously used an Apple product
Reviews.Author: R. Vorobieva
Reviews.Content: My husband got this one for me instead if mini IPad. I can't be more unhappier dealing with it for 2 months.What a user unfriendly and irritating thing! I thought at first - it was a just a learning curve,  but uneasiness of using it doesn't go away.I am buying my mini iPad this month.UpdateI got my mini IPad a month ago and am extremely happy with it.  As a working mom of two I have no desire to spend my energy on constantly figuring out the settings and weird features that I don't need.

Reviews.Title: Sorely Disappointed to Extremely Happy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Just received my Nexus 7 32g yesterday.  After being on the charger all night the battery was still not charged. Was able to start it up attached to the a/c adapter.  The tools did not reconized the battery and kept telling me to plug in the adapter even though it was plugged in. Gave it a few more hours on the charger and decided to check it.  System wouldn't start up, kept getting black screen with static nothing else.  I should have just saved my money or bought the Kindle Fire.  My friend has no problems with that.  Sorry Amazon, I'll never doubt you again.****Update****Received my replacement and now I understand what all the fuss was about. This thing is blazing fast. The clarity is awesome and best of all it charges. I will have to change my rating. Even though this started out as bad experience, the customer service and the new working product has more that made up for it. After using it for a week, I can honestly say that this exceeds most of my expectations. It does have a quirk that you might want to keep in mind. To use the built in camera, you will have to download an app from google play to find the app on Nexus. Yes, you read that correctly. There is no visible link to the camera app on the Nexus 7. This doesn't really bother me because I did not purchase it for the camera. So for me it is nothing more than a slight inconvenience.  The speaker quality is not that great but improves with the use of headphones.

Reviews.Title: Stop working on second day
Reviews.Author: vlad
Reviews.Content: Purchase Nexus 7 from Amazon. I had some problem to dounload Real Player and on the second day I can not switch it on. Big diapointment.

Reviews.Title: Battery cannot be recharged and I cannot start the device
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "beroez"
Reviews.Content: I agree with the review of Pearl1312, I have the same experience. Now I plan to return to Micro Center, unless there is some troubleshooting info in the manual. I am not some dummy consumer, I am a software engineer certified by Ibm, Oracle and Microsoft.

Reviews.Title: Dimensions are misleading
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: When I bought this, in the dimensions section it was listed as having a 10.1 inch screen. I hadn't done a lot of research on tablets before purchasing (it was a Christmas present for my husband, who just said he wanted the 10 inch Google tablet) so I didn't know that the number 7 in the title was referring to screen size. I sent it back and am still waiting for my refund (it's been 3 weeks).

Reviews.Title: A waste of money, nothing is free
Reviews.Author: M!!!
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 offering for entertainment is what I deem as a big joke.  All the so-called free items such as movies, magazines, TV shows, etc. that are supposed to be free is a lie.  Yes they have paid items but many so-called free items.  BUT! You have to give a credit card even to see free videos or magazines.  Why is this?  This is just short of fraud.  Frankly the tablet is useless for any entertainment value...Not when they want your CREDIT CARD to see FREE items.  The joke was on me.

Reviews.Title: not the best experience
Reviews.Author: B. Gause "Ace"
Reviews.Content: This is not 10.1 inches but 7 inchesthe Processor speed is 1.2Ghzalso it is 1gb of memory at DDR533 not 2gbI will return for refund seller ignored emails for cancelationI can get this 7" tablet for $199.99 with 32GB $169.00 with 16gb||||||||the technical details stated are incorect||||||||Screen Size 10.10 inchesProcessor 1.00 GHz  MOBILE AMD Duron  Bus: 200 MHz - 128 KB L2 CacheRAM 2.00 GBHard Drive 32.00 GBFROM NVIDIA: Key Innovations 4-PLUS-1(tm) Quad-Core with a 5th Battery Saver Core** - Four plus one refers to Tegra 3's four CPU cores, plus the fifth, battery-saver CPU core. This Variable SMP architecture enables four performance cores to be used for max burst, when needed, with each core independently and automatically enabled and disabled based on workload. The single battery-saver core (or companion core) handles low-power tasks like active standby, music, and video, and is transparent to the OS and applications. NVIDIA DirectTouch(tm) * - This is a patent-pending architecture that improves touch responsiveness and reduces power consumption by offloading a portion of the touch processing onto the Tegra 3 processor.3D Stereo Gaming* - This capability leverages the award-winning NVIDIA 3D Vision® technology to automatically, and in real-time, convert OpenGL based games and apps into Stereo 3D. NVIDIA PRISM Display Technology* - PRISM (or Pixel Rendering Intensity and Saturation Management) reduces a mobile device's backlight power while simultaneously enhancing the pixel color to deliver the same visual quality with substantially extended battery life.* Not available on all devices** Windows RT support still under developmentTegra 3 SpecificationsTegra 3 on AndroidProcessor CPUQuad-core, with 5th battery-saver coreQuad-coreMax FrequencyUp to 1.7 GHz single core /1.6 GHz quad-coreUp to single core 1.4 GHz /quad-core 1.3L2 Cache1 MB1 MBL1 Cache (I/D)(32KB / 32KB) per core(32KB / 32KB) per coreMemoryFrequencyDDR3-L 1500LPDDR2-1066DDR3-L 1500 LPDDR2-1066Memory SizeUp to 2 GBUp to 2 GBGPU ArchitectureULP GeForceULP NVIDIA3D Performance Relative to Tegra 2*Up to 3xn/aCores12123D StereoYesExpand Other Technical DetailsBrand Name AsusItem model number NEXUS7ASUS-Hardware Platform PCOperating System Windows XP Professional EditionItem Weight:  1.4 poundsProcessor Brand AMDProcessor Count 1Computer Memory Type SDRAMHard Drive Interface Serial ATASo the listing under Technical details is incorrect you will have to go to another site for correct specs although the Tegra 3 info on the CPU I listed is correctthanx for reading!

Reviews.Title: is it the new one? I cannot turn it on!!! give me an explanation ,please!!!!!
Reviews.Author: jocelyn
Reviews.Content: I am so happy to buy a new Nexus 7 on DEC 12, 2012. I receive it today and it is so sad!!!!!!I check the YouTube video which is related to how to turn on the Nexus 7 at the first time: I clicked the power key for seconds, a "Google" came to my eye. But it did not change to Welcome page and select the language, the Google stayed in the screen for even 3 hours!!!!What happened with this tablet I received????? Someone can tell me what happen for the Nexus 7. The shipping box does now have any destroy, so it is so weired!!!I want to return it. whatever it is the problem with seller or the problem with the ASUS, I want a friendly and patient answer!!!

Reviews.Title: Tablet problem
Reviews.Author: Briggs
Reviews.Content: I was surprise the tablet didn't  immediatelySetup a security pass in the startupProcedure.Due to this problem I lost this device because of thief.

Reviews.Title: technical details fiasco
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The details written as though they apply to this product are incorrect in many aspects. 10 inch display? Windows xp operating ststem? Tegra3 chip from Intel? Weighs more than a pound?Have all the editors been reassigned somewhere else? This is supposed to be a good product, but it is hopelessly misdescribed by amazon.

Reviews.Title: Skip the nexus 7 and pay a little more for the iPad Mini
Reviews.Author: Orangelifesaver
Reviews.Content: Its a decent device with very few apps that work on the nexus 7, the google play store has thousands of apps but very few of them work with this device. The web browser works well but honestly I regret buying this. I should have just paid a little more for the IPad Mini which is a much better device. I will probably just give this one away now to my little nieces and nephews.

Reviews.Title: Screen Size in Technical Summary WRONG! NOT 10" SCREEN!
Reviews.Author: Jess
Reviews.Content: I'm sure this is a good product so the 1 star rating doesn't necessary apply to the tablet as much as it does the advertising. My mother just ordered one of these tablets.  The Summary says the screen is 10.10 inches...IT IS NOT!  It's only a 7" screen which was verified by the seller.  Now, yes for technically savvy people, this may be obvious.  But, when someone who is not familiar with the market will look at the specifications as their primary guide in purchasing.  She also contacted Amazon about changing the specifications to reflect the accurate screen size.  Not sure how long it will take to change so hence my reason for reviewing.  Talk about a let down thinking she got a really good buy on a 10" tablet...
